"Yes please :)" 
He said he was really good, and I thought to myself, hey this place got 4.5 stars.  It CAN'T kill me.
.....And it didn't. In fact, it was AMAZING that we ate it until the plate was wiped clean.  The server even gave us extra baked bread for the beef tartare, on the house! I love when restaurants aren't stingy about that, and it was a good start and pleasant surprise for the night.

SCALLOP RISOTTO W/ LOBSTER SAUCE - (4.5/5) - this was delicious, and I loved how generous they were, giving 5 huge scallops for only $22! AND it was fantastic!! It was an interesting combo for scallops with the risotto and lobster sauce, the taste was rich and flavorful, but I would not eat the risotto by itself.  I always eat scallops whenever there is an option and though it still doesn't beat my favorite at Le Bernardin in NYC, these were still great and I was pleasantly pleased with this dish.  

My friend had the rack of lamb, which I had a bite, and we both agreed it was the best lamb we've ever had.  Again, great flavor. 

** BIRTHDAY STORY ** 

After we finished our food, my friend said he had to go to the bathroom, in which he secretly told the servers it was my birthday.  He came back where we talked for a bit, and all of a sudden, the lights of the whole restaurant went out.  Confused, I turned around and the servers held a plate with dessert and a candle and started singing happy birthday, along with everyone else in the restaurant!! I was so surprised!! After they finished singing, everyone clapped, turned the lights back on, and gave us 2 free glasses of dessert wine!  The host talked to me, shook my hand to wish me a happy birthday, and then gave me a Bistro Central Parc cup as a birthday gift! Omg, this restaurant goes above and beyond to make your birthday special!! The dessert was a delicious cream puff topped with almonds and it was fantastic.  This restaurant was fantastic, everything about it! 

Thank you Bistro Central Parc and Alan C for a delicious and special 25th birthday! :)
author: Raquel Y.

description: Great breakfast! Excellent service. Would definitely come back.  I had the crabcake benedict and my wife had the regular benedict. Both delicious.
author: Jonathon W.

description:
There's nothing French in this restaurant.
It's not because you're writing 2-3 words of French on your menus, that can make your restaurant a French one. 
I had the mussels. Well, I was surprised they didn't know how to prepare / clean mussels before cooking them. There was still filaments in each mussel. 

Anyway, wasn't that terrible, but I had better and this place is more Traditional American than French.

Allez, au revoir!
author: François A.

description: This place is cute.We were seated promptly and then ignored for twenty minutes.When I asked to see the manager the waiter replied "Oh she is not here ,she is always on vacation"lol.Needless to say we will never come back.
author: Manuel V.

description:
Once again, an awesome meal for my birthday celebration. The trout was amazing. Service ...over the top. Still my favorite restaurant in SF. 

I will return.
author: Rich F.

description:
Tip I wrote after I dined here:
So I've had to argue with our server thru our fatty lamb n mispriced wine. It's not a good sign when u point something out n ur server makes up excuses or keeps insisting that he's right. At least I got them to adhere to their listed wine price. N yes here's a pic of their wine list! How much is the margaux?! If u said $60 then u'd be arguing with the server too!

I just wrote a super long review that neither posted or saved so now I'm starting over which is actually adding to my dislike of this place. To sum it up, I came here to celebrate my dad's birthday. I grew up in a french restaurant and the menu here was very reminiscent of my dad's menu. I had reservations elsewhere, but since this restaurant had such great reviews I changed my reservation. I chose poorly!

The service when we got there at 6p was great. Friendly and attentive. But there were only about 2-3 other tables there so they weren't super busy at the time. The owner (I think) came by and said hello. One thing that bothered me was he picked up our bottle of wine on the opening of the bottle and complimented our selection. This to me was super unsanitary. Especially since he just walked into the restaurant! MINUS ONE STAR!

The apps were pretty good. A must order are the mussels! The were nice, juicy and not overcooked which is a pet peeve of mine. Who likes tiny shriveled rubbery mussels?! But these were just the opposite. And the sauce?! Soo good! My parents kept dipping their bread in the deliciousness!

So now comes time for our entrees and the restaurant is now packed! My dad ordered the rack of lamb which came with 2 pieces. Unfortunately half of those pieces were fat leaving my dad with only one piece of lamb. We brought this up to our server since my dad said this may be due to the fact that they are end cuts. But the server basically dismissed us saying that this was local lamb. So local lamb is fatty?! MINUS ONE STAR!

Time for dessert. I told them it was my dad's bday and we ordered the brulee. They were nice enough to turn down the lights and bring out the dessert with a candle while singing happy birthday.

In addition to dessert, I also ordered a port. I took a pic of it since I take pix of everything and saw that the glass was dirty. In the dim lighting I couldn't see anything, but thanks to my flash, the remnants of what looked like a towel were stuck to the glass. When wiping down glasses you wanna make sure you don't use one of those white kitchen towels since they leave residue on the glass. MINUS ONE STAR!

So now the nail in the coffin of this awful dining experience. The check! When we got it, it said the margaux was $80. I mentioned this to the waiter and he told us we were wrong. I told him I had a pic of the wine list on my phone and he stormed off. He came back with the wine list and said it was a misprint. Well, shouldn't a restaurant honor their listed prices?! After some arguing, he honored the listed price of $60, but not without some arm twisting. MINUS ONE STAR!

I probably would have given this place 3-4 stars if it wasn't for everything that happened. I know our server was slammed but even so you still have to remember that part of your job is customer service. I've been to a lot of restaurants, but I've never been treated with such disrespect. Even in france our waiters were nicer!
author: Elena N.

description: Very cool place that is hidden in the middle of a residential neighborhood in the panhandle. The food, the service and the ambience were on point. We will definitely be back.
author: Leo S.

description:
Great place hidden in a quiet area along the GG park panhandle. Very french, very good, love it (full disclosure, I am French too:).

Always liked what I had there in a few dinners. 

Good service, except once and this was not a french waiter surpringly ! ;D
author: Laurent C.

description:
5/5 stars overall

Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Ambiance: 4/5

We came here on a Saturday night for an early dinner (around 5pm) without reservations, and we were directed outside in the tented area. Although I rather be inside, it was nice for them to accommodate us.

I was blown away by this dish: Filet Mignon with Foie Gras and Black Truffle!! WOW!!! Must order!! The Filet Mignon was SOOO soft! The Foie Gras paired nicely with the filet mignon! Plus..you can't go wrong with truffle...! If you only order one thing here, definitely order the Filet Mignon!

Ordered:
1) Filet Mignon with Foie Gras and Black Truffle: 6/5
2) Baked Brie w/ roasted garlic, crostini: 4.5/5 YUM!!! (love the baked Brie and roasted Garlic)
3) Scallop risotto in lobster sauce: 4/5 Good, but nothing out of the ordinary
4) Frissee with bacon and crouton, with poached egg: 3.5/5 good, but I would skip this salad
5)


Overall, for a French restaurant, the price here is fair and you definitely get what you pay for!
author: Jen H.

description: I've consistently had very good to great experiences eating dinner here the 6-8 times I've gone. Excellent food and friendly professional service. Been there for brunch twice and the last time the service totally bombed, with our waiter forgetting to submit our order and somehow not noticing that no food was coming out to our table for over half an hour even though it was not busy and he was standing nearby the entire time he wasn't serving tables. OK to make a mistake but he didn't apologize or comp anything. Service was impeccable when Jacque owned the restaurant - hopefully those standards have not dropped with new ownership.
author: Mike S.

description:
Charming restaurant, perfect service, delicious food!  We had a little glitch during the meal that could have turned out bad, sounds intriguing doesn't it, but the manager remedied the situation with panache and comped our whole table with a snifter each of a most delicious after dinner pick me upper!
Will definitely return!
author: Keeping It Real K.

description:
The Eggs Benedict we had for brunch was fine - a nicely done but small portion. However, we each "substituted" Pommes Frites but when the check came we had each been charged extra. The menu is misleading in that it doesn't state the price for a "substitute". When we complained, our server politely told us that substitute means extra. When we pressed the issue she was able to correct the check.
This is an expensive restaurant for brunch with a relatively small menu. There are plenty of other choices for an expensive brunch, and I would recommend trying a different restaurant.
author: Chris W.

description:
I am so happy yelpers led me to this place. For value and taste, I give this place 5 stars. The wait for the food to come out was really long, but I was in no rush and bought good company. There's seating outside for people watching and plenty of street parking. 

MUSSELS: 4 stars, only because I feel like this dish wasn't as unique as the others. Tasty, but I could probably get this elsewhere. 

DUCK CONFIT: 5 stars; duck thigh/drumstick with sides of lentils. Not my preferred way to prepare duck but if you like duck confit then this is as good as it gets. 

RISOTTO WITH SCALLOPS in lobster bisque: 5+++ stars. Everything from the presentation and taste was spot on! I got 5 perfectly cooked scallops. This was for sure was the best dish. 

RATATOUILLE: 5 stars. It's a tasty-healthy side dish. Chopped veggies in a tomato sauce. 

ONION SOUP: 5 stars. Simple but packed with flavor!
author: Logan N.

description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants, and is a great date spot.  The french onion soup is delicious, I love the mussels, and the salmon tartar appetizer with gravlax and salmon roe is one of my favorites, and everyone that works there is really sweet. I brought my parents here when they were visiting from out of town and they were really impressed. I haven't been for brunch yet but hopefully will check it out soon!
author: Emily S.

description: Outstanding French cuisine, great service and beautifully designed interior. The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is the acoustics were poor, making it super loud when full. Was much better when the restaurant started to clear out. Also, the back area and bathroom could use a bit of sprucing up - seemed a bit worn around the edges. Overall, an enjoyable experience.
author: Scott L.

description:
Amazing, amazing, ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!
Fois Gras Filet. Duck confit salad with goat cheese and raspberries.  Pig ear salad.  Pistachio crusted Halibut. Chocolate dessert that melts in front of your eyes. 
IF you are one of those people who believe that good food and great service should be worth every penny you spend, you will NOT be disappointed here.  It's not fancy,  but not casual either.  Dress up.  It's worth it.  
Suggestion. Ask Jerome to order for you.  YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED! !!!! 
24 hours later and we are still remenising how fantastic the food was! Mmmmmmm
author: Grace Y.

description:
Bistro Central Parc is, for us, absolutely perfect and lovely. We've now have had two celebration dinners there and both were memorable and special in every way. A 21st birthday for our son and recently Mothers Day. The space itself is so intimate and warm and that it's nestled into a quite neighborhood makes one feel as though you've been transported to Paris! The staff is welcoming and cheerful, warm and professional. Absolutely wonderful. We have been so lucky to have had Sebastian as our server on both occasions and I must say that his ebullient nature and superb knowledge of the entire menu makes the experience at Bistro Central Parc all the more fabulous. HE is fabulous!!! Thanks Sebastian!!
The Bistro is the kind of place one can wander into spontaneously (several places at the counter to dine) or, as we did, celebrate a special occasion. It's  relaxed but very professional and hits an amazing balance between the two. The food is fresh and lively with nods to the classical and the contemporary. We've never had a bite that was anything less than delicious and the kitchen should be justifiably proud of their excellent work. Absolutely top notch!! Wonderful wine list, by the way. Sebastian is excellent at choosing excellent parings so you might just leave it up to him!!
Thanks, Bistro  Central Parc, for being there and we look forward to many more delightful and delicious visits!!
author: Rob W.

description:
With 4.5 stars, Bistro Central parc is underrated.  This is a hidden gem, and I'm conflicted if I want to write a review because I want to keep it to myself.  

-Tuna Tartare is 4 start
-Escargot 4 start, it was great that it wasn't overtaken by garlic as escargot frequently is
-Special Rabbit - 5 stars AMAZING 
-Fillet Mignon with Foie Gras - 5 stars AMAZING
-Risotto with lobster sauce and scallops - 4.5 stars

The service is excellent and its nice an quite as opposed to other overcrowded San Francisco destinations.
author: Victoria F.

description:
Came here for dinner the night before Valentine's day and the setting is so intimate -- Great place for authentic French food that actually fills you up. 

We ordered:
French onion soup: Loved the cheese on top of this but other than that, wasn't as amazing as the other dishes we had. 
Wild mushroom risotto: The truffle oil and the mushrooms made this one of the best risottos I've had. So flavorful!

Half roasted chicken - Came with mushrooms and potatoes and the sauce they use was so good I low-key wanted to lick the plate. It's like a smokey, rich taste that was so good with everything else on the plate.
Bouillabaisse - Something like a French seafood stew except the stew is more like a sauce, but regardless, this was super flavorful and all the bits of seafood were so tender. It's a really fishy taste that I wasn't expecting but after awhile it really grew on me. They give you a generous amount of seafood (scallops, mussels, salmon) and a little fork and bucket for your mussels. I think I would have liked more potatoes, I like my carbs haha.

Unfortunately neither me nor my boyfriend can eat red meat, and seeing all the steaks coming out of the kitchen was heartbreaking... next time!
author: Jingxi Z.

description: Small neighborhood French restaurant. We were there for breakfast and had wonderful experience.  We had French toast and eggs Benedict with salmon. Also order of French fries. The eggs were perfectly cooked so that yolk is melting. French toast with real maple syrup was delicious. Excellent fries. No experience for dinner service but my inclination is dinner will be great too.
author: Charles P.

description: I love this little neighbourhood gem. I've been for brunch and dinner several times and the food is always amazingly delicious and the service is always on point. It's a very pretty interior with a nice closed in outdoor patio for sunny days. They are always super accommodating and I've always left with a full belly and a smile!
author: Kiley R.

description:
What we ordered:
Duck confit salad
Mussels
Trio salmon  tartare
Foie gras torchon 
Beef cheeks 
Lobster risotto with scallops 

Him: hands down one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Tucked away in panhandle, this restaurant is one of the best kept secret in SF.

Her: Must get beef cheeks. Skip the foie gras torchon. Everything else is good, just up to preference.
author: Dennis J.

description:
The beef tartar here was disappointing at best, despite the ostentatious display. Coupled with unimaginably slow service, the restaurant delivered nothing short of a bewildering spectacle of blandness. The only thing that could have made the experience thus far worse was the frighteningly pedestrian wine selection. 

The redeeming factor came with the main course. While my medium steak veered disturbingly close to the well done side, it was still edible, and at times, enjoyable, albeit dry. The risotto was also acceptable. Nothing unique here, but presenting an edible dish deserves an accolade in itself.
author: Shenglong G.

description:
This is a great neighborhood restaurant but we got just terrible service on Christmas Eve.  Kept us waiting 45 minutes with a reservation- put us at the heated outdoor tables ( 42 degrees and wind blowing )

After we were finally seated next to he door another 20 minutes before we were waited on.

Did I mention we had our 95 year old (sprightly) mother with us.

They comped us one glass of wine - kind of Scrooge like :-(


My advice

AVOID THIS PLACE AT THE HOLIDAYS- they can't handle the crowds

Any other time - it is a really wonderful choice.
author: Thomas T.

description: Excellent food--our second time there. It's a bit noisy, so otherwise I'd give it 5 stars. But maybe you like the noise?
author: Dee S.

description:
What's with the overhyped French restaurants in SF? Bistro Central Parc is nice because I was able to easily make a reservation for a group on Saturday. The food, however, was mostly mediocre. 

* Steak Frites: I've had much better steak frites elsewhere. Mon Ami Gabi is great, L'ardoise... A good steak frites hinges upon good quality meat, and I think that was what was missing here.

* Mussels: The mussels were alright, but again I've had much better mussels elsewhere. By value and flavor, La Trappe trumps Bistro Central Parc 5 times over. For brunch, I've had wonderful mussels at Baker Street Bistro.

* Croque Monsieur: This croque monseur was pretty good, better than Baker Street or Chez Papa, because they were not too heavy handed with the bechamel sauce.

Tempted to give 2 stars because there were about 10 fruit flies that were circling the table.
author: Jess C.

description:
The Bf and I have tried this place for brunch several times now and have not been disappointed.

Each time we've ordered their mussels and fries and they are delicious! The fries are cooked to perfection and the sauce for the mussels is fantastic! The serving (at least on the last occasion) is a bit small though 

On the last outing I tried their eggs Benedict and I can't complain, I thought it was pretty good but nothing spectacular. What I loved most was the side salad that came with it. The dressing they put on it is amazing. So glad I ditched the side potatoes and got more salad.

The bf got the scallops and risotto with lobster sauce. SO YUMMY! I'm typically pretty good about trying a bite of his food and then leaving the rest for him... With this dish I kept trying to sneak a bite (he was kind enough to pretend not to notice). It was delish, will have to go and order my own
author: Pauline T.

description:
Visited this little gem many times when I still lived in the Bay. One of my favorite French restaurants in SF. I love the scallop risotto! Must get!! Superrrr flavorful, cooked just right, I always get this no matter what haha. Doesn't look very big, but very filling (4 large scallops!) Foods here tend to be pretty heavy, but that's how French food usually is. Tried the mussels and bouillabaisse before, but still think scallop risotto stands way out.

Service is super friendly. Presentation is great. Reasonably priced. Make reservations since it's pretty small. Tucked away in a residential area, parking is pretty difficult.

Bottom-line: Top-notch no frill French food!! Super delicious scallop risotto, make a reservation and go!! :)
author: Grace H.

description:
I've been to Bistro Central Parc a few times and each time has been a good experience. This is a good spot to chill with a small group of friends or a good date night spot. The place itself is nice inside with a few tables, a bar (wine&beer), and an outdoor seating area. They also serve brunch but I have yet to try it. The highlights from the dinner menu for me are:

French onion soup
Bone marrow (when its available)
Rack of lamb - oh so good
Scallop risotto
Beignets
author: Mike P.

description: Came here on another date night before seeing a show in the city. The service was excellent, and food delicious. We especially enjoyed the salmon tar tar that we got as an appetizer! It was amazing! Our entrees, filet with foie gras, and duck breast were both so good, we split them bit for bite! Too bad we were running late to see Wicked and had to skip dessert because that looked amazing too!
author: Hila P.

description: Traveling in SF alone for a work conference and needing to pass a rainy day I found Bistro Central Parc while searching Yelp for a brunch spot near Golden Gate Park. I'm so glad I came here! The food was fantastic and the staff was so hospitable to a solo diner, Emily was so warm and friendly, she really made me feel like a local neighborhood regular. The warmth of this place is something I'll never forget - it was the bright spot of my rainy day. Delicious coffee and decadent French toast were just the cherry on top of the rest of my experience here. Thank you Emily!!
author: Chelsea S.

description:
Service is great but food is okay. The dessert was pretty interesting. I had the strawberry with the strawberry purée and vanilla ice cream and there's black pepper underneath. It's really interesting when you mix everything together. 
The grilled scallop risotto with lobster sauce is pretty good, but a bit heavy (too cheesy). The beef tartar is not bad. MUST try the duck confit salad; very good and tender. The seafood cioppino is okay; too watery.
author: Cindy W.

description:
We went there for a birthday dinner. It was amazing. Food was absolutely great, Charcuterie , foie gras, duck. Deserts were awesome as well.
As a French person I can say that Bistro Central Park is truly authentic. The staff is French too, which is a really good sign, and all were very friendly. We strongly recommend this place for any occasion!
author: Florent L.

description:
This place has been on my bookmark for so long, finally came for a leisure Saturday late lunch! 

We ordered scallop risotto, croquet Madame   Et ratatouille. Scallops were perfectly seared, creamy risotto served with lobster saw totally blend the flavors all together! 

Madame sandwich is flawless! Cheese top and buttery toast give every bite a hint of sweetness.

Ratatouille, okay have to say as a big fan of this humble french peasant yet homey dish, this is the best I have ever had so far! Flavors were really infused into the vegetables, yet veggies didn't completely loose the texture! Great balance of sweetness, sourness and savory. 

Service, a really friendly and considerate lady prepared our table, when she said Bon appétit,I know she really mean it and she has confidence in her food!!!!!

As I replied on the receipt " will come back!"
author: Yann M.

description:
A truly enjoyable experience was had tonight. The reception was pleasant, the service - excellent, the food - robust in taste, and the prices - reasonable.

Our lineup goes as follows:

Appetizers:
- Mushroom risotto (small form like rice-cake size; tasty, but leaves you wanting more)
- Baked brie (with tomatoes and slices of toasted bread; like bruschetta with brie)

Entrées:
- Seabass (light and tasty over au gratin cauliflower)
- Cow cheek (like tender hamburger with a slightly different flavor)

Dessert:
- Almond tart (like an almond version of pecan pie)
- Chocolate mouse (over a pastry shell with strawberry slices; creamy, light and airy)

The maître d' and servers were French and were friendly and personable people. It added much to the evening. We would easily return.
author: Adam F.

description:
Serious serious food poisoning tonight from dinner.  I should have read the recent reviews about change of ownership and increase in pricing. They are charging so much more than other French restaurants for basic dishes. I would avoid and go elsewhere. 
Anyways, avoid the mussels. No bueno and my expensive dinner is now, well, you know where.
author: Jean G.

description: Love this place! The staff and owner are so welcoming and remember you every time you come back. Food is awesome, and if you can grab a seat at the bar you get to enjoy a view of the hard working Chef, Brad and his team. If you live in the neighborhood, you are lucky, but it is also a destination spot.
author: Michael B.

description:
One of the best restaurants I been to! Not only is the food hella good but the service is absolutely the best! 

1.) We made reservations at 730 and was running late, didn't get there until 8 and they were still cool with it. 
2.) the owner let us use his parking garage space bc we couldn't find parking
3.) free bday gift for my friend
4.) did a nice bday surprise for all the bday ppl in the restaurant
5.) help us take hella photos(until we finally got the one we are satisfied with)
6.) food was amazing 
7.) everyone was super friendly and funny 
8.) guided and helped my friend out with the parking(he went outside in the cold haha) 

Made a yelp account just to leave a review and this is my very first review bc they deserve it! (: 

Everything was just too perfect. Hope I didn't leave anything out! But will definitely come back and recommend this place to anyone!
author: Myra L.

description: If you're looking for a great getaway from the usual suspects, head over to this French restaurant hidden in plain sight. This French bistro is an amazing night out. Join other foodies into a most flavorful evening of libations paired with one of the best French food in San Francisco. The staff here at Central Parc are a wonderful addition to reminding us of what's it's like to eat and be merry. Gracious and caring, the waiters, cooks, and host will definitely leave you with a smile and of course, a happy belly. Viva La France. Viva Bistro Central Parc!
author: Zee R.

description:
Went here for Valentine's Day as we were craving French food.

Ambiance: 5/5
Cute little corner location. The decor and atmosphere transported me back to Lyon.

Food: 5/5
I ordered the warm spinach salad with bacon and a poached egg and curried mussels with fries. My favorite was actually the fries, I'd love to know what their secret is to maintaining such a crispy-on-the-outside-yet-soft-on-the-inside consistency. My girlfriend ordered the French onion soup (OMG the cheese) and veggie ratatouille, which was creamy and delicious.

Service: 5/5
Very attentive, pretty fast for a French restaurant. Accommodated us well.
author: Max H.

description:
This place was so VERY dissapointing!! 

NOPA was too busy for my birthday brunch so I suggested the cute little bistro about a block from my new apartment. I'm thinking: Sunday brunch, close by, neighborhood French style - sounds perfect right? BAD IDEA. 

Party of two, there were several open tables with no line out the door or waiting list and the waitress (no hostess) seemed entirely put out by our presence. Fair enough, I waited tables for years when I was younger and maybe they were recovering from a morning slam. Out of 10 possible- SEATING SCORE: 3

In about 5 mins we get menus and water dropped by another server with still no greeting. Then we waited 10 more to get our drink order taken. I enthusiastically tell this second server that it's my birthday (he doesn't acknowledge this in any way) and we order a Bellini and a Kir Royale. The server says nothing other than, "Are you ready to order food?" He seems impatient but I explain we need a minute. ORDERING SCORE: 2

10 minutes later we flag down another server and ask about how our drinks are coming along (two ingredient drinks strait out of bottles, still empty tables around us and no wait.) In 5 mins she finally brings them. We proceed to order a regular and a salmon Benedict + a half order of French toast with no modifications. Over the next 45 mins our glasses run empty and when we have to walk up to the bar to order new ones because no one has checked on us) after we order new drinks and the wrong ones are bought we are given lots of attitude. At this point it's still my birthday brunch so I try to keep smiling but it's getting a bit unbelievable. SERVICE SCORE: 1

Recap: 30 mins for a Kir Royale.
1.5 hours for an average tasting Benedict 
1.75 hours for the first person to ask if everything was OK (by that point we just wanted to leave.)

I was told the place is under new management so perhaps that is the reason for it's decline.

I've served in and managed several restaurants. I love food, I love people and I love my life. As much as I would like to find a silver lining, this place was TERRIBLE. I won't be back even though it's across the street from my house.
author: Alex W.

description: My husband and I had a wonderful dinner here last night. The service was superb, and the food absolutely divine. We will be back soon!
author: Rose D.

description:
Words cannot explain how great the food is at Bistro Central Parc. I enjoyed every single bite and the service was out of this world too. My bf and I started with Dungeness  crab cakes and french onion soup. It is honestly the best onion soup I've had (and I've eaten plenty). The crab cakes were so fresh and decadent. THey had a bit of a kick with pepper and the accompanying sauce was great too.For the main course, I ordered the risotto with scallops and lobster sauce. Again, impossible to explain how amazing it was. It was first time trying risotto and now I'm so addicted. 
My bf ordered the filet mignon. I tried a piece and it was so tender and flavorful.

For dessert I ordered the volcan au chocolate which is a brownie with a nut glaze, filled with oozing melted chocolate and a dollop of vanilla ice cream. I could have sworn I heard angels sing. I was making somewhat disturbing faces because I was in such heaven. My bf had the creme brule and he loved it. I tried a piece and it was amazing. Pure heaven.

Best meal I've ever had! Will so be back.
author: Wanda M.

description:
Totally 5-stars and 100th-review worthy!  It was taking me a while to find a restaurant that deserved both honors, but luckily, I was taken here for a romantic dinner a couple of weeks ago.  

The escargots we got for an appetizer were served soaking in their own individual garlic butter bath, which translated to very buttery escargots.  Yum!  Despite the richness of our appetizer, we still managed to make room for our entrees.

I got the popular scallops with risotto in a lobster sauce, where each bite led to its own foodgasm.  Ah, fond memories.  I also got to try my date's cherry-glazed pork belly with wild mushrooms and a sweet potato puree.  Being that the pork belly was a special, I'm not sure how often this shows up on the menu, but I highly recommend it if you want deliciousness without the embarrassment of foodgasming in public.  *blush* 

Gentlemen, if you're looking for a place to take your special lady and score a couple of bonus points, take her to Bistro Central Parc.  The food high she leaves with will feel a lot like that other warm, fuzzy feeling.
author: Nancy C.

description: Was there Saturday for brunch. Food was excellent, service was phenomenal, super busy, great crowd...love the lights. Ordered the croque madame & the mussels, will definitely be back.
author: Michaela F.

description:
Met some friends here for Sunday brunch. We actually had a reservation and were seated immediately, 5 adults and a child. They gave her a toddler seat.

Food was good, I had the Croque Madame which is a grilled ham and cheese sandwich, French style, with a fried egg on top. It was a very generous portion and I was already full by the time I finish 3/4 of it. Other friends got decent looking omelettes. I found the service to be friendly and prompt and the coffee was excellent.

Will return for dinner.
author: Jordan C.

description: Recommend artichoke salad, mussels, and tournedos Rossini!!! The food is delicious, yummy yummy yummy...The waiters are very polite and professional.
author: Jiao W.

description: My second attempt to this cute place within two weeks. Everything was just perfect!! Food, price, service... I especially loved their duck Breast and filet mignon with seared foie gras. You can never go wrong to this place.
author: Mandy W.

description: Bistro Parc Central is always so excellent! I've been there several times. I'm always so happy with the food and experience. No matter how busy they are, they are always on top of their game. I've been a server and I'm so impressed! I always order the steak frites. I can't help it because it's so good. I love the wine selection too. My brother, who is vegetarian, had the vegetable risotto, and loved it. My boyfriend has also had the fish special and loved it. We had the tuna tartar special as an appetizer and it was delicious. They also let us make a last minute reservation on new years eve. It was much appreciated! I can't wait to go back!
author: Gina R.

description:
There was plenty of space at the bar on a Saturday night -- score!! Our waiter was unapologetically French... sarcastic, funny, well-informed.. and was actually pretty nice about how long it took for us to decide.

Warm spinach salad special was out of this world... just perfect in every way. We had the beef tartare, which was a huge portion btw, and it was actually TOO flavorful for me if that makes any sense? Like the herbs was just a bit too much. I gave in and boyf allowed me to order a side of fries, which again there was a lot of... kinda just normal fries but done really well, perhaps in duck fat? Then we had the bouillabaisse which was beautiful. We were completely stuffed after all this, but we were enticed by the seasonal dessert -- warm strawberry compote with ice cream and this little almond tuile? SO GOOD.

Anyway, we ordered too much and could have done without the tartare I think. I was surprised how big the servings were. This place is great for really solid bistro food and a pretty casual atmosphere.
author: Vivian H.

description:
price good!
foie gras a lil too charred
beef tartare was fave of the night
filet, onion soup, escargot, charcuterie, coulda been better
3.5 for food
service was great so bumping to 4 stars!

GF says it smells like french in there, not sure what that means.
author: Phuc B.

description:
You know when you go to a restaurant and it is just one fail after the other to the point of giving up? Well that is exactly what happened at Bistro Central Parc tonight. My father is in town and being the avid restaurant goers who prefers to spend their money on fine foods rather than fine...well..much of anything else, we opted to go here. Actually I picked the place because I am in love with magret canard (duck breast). So much so that I seek out restaurants who serve this and will take a duck confit as a back up. Which brings us here and to my review. 

1) The initial: We had reservations at 7pm on a Sunday. We cam in around 6:55pm and waited at the front door. There was a server walking around, but no hostess. Actually we wait about min or so until someone came over. Now this may not be weird in a Denny's, but at a 3 star restaurant, we expect to at least be told "someone will be right with you". 

2) There seating: We were given options, so that was nice. Unfortunately we had to wait another 5 min or so before we were asked about water. I saw one female waiter, a male and a bus boy (perhaps) who was working the tables. Finally, water. 

3) Taking our order: When the server (Alex) came to take our order, I asked about to of the french white wine bottles on the menu. I asked "could you tell me about these two?" To which he replied "They are chardonnays" I said, "Yes, can you tell me about them?" He points and says, "This one is more round". I give up and and finally just choose one of the two wines assuming he may not have known about the wine he was serving. After all they did run out of white wine glasses and ended up serving us in a red wine glass I know they don't have Riedel, but please don't try and convince me that this will taste better. The bottle was good though and only $46! 

4) The service: Alex was very off and then on. At points I thought it was almost to the unfriendly style wait staff but then he would walk by and check to make sure I was okay. Overall I think he was just busy. 

5) The meal: Uh oh! The restaurant did not put "bacon" under their duck breast dish nor did they seem to teach their servers to tell us! BIG NO NO for someone who doesn't eat pork and ended up with a big old piece of bacon in her mouth. When I told the server he said that there was bacon in the potatoes. When I explained nicely (yes I was in customer service so I try and make a point without being a jackass)  that this was not on the menu and that I had just put this in my mouth, not a single sorry came out of his mouth! I know it is not your fault personally but shocked! Apologize for the restaurant since obviously this was not okay at all! The took it back and as a woman (manager?) walked by I explained how it would be very helpful to put that on the menu since many people have pork as a dietary restriction. She apologized and as my father and husband ate, I waited for my meal. 

6)  The meal part two: They were kind enough to re-do the whole meal, but here is where the "giving up" part comes in. The meal came back and the duck was so raw I did say something, but I said it was fine since my dinner party was almost done with their meal and I really just wanted to eat. I will take the blame for that part because I kept the meal as is and ended up throwing over half away. What a waste of $23! 

7) The end: They did not offer dessert or anything on our meal which shocked me based on the circumstances. This is a very diverse city with a LOT of different religions, dietary restrictions and personal beliefs that will affect their food choices. To not mention one of the most avoided meats by so many people (pork) and then to not really show much care that the incident happened shows a poor taste in customer service (and yes, I worked in customer service for MANY years which is why I treat staff very nicely, but I also want to be, well, eat a good meal without worrying! 

We have been here before, but I am not sure if we will go back. I have received better service/ care (which is a main part of dining experience for me) at one $ sign restaurants. And for anyone who wants to say "they were just being French" stop the stereotypes since we have traveled there. 

I think if they would have cared a little more about what happened, and made the food a second time around as good as they did the first. it would have made the experience a whole lot better. 

le sigh...
author: Kat M.

description:
Love this quant little French restaurant!

We've been trying to find a restaurant we can call our own. This wonderful little gem is just adorable and has the perfect level of intimacy. Just a great place for a good meal with good people and good conversation. 

Service was friendly, funny, and quick. Everything on the menu looked good so it was hard for us to choose.

The mushroom soup was creamy but not heavy. French onion soup was very good. We were expecting the mushroom risotto to be heavy and thick but it was surprisingly light. Sweetbreads had the perfect texture and the sauce with the drops of honey was good too.

We both had the Rossini (filet mignon with foie gras) and that was just pure heaven. SO good. My steak was bigger than my fiancé's and cooked perfectly rare.

Some of the dishes needed a bit of salt and the dessert was a let down but only because it had caramel (yuck).

Solid French restaurant. We will be back!
author: T L.

description: Just need to update my review since the change in ownership.  The food is still decent and the service is standard but it is not the neighborhood gem it once was.  I do not feel that my children are welcome as they were when Jacques and Claude ran the show.  Claude always told me to nurse my child more (while serving me organic beer with my moules to keep the supply flowing).  i miss her, the Alsatian Maitre D, and the friendly, local family vibe of days past.  We barely ever come here anymore, because I get a strong vibe that they would rather not serve my kiddos.  I don't love that.  And the new owner seems a bit chilly.  Bummer.
author: Julia K.

description:
Absolutely loved this restaurant.  Was promptly seated in a quiet area on the outdoor patio.  It was warm because the patio was enclosed and they turned the heaters on.  Our food was brought out within a reasonable time frame, and it was absolutely delicious.  Honestly, it wasn't extremely expensive, as we got a shrimp appetizer, 2 entrees (filet mignon and chicken dinner), dessert, and my client got a glass of wine. All to come out to $108.  The presentation was also very well put together.

The waitress was incredibly nice, helpful, attentive, but not overbearing.  

I will definitely bring my clients back here.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Amazing food. Good company. Incredible chef. Brad greeted my friends and I when we sat down at table. He was clearly very busy as every seat in the house was filled. However, from the minute I called in reservation (open table wasn't functioning), my experience was off to a great start; they balance customer experience and business expedience well. 

The space is tight, so my claustrophobia had to be managed. Otherwise, however, the entire experience worked:

We sat down to begin our multiple courses with delicious appetizers. The waiter paired wine throughout the dinner adeptly--all of us had different pallets and were given individualized recommendations. 

We enjoyed great cheeses and salads to start as well as some exceptional beef tartare. I ordered the filet and I was so pleased to have received a surprise serving of foie gras to top it off.

We finished with a few incredible desserts.

Bottom line: if you like a sexy pirate-looking, Argentinian waiter, go to Bistro. If you enjoy a value for your dollar, go here.--my steak was delectable and perfectly cooked to suit me. If you like a chef who personally offers a welcome and food selection insights, go to Bistro. I could find no fault.
author: Philip C.

description:
Coming in for a family dinner several nights ago, we found ourselves having to wait almost 20 or 30 minutes past the time of our reservation, until they finally kicked out (or, politely asked, rather) another party who had been sitting there long after their meal, just talking. Moving past that, we ordered the:

* Ribeye Tartare - Gorgeous presentation aside, this was a pretty tasty appetizer to start with, but not as spectacular as some other tartares I've had, with more unique flavors or complexities.

* Lobster & Scallop Risotto - Perfectly cooked scallops with good flavor, over a bed of tasty risotto.

* Seafood Paella - Not really traditional paella, but had good flavors, and the kick was quite enjoyable as well.

All in all, tasty food, albeit not particularly unique or memorable. I'm a little torn in how to rate Bistro Central Parc, but will opt for a low 4 stars rather than a high 3 stars: in other words, I can see myself coming back here again, but it's unlikely to be among my top choices.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - With tables arranged as closely as they are here, maneuvering through the restaurant and getting seated may pose some difficulties, but all in all, was not terrible.

Bathroom - Didn't try, so no comment.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Came here to bid adieu to foie gras with their trio of foie appetizer. That pretty much did the trick. In addition to classic foie gras and seared foie gras, it also included a foie gras macaron (the best part)! It was sweet and had just the hint of foie in it. I liked that both the brioche and the bread were served nice and warm. Always a nice touch :) 

Thoughts on other dishes - 
~ Mussels: a bit dry on the top; not thoroughly soaked in the soup. The fries were great though. This seems more suited for a belgian restaurant though. Check out Frjtz for legit mussels and fries!!
~ Duck: tender and yummy!
~ Veggie risotto: was this risotto or just white rice? I couldn't really tell. It was basically red peppers stacked on top of a round cylinder of tightly packed, bland white rice.  I'd give this dish 2 stars. Other yelpers seem to like the scallop/lobster risotto though.
~ Apple tart: more like poached apples piled on top of a tart-like crust. OK only...


My only other qualm was the waiter didn't really provide us with enough attention. We had to call him over to see the dessert menu or to get drink refills. It could be that they weren't used to the crowd that night all clamoring for their fill of foie gras. 

The prices were quite reasonable for an upscale, intimate french restaurant, and the menu has a good variety of interesting French dishes. Worth it!!
author: Audrey L.

description:
I don't toss out 5-star ratings too often, but Bistro Central Parc really deserves it! It was only my time at this restaurant, but whenever I return to the City (which isn't too often), this place will be at the top of my list.

For starters, we shared three appetizers (the pate, the escargots and the baked brie), all of which were delicious. The pate plate included three types of pate along with some crispy breads to enhance the flavors. The baked brie included a hunk of roasted garlic from which you could extract the cloves. Finally, the escargot was...well...just what escargots should be!

We all tried different entrees, and our tummies were delighted with the choices. The lamb shank (that day's special) was fall-off-the-bone and savory. The beef cheeks were delicious, and the duck breast was wonderful. The only entree that was just so-so was the scallop risotto. 

We even liked the fact that our server had an authentic French accent!
author: Mark R.

description: This place is the best! Amazing French food, and they always have the best specials. Perfect for a nice dinner or breakfast/brunch on the weekends.
author: Madeline H.

description:
Went for brunch today. 4 of us had the steak frites, French toast, and the croque madam along with coffee with mimosas.

The food was delicious, service great, and we had a good time. Will definitely come back again. Maybe, even try dinner here.

Food Quality - Excellent.
Food Taste - Excellent.
Food Originality - Good. 
Price - Good. 
Customer Service - Excellent. 
Ambiance - Good.
author: Vibhor C.

description: Excellent food.....wonderful service.....perfect music in the background. Our first time eating here but we will definitely be back. Had the best salad, bouillabaisse, pea soup, steak frites and apple dessert. All magnificent! Come if you haven't been here.
author: Susan W.

description:
I'll preface by saying that service is extremely important to me at high-end restaurants. It's part of the experience. Bad  service can affect my palette. That being said, not only was service only so-so here, the food was also just slightly above mediocre.

I ordered the warm spinach salad to start. it was one of the night's specials but there was nothing special about it. Very boring dish I could have made at home. My date got the broccoli soup and said it was too salty. 

For our entrees we got steak frites and a lamb special. I thought the lamb was pretty good but poorly executed. The sauce was too thick and sweet and drowned the dish into a soupy mess. Brussels were not crispy either (or maybe they were soggy because of the sauce).

After we sat down, we waited a few minutes to be offered water and had to ask what the specials were. Apparently they are written on a chalkboard near the front of the restaurant but seriously, in a place like this, announce the specials at the table! Food took a while to come out and since your server doesn't bring it, I think we saw our server once during the meal. An entirely different person cleared the plates and yet another brought the check-- soooo confusing! 

I probably won't seek this place out again. It's also away from the Divis corridor and in a very residential area. There are better places in NOPA.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
I love this place.  I've been going since they opened in 2010.  The food is absolutely incredible, very reasonably priced, and they have an awesome wine list that averages around $45/bottle and maxes out (I think at 70?)

The space is great, and not too loud.  The service is incredibly attentive and very caring.

My favorite dishes:
*Tournedos Rossini -- Filet, Foie Gras, Potatoes, Port Reduction Sauce...it's the perfect dish.
*Cassoulet -- The perfect mix of white beans and delicious meats -- boudin blanc, duck confit.etc
*Escargot -- The mixed herbs that they cook the escargot with are better than I've ever tasted
*Volcan de Chocolat -- Yes...normally I'd never recommend a flourless chocolate cake...I'm not even a desert person..but this thing is insane.  Do yourself a favor.  Order it.
author: Wojtek K.

description: Quite good French bistro fare. The menu is wide, doesn't vary much, but there are always daily features. Good wait staff. My only complaint is no listing of cost for the specials, resulting in  a higher priced entree that one of our party might not have opted for if aware of the dollar amount. Of course, we could always have asked, but why is that necessary? But, I/we would still return to this neighborhood restaurant.
author: Jean G.

description:
Cute little neighborhood restaurant with great food. We came to celebrate a birthday and the food was better than I expected. 

Escargots - deliciously made with a chewy texture.
Mussels - perfectly balanced with white wine and other ingredients. Fresh.
Duck Breast - big portions. super tasty
Filet mignon with foi gras on top - huge portion of foi gras and filet mignon melts in your mouth
Risotto  with scallops - yummy!

Service was quick and friendly. They also serve you a bread roll before hand, what more can you ask for?
author: Kelly C.

description:
I was super ecstatic about trying this place tonight. My attention was caught by the number of reviews and the high rating this place has. I saw all the pictures on Yelp and read through a couple of reviews so I knew what I wanted to order beforehand. 

The restaurant itself has a cozy feeling inside. A little dark inside during the day, but there are outside seatings that are shielded by this plastic cover with heated lamps. The interior of the restaurant is way much more romantic than the outside seatings-but hey, we love bright light because it makes us more happy. So we choose to sit outside. It was like eating underneath a carnival. There were no table clothes, utensils were all pretty unsanitary looking, entrees took quite awhile, but appetizers came out quick. Our waiter was friendly but did not check up on us... Usually I don't mind, but when I do want to hunt him down, he is always nowhere to be found. Now here is what we had:

Beef tartare (Good, but not amazing)
Foie gras torchon (Skip! Left a horrible after-taste)
Scallop risotto with lobster sauce (Super fishy!)
Filet mignon with gratin potatoes (Just ok) 

While everything looked amazing and tasted well, nothing stood out to us. We liked the food but not enough to convince us to dine here again. Also I do want to point out-the pictures that people post on Yelp are taken zoomed in. The portion sizes of everything is small-but pretty filling.
author: Laura T.

description:
This place is #EVERYTHING. 
Insanely perfect food and presentation. Our waiter was incredibly on point and knowledgable. I've jumped around the menu a bit and have been consistently impressed. HUGE FAN of the beef tartare... and well everything else really.
author: marco v.

description:
The croque madame (melted swiss, ham, bechamel on pain de mie, sunny side up egg) was quite good. It was in the shape of a sandwich, but it really had to be eaten with a fork and a knife. This was quite a unique dish and I loved how the swiss cheese was melted on top of the toast.

I also tried my girlfriend's omelette with ham and grilled onions. It was a bit runny from the onions, but I thought it was really well made. 

After we paid the bill, our group just sat around and caught up with each other. They didn't kick us out since it didn't seem too busy, so that was a plus.
author: Edward W.

description:
Came here with the fambam on a sunday night, and the restaurant was mostly empty.. It's on the corner of a very residential area. The insides are okay-looking, nothing fancy. Not as nice as what I'd expect from a $$$ restaurant ya knoww. 

The food was 4 stars, the service was 2 stars. 

Food: Ordered the salmon tartare (SO GOOD IF YOU'RE A SALMON LOVER), and the brie appetizer with garlic and tomatoes MMMMM BOTH OF THESE ARE DELICIOUS. I love soft garlic and melted brie.... and toasted bread... For the main courses we got the scallops, lamb, and beef cheeks. Scallops were one of the best I've ever had, and the risotto it came with was also spot-on.  Highly reommended. Lamb was eh, nothing special, and the beef cheeks melted in your mouth. The beet puree it came with was also kinda cool. 

Service: Our waiter was so rude.... As he was explaining the menu, I started to ask him a question and he said "I'm not finished" and glared at me. He didn't even let me finish the question... then he just kept talking..! wtf?!? So unfriendly. Don't think I've ever been shut up by a waiter before.
author: Amanda C.

description: A pleasant surprise. We were staying in a hotel downtown so it was a bit of a drive. It was worth it. The food is French infusion. The service was excellent. I had the spinach salad pictured to start and the filet mignon topped with foie gras. It was rich but the steak was cooked perfect. Each bite melted in your mouth. Also the wine reduction sauce was the right amount of tangy to off set the richness of the foie gras.
author: Ilene S.

description:
Tucked away in the residential neighborhood corner of Nopa, this little hidden gem stood out with the light-strewn trees, outdoor seating with heating lamps. The restaurant offered inviting lights that emanating from the window front beckoning curiosity from passerby.  

We were seated promptly and were address according with our menu and drink options. The waiter discussed the specials with us and gave us time to explore the rest of the menu. After hearing about the filet mignon with a seared foie gras atop, we were determined to order the "Rossini" dish listed as a special.  

We ordered: 

Escargot - 3 Stars. This is prepared in parsley butter and garlic. It needed more butter as it was a pinch bland. 
  
Kobe beef tartare - 4 Stars. Served with crostinis and a small salad. This was prepared well and met expectations as this was lightly seasoned. The salad paired well as it had a light tangy vinaigrette dressing. Great as an appetizer. 
   
Braised Beef Cheeks with Red Beet Puree - 4 Stars. The meat is slow cooked for hours, so it is extremely tender to the touch. I thoroughly enjoyed this texture. Surprisingly, I was able to taste the goat cheese which gives the dish a different take considering that its paired with the red beet puree which was light in taste. 
 
Rossini - 5 Stars. Filet mignon with a seared foie gras atop. Excuse me, did you just say foie gras? Are we in heaven? The foie gras was prepared on point and the taste and texture was buttery as it melted in our mouths alongside the filet mignon. I was savoring every bite and taste.   

I would recommend Bistro Central Parc to friends.
author: Becky Q.

description:
Cute Date Night Bistro

Bistro Central Parc is a fantastic date spot. The restaurant is nestled on the street corner of a mostly residential area, so parking is usually decent and there isn't much street noise. Inside can be a bit crowded, which gives the place a cozy feel. It gets noisy, but not to the point where an intimate chat becomes a screaming match, a problem of some other SF dining locales.

The staff is friendly and funny. The kitchen has an open concept, so you can watch your food being made and talk to chefs and waiters. 

Now to the food. I had a glass of the house Bordeaux to start (which in some circles classifies as food) and it was delicious - robust flavor and a nice hefty pour. My boyfriend had the filet Mignon, which sat on a lightly fried potato gratin, fantastic from the bite that was begrudgingly bestowed upon me. I had the fish of the day, salmon with a teriyaki glaze and curry sauce.  I enjoyed it so much I asked the waitress if, hypothetically, one were to call ahead one could request the salmon. She said yes (!) If you enjoy salmon, I would definitely recommend doing this - best salmon I have had in San Francisco. 

For dessert, we split the Chocolate Volcan. We weren't quite sure what it was, but figured we couldn't go wrong with chocolate or volcano-themed dessert. We were more than right. Chocolate Volcan is like a cross between a soufflé and a flour-less chocolate cake, served hot and garnished with mint and ice cream. It was so delicious, our waiter jokingly tried to join us in devouring it. Many of the other desserts on the menu look appealing, but this will always be my favorite. Not too heavy or overly cloying - just damn good and extremely chocolate-y. Yum. 

If you need a spot to go with a significant other, friend, annoying relative or if you are flying solo, this place has amazing food, nice decor and a quaint but classy ambiance. One of my favorite San Francisco spots.
author: Adriana F.

description:
"What? The wait is an hour and 15mins??" I replied to the hostess at NOPA. 

Not feeling like floating around for an hour and 15mins to be seated, I decided to try out Bistro Central Parc, which was about the best decision made that night. 

On my walk over there from NOPA, I decided to be smart about it and call Bistro to get a feel for what the wait situation would be. A French gentleman, who I am assuming is the owner, answered the phone. I asked him how long the wait was going to be for a table of 2. He responded to me with his accent, "For you, I have one waiting right now." A vividly fast flashback of my recent trip to Paris was only appropriate. Sure enough, I stepped in and was seated immediately. 

I ordered the Magret De Canard, which is duck breast accompanied by a small bed of spinach, potatoes, and half sliced figs all swimming in sauce. My duck was prepared medium rare, which my waiter recommended to preference and it was nothing short of being flawless. Everything was rich in flavor and nothing on the plate overpowered anything else. The definition of teamwork.  

My friend ordered the Carre Dagneau, Ratatouille, which was the rack of lamb also cooked at a medium rare. The lamb was perfect. Seared with seasoning on the outside and juicy on the inside. Zero traces of the gamy aroma for those of you who fear that. This is something I would definitely put on a recommendation list. 

WORD OF ADVICE: Get the Malbec Wine to go with the duck or the lamb. It's the business and definitely a nice place for date night.
author: Mike D.

description:
Oh, man! I loved it so much! I loved it!

This is a little place, but I feel the staff does an amazing job of being personal and accommodating. In fact, I somehow booked the wrong reservation time, and when I called same-day and realized my mistake, they fixed it and reassured me all was well! (It was :) )

My husband and I became total snobs after the dinner we had. We didn't know how we would go back to regular, every day food. We've had French food before (usually on anniversaries), but we just felt this place took it to the next level. The way we wordlessly expressed our amazement with our eyes as we silently savored the biteful of food we had in our mouth was enough to prove we'd never be able to settle for less again (at least for the evening. Than we went to China town and dove into some really grubbin' buns and it was ok). 

This was my first experience with foie gras, and it was executed quite well - the filet mignon was delicious, and I would recommend it.

However, the best thing I ate that night was likely the beef cheeks. I can't wrap my head around the way they blended beets, goat cheese, and some veggies into this beautiful, balanced sauce that cradled the beef cheeks so elegantly. When I took my first bite, I exclaimed "why would anyone eat anything other than beef cheeks when beef cheeks exist?!?!" I meant it.

When myself or my Mother make a roast, I always cut off the fatty pieces. Yes, they're tender, but ew - that texture! No. I can't. My Mom loves it - my hubby doesn't mind it, either, to get that delicious fat flavor. 

But this, somehow, was the best of both. It was so soft that I just touched it with the side of my knife and it slide to the bottom of the plate with a little-too-loud clank. It was so much softer than any cut of beef, but didn't have the gumminess that I hate of actual fat. It didn't have an entirely fatty flavor - it was somewhere inbetween. 

I mean, I would eat the cheeks of any animals at this point if I were assured they would taste this good.

This place is Aces. I can't say enough, but I should, so I'll stop.
author: Amber G.

description:
If you want to grow old happily, celebrate your birthdays at Bistro Central Parc.  

OK, that sounds like a plug, but I celebrated my birthday this evening.  Jacques greeted our unannounced arrival at the door, and found us a place anyway.  All the employees were gracious to my Hot Russian Girl and me.  

Conversation ensued with the people seated next to us at the bar, with the owner and the waitstaff, and with each other.  All the food looked great, but we could only order so much.  We'll have to come back again to try something else.  

Sweetbreads, bouillabaisse, profiteroles and a kir royale for My Hot Russian Girl.  A 3-salmon appetizer, a tender (like cooked all day) short rib, and a poached pear with ice cream for me.  So many glasses of wine that we were traded the bottle, and I do believe we came out ahead on that one.  

At one point the lights flickered, and then the whole staff came out singing.   I thought it was great that someone else was celebrating their birthday here, too, but then the poached pear was set before me with a lit candle.  Oops!  It's mine!  

Then they even gave me a birthday present.  

To be fair, other people were celebrating their birthdays here, as well as a party of  maybe 20 people who were overjoyed to see each other.  Yes, it's a special kind of restaurant.  

Our dinner was $143 + tip.  It wasn't exactly the same experience we would have by calling a potluck in Dolores Park.  It's not like that at all.  It's Bistro Central Parc, and it does make my birthday happy.
author: David D.

description:
Close your computer, get off your phone, shut down your tablet and GO NOW. This place is absolutely fabulous. I can't remember the last time I came to a restaurant so unknowing what I was about to experience and leaving so full of happiness!

I came here late on a Friday night with no reservation probably around 9pm. The place is kind of small so definitely recommend making a reservation, but luckily for us there was some room at the bar. The ambiance is very nice and simple, modern for sure, and a little upscale. Not super fancy but I'm glad they didn't notice my dates tie die shirt underneath his pullover ha!

Service was great. My date described our waitress as "no nonsense". She gave us an excellent wine recommendation after explaining our taste preferences to her and was there to meet and anticipate all our needs but wasn't overbearing and let us enjoy our evening together. 

Most importantly - the food. I mean oh, my, god. We didn't even order from the regular menu, we ordered all specials because they sounded so good! I definitely need to go back because there were multiple items on there calling my name!! So we started with the special salad which was a warm spinach salad lightly tossed in some delicious vinaigrette with fried shallots, pickled red onions, a poached egg and bacon... I have literally had dreams about it since. My date ordered the filet mignon with foie gras, I had a bite and it was incredible. I had the short rib with parsnip purée and sautéed mushrooms. You didn't need a knife, it fell right off of the bone and melted in your mouth.

Stop reading now, just go!! One of my new city favorites.
author: Mandy A.

description:
I'd never heard of this adorable neighborhood joint, but a yelp search brought up its 4.5 star overall rating & I was excited to try...

Now that I've been there, I'm thinking BCP at brunch is a completely different restaurant from BCP at dinnertime...

Let's get the bad out of the way: service. Our waitress, for lack of a better term, was completely clueless. She did not know menu specifics (what kind of pasta do they use in the special? She had no idea), left bff's OJ sitting on the bar til the end of our meal, & I'm gonna chalk it up to a language/cultural barrier, but we had to motion for the check five times before receiving it. 

Onto the good: the food!
-- omelet with Swiss cheese & spinach: super fluffy eggs, generous amount of filling, simple, but delicious. Salad was dressed perfectly, had bits of garlic & scallion, yum. Fries, or rather pommes frites, were crispy, but not what I expected from a French restaurant. 
-- creme brûlée: a classically good one. Portion big enough for us to share. Only complaint: custard could've stood to be firmer. 

I don't have a desire to return for another meal, like dinner. I understand brunch, to restauranteurs, are considered less important than dinner, but my experience is evidence that hiring the proper staff can make or break a customer's first impression. Probably wouldn't come back based on this one meal.
author: Fancypants X.

description: how fortunate to live where we do.  a short walk to a lovely little bistro.  always walk out satisfied.  service is attentive, food is prepared and plated perfectly, intimate surroundings.
author: Ron S.

description:
Outstanding value for what you get. Food quality: A+. The atmosphere is casual, yet chic - dim lights, simple French decor. 

We came early on a Saturday night - 5:30pm - so it was not crowded (which was nice). Started to fill up closer to 6:15pm. 

What we ordered: 

-Mussels with curry/cream sauce. Wow! Absolutely delicious. The sauce was so flavorful and rich. The mussels were large and perfectly cooked. 
-Little gem salad: A little gem this was! The blue cheese is not as "smelly" or "pungent" as most others. I really enjoyed it. The bacon brittle is highly addicting. 
-Beef cheeks. The beef literally melted in my mouth...holy cow! The beet puree on the plate was to die for and had a creamy texture. Mushrooms perfectly done. I could have done without the potatoes...but still not complaining because the rest of the plate was amazing. 
-Lobster risotto with scallops: YUM! The portion looked small, but I could not finish it, because it was so rich (trust me though, I wanted to). 

Dessert looked good...but couldn't do it. Way too full. 

Thanks for a fantastic experience.
author: Jamie M.

description:
I had eaten here a few years ago and had a great experience but wasn't sure my high expectations would be met this time---but my expectations were completely exceeded!

There is a new owner now but she has kept the same concept, same chef, and the same staff. If you like well-made, beautiful, simple french dishes in a neighborhood spot ambience, then this is the spot for you. Service was friendly, food was delicious.

What we had and loved:
Salmon tartare
Mussels
Beef tartare
Escargot
Steak Frites
Salmon special

Desserts were great too! The chocolate volcan was amazing. Apparently the head chef used to be a pastry chef.

The meal wasn't cheap but not overly expensive either. There is lovely patio seating as well as a large seated bar inside.

Their wine list has expanded as well.
author: Camille E.

description: A wonderful birthday celebration topped off with an excellent pistachio sponge cake, complete with the traditional birthday serenade and a lighted candle.  The specials were amazing, as was the service--as always. Glad I can walk to this neighborhood gem!
author: Nora K.

description:
Je suis en amour avec ce petit bijou de voisinage...*SWOON*

Yes, I'M IN LOVE with Bistro Central Parc, with the mouth-watering and beautifully presented French fare, the charming ambiance and the staff's ultra sexy French accents; what's NOT to love?

On Sunday, my friends and I (party of 3) came to BCP for dinner. We had dinner reservations at 6 PM but were a little late because it was difficult to find street parking, so make sure to allot an extra 15 minutes to look for parking.

F O O D:
*WARM BRIE w/ Potato Pancake and Mizuna Salad ($9.50): DELISH!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/W97siDhQbWIVa0MEpcq9iA?select=amOAN6cKbqviMv9biA9_lw

The potato pancake was lightly browned to a crisp and crowned with an oozing chunk of melting brie. The combination of the soft, crisp potato cake and the rich brie created a delectable savory creaminess which was balanced by the Mizuna's (Japanese greens) slight peppery flavor. 
 
*SWEETBREAD w/ Mushrooms ($10): The BEST sweetbread I've ever had! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/W97siDhQbWIVa0MEpcq9iA?select=lVxW___vn5JF0agTJDOgOg

The sweetbreads were perfectly seared creating a slight crispiness around the edges while maintaining it's rich, creamy and soft texture. The mushrooms had a hearty meaty flavor which complemented the mild flavor of the sweetbread and the mushroom au jus was lip-smacking good as it was bursting with a rich and savory woody flavors. 

*TOURNEDOS ROSSINI - Filet Mignon w/ Foie Gras ($28): An AMAZING union!  Better than Harris' Filet Mignon Rossini! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/W97siDhQbWIVa0MEpcq9iA?select=P6OXn6VEfduz4YeRFC_IGQ

Topped with a luscious slice of foie gras, the filet mignon was marinating in a pool of black truffle sauce. As I cut into the foie gras and filet, I saw the juices from the foie gras dribble down onto the tender slice of filet. As I put the fork of this perfect union in my mouth, it was love at first bite. The filet was soft and tender, and the foie gras added that layer of fatty decadence to take it over the top. The black truffle sauce turned this into a ménage à trois adding a rich, savory and complex woody flavor that complemented the pairing without hindering the natural beefy flavors. 

*CHOCOLATE LAVA CAKE ($6): RICH AND DECADENT! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/W97siDhQbWIVa0MEpcq9iA?select=oxL6hegJ4cyRfUqu9FIeqg

As we cut into the warm lava cake, chocolate started oozing out which is always a good indicator of a perfectly baked lava cake. The exterior of the cake was slightly crisp and the interior was fluffy and light. The oozing chocolate sauce was rich and thick but was slightly bitter, allowing the dessert to be decadent but not overwhelmingly rich or sweet. It was the perfect ending to our meal!

S E R V I C E:
MAGNIFIQUE!

The owner and staff were very warm, friendly and attentive. They came by multiple times to check on us to make sure everything was ok and that our food was to our liking. You can tell the owner takes pride in what he does as I saw him go from table-to-table ensuring everyone was having an enjoyable meal. 

Dishes were well-timed; 10 minutes to get our apps, 5 minutes to get our entrée after finishing our apps and 8 minutes to get our warm dessert. 

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
PERFECT DATE PLACE! 

BCP's intimate and simplistic setting is charming, yet casual. The live bistro jazz music on the weekends sets a romantic tone and with the mouth-watering food and sexy French accents, it transcends you into a neighborhood bistro in Paris

P A R K I N G:
Difficult street parking. There's no nearby parking lots, so as I mentioned, allow an extra 15 minuets to look for parking. 

BCP is truly a neighborhood gem in NOPA worthy of 5 stars! While reasonably priced, the food and service is top-notch. It's not very often that I rave about restaurants and I couldn't help but tell some of my friends and my co-workers about how much I loved BCP. Or, maybe it's that damn captivating French accent that's clouding my judgment...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This review is for brunch/breakfast.

The dinner options at this place look amazing, the breakfast was just ok. Decent but nothing special.

Tried the French Toast (full order is two slices) and the eggs florentine. Both were decent, but nothing amazing. Also the French Toast came out a little cold.

If I lived within walking distance of this place I would come for breakfast again. Since I don't, I'm going to wait until I can come for dinner - since as I said, dinner looks great.
author: Ely L.

description:
I came here for my birthday with about 8 people and was able to make reservations and be seated on time. What differentiates an SF French restaurant from a French restaurant in Paris is the service- the waiters were so attentive and friendly! The owner even came by a few times to ask how food was, and gave me a mug since it was my birthday. 

I ordered the rabbit with risotto (first time I've had rabbit), and the meat melted in my mouth. I also ordered the escargot for the appetizer, but it was a bit too buttery/oily for me. Endless bread that came was delicious and some of the best bread of tasted since  living in Paris.

Great experience, a bit of a dimmer restaurant. The reason this is a 4 and not a 5 star review is that it was a bit too noisy for my taste, as I could barely hear the person next to me at my own table, but some may say that adds to the ambiance.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I used to go to Zazie's, but have retired the restaurant immediately upon discovery of Bistro Central Parc. It is hands down my favorite French restaurant in SF. They have a classic menu, done well with good ingredients and seafood. My favorite dish of all is the beef cheek. The shavings of beef are so tender and served beautifully on top of a red beet puree with soft potatoes.
author: Hannah G.

description: Love the food, the staff are very French. You know what I mean.
author: Heber S.

description: On the eve of the French presidential election, we had a wonderful dinner. Our waiter was warm, helpful, and attentive, and the entrees and appetizers... and desserts were terrific. Highly recommended!
author: Barry T.

description: Good food and service. Friendly cozy place that is very welcoming. Nice wine suggestions from our great waiter. Not too noisy either. Lovely evening out with friends. Really recommend.
author: Pam V.

description:
Sadly typical of SF to spawn yet another ersatz "bistro" with French pretensions but with no real "cuisine" worth the trip. 

Please at least stop serving that ghastly gristly confit which hardly saw earth, let alone has ever been laid to rest as it should until the meat falls off the bone, and I don't mean after being gnawed at for half an hour. And those lentils are only fit for composting. 

SO very sick and tired of all these pretentious, unpalatable, costly wastes of time and taste...get your greedy heads out of your overfed derrieres and make it worth our while you cynical pretenders!

We can only pray that Buvette opens a bistro in SF.
author: Josephine M.

description:
If it weren't for the location we wouldn't have come. Wish we didn't.

First off if you work somewhere, anywhere, but especially a restaurant I would think you'd Google the name to know what other restaurants in might a similar name. When I arrived and explained that we were meeting friends and if there were a restaurant by a similar name the hostess said, "I don't know." She did not say, "I'm not sure, I don't believe so, but if you really aren't certain if you wait a moment I can check for you."

So we sat to wait for our party at a practically empty bar at the two seats reserved for people without reservations (our friend had reservations we didn't know the maiden name). I got a hot chocolate (think Swiss Miss) and my partner asked for an Orangina. "We don't have Orangina the best I can do is orange juice and Perrier." I would have preferred, I'm sorry we don't carry Orangina but I could mix orange juice and a Perrier if you'd like?" How about a Coke? "We don't have coke." I would imagine in a bar they carry a carbonated sugary soft drink but that option wasn't offered. Ok, I'll take you up on the orange juice and Perrier. "We're out of orange juice." I would have liked to hear, "I'm sorry, I know I offered you an orange juice based drink, but failed to realize we were out. What might I get you instead?"

So they sat us outside, where it was cold. The reservation was for 5. There were 4 chairs. Then they wanted to sit us all in the corner away from the heat lamp. They were more concerned about changing the configuration of the tables than the comfort of their guests. Eventually they acceded to our request to move closer to the heat. I didn't mind eating with my coat on, it was just like camping.

I wish I could comment about the tastiness of the duck breast but they were out. The duck confit was okay, but just. Onion soup was ordered as an appetizer but when the entrees arrived, no soup in sight. After we asked to have the soup that didn't arrive taken off the bill a few moments later the soup shows up. It was rejected a second time since were already eating entree. Poor coordination.

The desert was fabulous. If you eat here, get dessert. Apparently the fish was very good but oddly paired with lentils (looks like they pair everything with lentils).

While we waited in line for the single restroom it occurred to me that while our waiter was very nice, even if the food were better, it is not a repeat visit. I'm glad I don't live in that neighborhood because this exists only because there are few options in the area. Even so the poor customer service is unforgivable. It actually more insulting to turn up the charm when you screw up the order because it shows you know better but don't bother.
author: Daniel D.

description: Went for brunch (so not sure what dinner is like).  Food was good, service was so-so.
author: Rob S.

description:
This is a restaurant that I keep thinking how great the food tasted even days later. To the top! Even when they were out of the Malbec half, they had a Bordeaux ($30) which was just has pleasurable and actually a better pairing for my absolutely delicious duck. And my 'o my, the wine sauce that came with my duck, and the infused (campaign?) black cherries! And I'm always a fan of spinach, oh so fresh. My companion's steak was equally memorable.
