You know it's good when you love the charred fat. Yumbuckets! This came with the best as they can get, string green beans. I was in heaven, wait, I till am. I felt like I revisited my ancestors, my father the hunter and my cousins the farmers. It was magic that delighted all our senses.

I can talk about my chocolate covered pear dessert, but I would just be repeating myself, but ooh the sprig of mink was perfection.

The service was great. So great that many of the other patrons knew the staff. There is a definite neighborhood feel among the patrons as well. 

Our group was celebrating Valentine's Day a day before and so took the only reservation left. at 5:30pm. Bistro Central Parc has inside AND outside sidewalk seating which on this night was packed. This a is bistro restaurant of the greatest proportions.
author: Frank M.

description:
This place can only be described in one word... Brilliant! 
We went to San Francisco for my partners birthday weekend, and one of the restaurants I decided to take him to was Bistro Central Parc. This is a charming place, with a real "at home" feel. The service and the food are amazing, one complimenting the other. My partner and I both decided on two great meal choices, he had the pork chops and I had the Ratatouille over Risotto. Both dishes were beautifully prepared, like a work of art! The end of the meal was finished off with a piece of lemon tart, which was brought out with a candle on it and the lights were turned off and everyone in the restaurant sang happy birthday! A real unforgettable night. Glad that we decided to come here.  Looking forward to eating here in the future. 

Thank you to the staff at Bistro Central Parc for making my partners birthday one of a kind!
author: Charles B.

description:
A dark and stormy night; seated at the front door and catching the blustery wind with its chill factor, we asked for another table.  Not to be.  Each party is seated in rotation and we arrived at the restaurant's opening hour - second table to be seated.  I wore my coat to be comfortable.
Our waiter entertained and charmed us; unfortunately he moves south to L.A. at the end of the year.  
What we liked:  the mussels were plump; the halibut was perfectly seared and cooked to perfection.  
What could be improved:  our requested second glass of wine never came, the sauce on the pork chops was bitter and added little nuance to balance the flavors, the vegetables were overcooked and a distasteful mash.
It is not a good sign that I was eager to escape the table.
author: Geri S.

description:
Wow! What a great place!

I have to admit, I was a bit skeptical at first when I saw that this restaurant was serving upscale french cuisine at moderately low prices. Especially eating here on New Years Eve, I was expecting an overpriced menu just for the occasion. 

However, unlike most upscale french restaurants that serve exquisite food at high prices, Bistro Central Parc remains humble and offers exceptional french cuisine at a reasonable price. With four of us dining here that evening, we got the opportunity to try a lot that their menu offered..

Appetizers:
Escargot - very typical "french" appetizer to order and nothing too special. A little too much parsley was added to it and overwhelmed the flavor of the snails.

Salade D'endives Au Roquefort - endive salad with pears, apples walnuts. Very well presented and very light. 

Moules Au Curry Madras - Mussels! Always a good choice and they were very satisfying. The curry and cream added a nice spice and flavor to the mussels. 

Entree's:
Magret De Canard (Duck) - Both presentation and taste were absolutely exquisite. Tie between this dish and rack of lamb for the best entrees of the night.

Carr D'agneau, Ratatouille - Rack of Lamb and Ratatouille. I am always a fan of ratatouille as a side, but this time it was a bit overcooked, yet still very tasty. The rack of Lamb was spectacularly delicious and presented very well.

 Risotto Aux Coquilles St Jacques - Scallops atop a risotto in lobster sauce. This dish was somewhat disappointing. I was expecting the scallops to be seared better and the risotto was nothing extraordinary. 

Overall, I highly recommend trying to place out. For the price, its definitely worth it and I plan to visit again soon to try some of their other dishes out.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Comment dit-on "Holy prices, Batman!" en français?

Nice place but Valencia pricing won't fly in the Western Addition. $8.5 pommes frites? I've had cheaper on Fifth Avenue!
author: a s.

description:
Lately Bistro Central Parc has become one of our favorites, nothing fancy, very casual, tastes great and not outrageously expensive.  Few things that we love:
beef tartar, mussels, duck breast and filet mignon with seared foie gras.  They also have a decent selection of inexpensive wines.  Pretty much everything we have tried so far has been good.
author: Marina F.

description:
Yep, best place to get brunch, hands down, end of story, close your textbook, stand up, class dismissed. Move along. This is my private sanctuary. Do not enter. 
Seriously, this is a fine French restaurant that knocks eggs out of the parc and is good enough to bring your nana to for her 100th birthday. On New Year's Eve. Don't miss it.
author: Riley C.

description:
Came here for NYE dinner.  I know why this tiny little restaurant gets such great reviews.  First off the staff members are all friendly!  They had a bunch of specials for NYE.  My gf and I already knew what we wanted to order.  Everything on the menu sounded delicious!  Started off with the warm brie on a potato pancake and the kobe beef tartare.  The portions are very nice, they dont skimp out at all!  We had our own bottle of wine (corkage fee is $15), I did notice some people got free champagne, but we werent offered any... I didnt mind though because our wine was SO GOOD!  

Anyways back to the meal... she ordered the seared scallops over risotto in a lobster sauce. AMAZING!!!! The flavor of lobster popped in the mouth, the scallops were seared perfectly and HUGE pieces and the risotto was creamy and cooked perfectly.  I ordered the "SPECIAL" filet mignon that night... OH was I super stoked about this!  I ordered my steak medium and it came out perfectly, the potato gratin on the bottom was delicious with the pepper corn sauce.  This NYE meal was amazing especially for the price!  We finished our meal with a strawberry and persimmon cheese cake.  I was one happy camper!  This in total cost us about $100! I would consider that a STEAL for the meal we got!

I told the owner I would be back with some friends. Amazing little French restaurant!
author: David K.

description:
The service is great here with attentive and capable staff. Even with limited staffing and a mostly full  brunch service the server was able to attend to us. 

We started with the french onion soup. It seemed a little short of flavor. It had all the right components but it could have benefited from a bit more time However, we realize it was breakfast and it was probably started this morning. It would be great if it was started earlier. We also got the escargot and it had great mix of herbs and spices. Even went about munching on the herbs in the butter that did not stay on the snail. 

Croque monsieur was good. It was a great balance of the Swiss and bechemal. Unfortunately, the salmon benny was missing red onions and capers or it would have been much more enjoyable. Also, the potatoes are a little under done. 

Finally, the bellini was a tasty touch to the meal. 

Overall, the knowledge and the technique is there, but it was a slight miss on the execution. Despite that, we will definitely come back for dinner.
author: Eric W.

description: Excellent overall dinner.  Made reservation and parking was easier than I expected.  Got seated right away.  Food is very classic in terms of the menu selection but it's very well made and quite tasty!  Portion are generous as well.  We had three appetizers and three entrees and we were all impressed.  Service was superb as well (very professional and attentive/I would know since I worked in the business for about 20 years!).  Price is not cheap but you get what you paid for!  If you want classic French in a nice and inviting environment, that is the place to go!  Looks like you can also eat dinner at the bar and I will definitely be back by myself or with a group!  Very enjoyable experience!  Merci!
author: Yann D.

description:
Bistro Central Parc has French bistro food down to a T. Perhaps, the reason why is gentleman and woman who appeared to be owners are French? 

The food was so simple but incredibly delicious. Yes, I just said french food is simple. Looking at each dish we ordered, I noticed that are there were very few ingredients, and yet, each dish was so rich and flavorful.

Great food and even better, no to minimal wait. We walked in a little before noon on a Sunday and not only were we immediately seated, but there a few open tables. During our time there, there may been a table waiting to be sat for 5 minutes, but never  a line out the door waiting to be seated.

The eats: frisee salad w/lardons & poached egg, pasta carbonara, croque madame and creme brulee. I'm not sure, but have a feeling this will be the first of several visits. 
Afterall I couldn't keep my eyes off nearby tables food - eggs benedict, french toast, steak and eggs. Oh, and there's a dinner menu? Yeah, we'll be back.
author: Leona Z.

description:
I came here for the first time while on a study break with my friend. They provide excellent customer service. Everyone from the servers, chef, and owner were very friendly. It felt like we were visiting the home of close friends for a dinner party.

The food tasted wonderful. We had the french onion soup, brie chaud, salade D'endives au roquefort, filet mignon, salmon, and apple tart. Definitely recommend the french onion soup, brie chaud, filet mignon, and apple tart.

We arrived at the restaurant pretty late but were welcomed and not rush throughout our meal. They even played awesome 80s music towards the end.

Wonderful first time french dining experience!
author: T D.

description:
I was having a really bad day, but this place managed to cheer me up. My boyfriend and I were trying to get a table at Brenda's French Soul Food, but the wait was 1 1/2 hours, so we decided to drive out to this place. 

Unlike most brunch places, it was not too crowded (probably because the selection of item isn't as large compared to most places, but that means they are focused on making the dishes they have amazing). I really liked the atmosphere here -- very laid back and we didn't feel rushed or cramped. Things are a bit pricey, but the food was delicious. 

My favorite item here was definitely the mimosa! They use a very good Champagne.. hands down the best mimosa I've ever had, which has now ruined me and left me incapable of ordering them at other places since I will forever make the comparison. Just wish I had gotten the name of the Champagne they used. Very gracious and charming waitstaff as well. I believe I also saw the owner sipping on Champagne and thanking us on our way out.
author: Ghia G.

description:
My dad took me to BCP for my birthday a couple weeks ago, and it was seriously amazing.

*THE BREAKDOWN*

Ambiance: Classy, soft lighting, cozy.

Apps: Escargots - SO flavorful & delish. Could've eaten 10 more plates.
          Wild Mushroom Risotto with Truffle Oil - not a mushroom fan, so can't really comment on this. Dad really enjoyed it.

Entrees: Dad got the Halibut (Fish of the day) - tender, light, delicious
               I got the Magret de Canard (Breast of Duck) - ORDER THIS!! It will change your whole life. Duck was tender, not greasy like it usually is, amazing full-flavor. As close to steak you'll get without actually ordering a steak. Sauce was sweet & SO good. Duck came atop spinach and potatoes, also delicious.

Dessert: Chocolate Lava Cake - with vanilla scoop on top, warm choc syrup in the middle, perfect.

Service: Waitstaff was friendly, attentive and experts on the menu. Perfect. The owner (who is actually French!) greets you at the door. 

Bonus: Staff sang me happy birthday, turning down the lights in the restaurant & to top it all off, the owner brought a birthday present to take home - a Bistro Central Parc mug. 

LOVE it!!

tl;dr Get the duck.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
It bums me out to have to dis what was once one of our favorite spots around town, but our dismal recent dining experience at Central Parc, followed by a spectacular night out at the less well-known Le P'Tit Laurent has forced my hand. Having dined at both places within the space of a few nights, it felt deeply unjust that Central Parc should enjoy a higher rating on Yelp or anywhere, for that matter. 

This past Friday we were pining for a steak and were surprised to be able to get a reservation at CP on short notice, only to find the place half-empty when we arrived (on a Friday at 7:30?!). We were nonetheless treated as if we were a royal hassle by our waitress, who seemed greatly put out by the experience of serving us, though we were about as straight-forward a table as you can possibly be (couple of steaks, please). Compare this with our meal this evening at a jam-packed Le P'Tit Laurent (on a Monday!?), where our waitress juggled multiple tables in a crowded, raucous environment and still found the time and energy to serve us with grace and real warmth. The contrast was stark. 

The wife and I were left wondering what it was that had previously wowed us about CP and came to the firm conclusion that it must have been its famous filet mignon with foie gras, a dish it can no longer serve. The simple fact of the matter is we won't be back to Central Parc, whose sterling reputation seems to have gotten in the way of its caring about getting the little things right. Do yourself a favor and check out the Glenn Park neighborhood champ, Le P'tit Laurent, instead.
author: Matthew Z.

description: My god, this place is amazing... On top of great food, the service was impeccable. Our waiter Kyle was amazing. Helped us out with the right wines for what we were getting... And we chose to get a lot of different things because everything sounded incredible. We got several appetizers starting with the wild mushroom risotto which was fantastic... Then it was topped by this cheese and meat plate that has incredible pâtés on it... And that was topped by the duo de tartare saumon which exploded like an atomic bomb of flavor in my mouth. For the main courses, we got the carré d'agneau with ratatouille (an incredible rack of lamb) and the moules marinieres (succulent mussels) and both were superb. The lamb was cooked perfectly and the ratatouille was delicious. The mussels came in a white wine and cream sauce that we also dipped out pommes frites into. For dessert we got the Napoleon which was an amazing end to one of the best meals I've had in a long time. They carefully boxes our leftovers for us, a service that seems all too forgotten and we had great conversation with Kyle and the owner... A fantastic time.
author: Roger M.

description:
Another French bistro for the books! If you are like me, and love charming, intimate places that serve delicious and beautifully presented food without breaking the bank - then say "Oui, Oui!" and give Bistro Central Parc a visit. 

I did a very extensive research for a dinner spot for NYE dinner. I wanted to find a spot that did not offer a tasting menu just for the sake of it, and wasn't hard to make a reservation to. To my luck, I found BCP and it was the PERFECT choice.

Appetizers:
_____________

Escargot - 
A little disappointed it wasn't served in the shell. To me, its more moist this way. The parsley to butter and garlic ratio wasn't well balanced. There was way too much parsley. Will skip this app. next time. 

Salade D'endives Au Roquefort - 
Endive salad with pears, apples walnuts. Refreshing, light and tasty. 

Moules Au Curry Madras - 
Plump and perfectly cooked. There was a subtle hint of curry in the cream base sauce. I thought it could use a little more garlic.


Entrees
_______________

Magret De Canard (Duck Breast) - 
Our entire party was in awe of the presentation of this dish when it came it the table. It was ordered rare too and was rich, slightly tangy/sweet, and savory at the same time. The side of potatoes and chard was perfect with it.

Carr D'agneau, Ratatouille (Rack of Lamb and Ratatouille) 
The rack of lamb was a perfect medium rare. There was a great crust of seasoning on it and it was so juicy! I'm glad my bestie gave me a rib to clean off. nom nom nom.

Risotto Aux Coquilles St Jacques - 
Scallops on top of risotto in lobster sauce. This dish was underwhelming and kind of bland. The scallops were tiny and the risotto was flavorless. Yelpers were not right with their high recommendation of this one. 

Overall, a wonderful meal and I'll definitely be back now that the foie gras is back in California !!! :D
author: Sue Y.

description: We were prompt for our reservation. I love the relaxed atmosphere. i believe it was either a $30-20 corkage fee so watch out. The escargot was delish. The Rack of lamb was so juicy. I never had foie gras so I wasnt a fan. My date loved it. You have to try their dessert menu. I reccommend the tart  dark chocolate cake. The place is pretty tiny but still can be intimate. I would reccomend this place for anyone craving some french cuisine. I wish they had a website.  Our waiter was casually dressed in a polo which I didn't expect. The service is quick.
author: Rachelle E.

description:
Bistro Central Parc offers the most pleasant dining experience, and their food is just so so sooooo good. 

My friend and I weren't incredibly hungry, but we still wanted to sit down and eat something hearty. We opted for an appetizer, each, along with a bottle of white wine to share. This was a totally smart move as the portions for these appetizers made them feel like entrees. 

I ordered the galette de pomme de terre (warm brie on potato pancake, mizuna salad) and my friend ordered the wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil. Both were fantastic, and we didn't leave one bit of food back. 

The chef came by our table a couple of times to ask how our food and wine was. He was so incredibly nice, and the light and friendly conversation with him made us feel so welcomed! I remember him being a little bit touchy, but what French man isn't? It's what we love and hate about them, no?

Totally dying to try their brunch menu. I will most certainly be back!
author: Ha V.

description:
A fellow Yelp reviewer implores us not to trash a place based on our "visit-specific details." OK, well, I'll just assume the food is this bad for everybody, then.

The steak tartare is watery, as if it were previously ... eh? Never mind. Just avoid it.

Overcooked duck blistered with a gas-grill bitterness. Hideously fishy-tasting scallops with stiff, mushy "risotto."

I think we have here another case of avoidable problems. Scallops risotto is a difficult dish to do well, as is duck breast, to order. Simple, French bistro dishes are less hard and still very appealing. Nevertheless, people demand "beautiful" food (in ring molds, table side) over basic quality. A shame.
author: J W.

description:
Just moved into the neighborhood and walked by this place. Its perfect for a quiet dinner at the bar or a sit down with friends   Food was outstanding. I had the Chacuterie to start..the chicken liver pate was particularly good and then Steak F rites for main. Cooked perfectly with perhaps the tastiest green beans ive ever had. Frites were crisp and perfectly salted and the profiteroles were perfect.
Ill be back
author: Jim D.

description: Perfectly nice.  Service can be brusque, but can also be quite warm and welcoming.  I've had some absolutely inspired dishes here, and nothing has ever been less than "pretty good".  Waitstaff appears to be over-worked, as there were some pretty significant gaps between when things are requested and when they are delivered (i.e. the check, the wine).  This very, very traditional bistro serves a lot of dishes that we all crave, and they do them well.  Thus the popularity, which seems to be the crux of the problem:  popularity breeds complacence.
author: Robert M.

description: This restaurant is great. I went here for my birthday and it was the perfect choice. First of all, the food is amazing. I had the scallops and risotto and it was flavorful and so yummy. My friends had the steak and fries, french onion soups, arctic char, and mushroom risotto and everything was absolutely delicious. The waiter was so nice and recommended a great bottle of wine. They even brought out dessert and sang happy birthday to me. Overall amazing service and food and such a cute and laid back atmosphere. I would recommend 110%. You will not be disappointed.
author: Haley P.

description:
Love the intimate, cute, romantic setting. 
Lobster risotto was amazing. It was perfectly cooked. Perfectly seared scallops and perfectly flavored lobster sauce. Drools. 6/5. I thought my filet mignon with foie gras was just ok. The foie gras was great but the steak was mediocre masked by sauce. 3/5 unfortunately.  Creme brûlée was on par.  4/5
author: Carrie T.

description:
Amazing upscale French cuisine . The delicious starter, entree, and such charming and friendly  ambience made our night one of a kind!
The foods were beautifully presented and the dessert was unique and heart warming!
The Bistro Central Parc is with no doubt a 5 star and a must go restaurant in the city!
author: Saloomeh N.

description: Came here for a Saturday date night with my boyfriend and it was delightful. The food was simple yet out of the ordinary good! Service was great as well. Wine collection that paired with their food selection. Overall, it was a great experience.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
I have lived next to the restaurant for over a year and finally took the time to have a meal at their establishment. 
It was one of the best meals I have had in the city. 

Bistro Central Parc was such an overall pleasant experience. The owner was very gracious and hospitable. He made us feel like honored guests dining in his own home.
We sat at the bar and had a great conversation with one of the attending regulars.

My fiance and I shared all 4 dishes and one glass of wine. We started with the the steak tartar, followed by the mushroom risotto. We then split the chicken entree and finished off our meal with the apple tartine.
All the dishes tasted great. We did not leave hungry, and we enjoyed the surrounding company and service through out the evening.

If you are looking to experience french cuisine for the first time this is a great place to try, you can easily have a delicious meal for two and keep it under $100.
author: Matthew F.

description:
Excellent French comfort food.  We totally enjoyed our meal and would definitely return.

We came for brunch on a weekend.  I was worried there would be a line, because I hadn't been able to make a reservation online, but there were plenty of tables available when we arrived.  My husband ordered the French toast (with maple syrup for an additional $1.50) and I ordered the croque monsieur with a side of French fries.  So, so good.  The croque monsieur was perfect, cheesy goodness, prepared like you get it in France, with the bread crisped over a flame and not in a toaster.  However, it was the French fries (pomme frites, I should say) that were out of this world.  I don't know what they put on those fries, but they are damn good.  We couldn't stop eating them.  My husband's French toast was delicious, and the maple syrup is a must.  The creme fraiche it comes with is fine, but the maple syrup really elevates this dish.

We checked out the dinner specials posted on a chalkboard near the kitchen, and they all looked really good.  I think we're going to come back for dinner.  Wine list is heavily European, with only a few California offerings.  

Overall, great.  I enjoyed the ambiance and really loved the food.  Thanks, Bistro Central Parc!
author: Erin L.

description:
Great.

Love French food. Had a great time with friends. What more can you ask for?

Recommend the Mussels, whichever way you want them and the Duck.

I'd say the vibe at night looks better than the website picture.

Bon appetit.
author: Aakash G.

description: This was one of the best highlights of our trip to San Fran! Such good food, the scallops are amazing!!! The waiter was friendly and personable! Highly recommended!
author: Tricia H.

description:
Yummy scallop risotto and TO DIE FOR lava cake. Dont remember the rest.. 

Parking sucks here and restaurant is too dark. Can't see sh*t!
author: Betty T.

description: Hole in wall French place. Extremely delicious and the service I have ever experienced.
author: Eryn D.

description:
Great restaurant visit, The service was amazing and they were really Nice. 
For starter I ate the mushroom risotto with truffeloil, it was really good.
For the main I ate braised beef and they missed to trim some of the fat off so it was like eating slime. but the rest was great.
I had a great and simple lava cake for dessert.
Great experience, I would return.
author: Casper L.

description:
The one star is for the service, not the food.  I live in the neighborhood and can vouch for their delicious food.   I was so looking forward to the smoked salmon benedict but felt the urge to leave because the server so obviously didn't want us there.  So this shout out is to you, angry lady in the obnoxious fluorescent orange shirt on Sunday, August 9 @ 1:30.  
My friend and I request to dine outside and we are granted permission to seat ourselves.  My friend reaches to grab some menus as they are on the counter and on the way to the outside tables but Angry Orange Shirt (AOS) says, "No, we'll get those for you."  At the same time she's fluttering/rolling her eyes so dramatically, conveying her intolerance for us merely entering the restaurant.  Ok, we seat ourselves, menuless and waiting.  AOS steps outside and asks us, "Who sat you here?" "Us," we reply.  Then she asks us to move to a table that is 6 feet from the table from which we were just sitting.  Mind you,  it was not busy and this request/order was ridiculous and the other patrons expressions reflected the awkwardness that was taking place.  A man comes along and sets down two empty water glasses and then asks the table next to us, "how are you doing?" So we continue sitting, feeling more and more unwelcome as the time passes.  It was like we were in the Twilight Zone.  So we left.  This woman's attitude was bad for business.  I hope service improves.
author: Stevie b.

description: I love this place! Best brunch food in town, very friendly service, and they make a great French Bellini. Zarina always takes great care of us.
author: Brian R.

description:
Was excited about this place but it didn't quite live up. 
I ordered the onion soup and steak frites, my friends ordered from breakfast menu (eggs). We got all the food at the same time. That means I got the soup at the same time I got the steak. Naturally, my steak was cold by the time I started eating it. 

After we ordered french toast to share and it, too, arrived cold. 

The restaurant is not that big and it wasn't full so not sure why they "got slammed" as our waitress said. Regardless, maybe they got slammed in the kitchen, the wait staff wasn't too busy. And getting slammed in the kitchen doesn't mean the waiters can't get food to the table before it gets cold.
author: B G.

description:
Service..is very friendly 
Food...is fine but nothing extraordinary 
Menu...almost as same as other restaurants in SF.....
author: Angkana P.

description:
Now one of my new favorite places to eat...

Casual, warm environment with a sweet little bar and the most outstanding risotto I may have ever have had (was it made with heavy cream? appeared and tasted to be so) with a divine lobster sauce reduction that was simply out of this world.

I wish I'd ordered it: I was stealing bites from my dad's plate. If I had, however, I would've missed the perfectly grilled and excellent cut of steak with frites which were ..amazing! Thin, hot, salty frites that begged to be dipped in the delicious (I think I remember it was a port) reduction. All accompanied by slim and delicious haricots verts nestled between the steak and frites. 

All the dishes had an artful presentation without being fussy or overdone. Whoever the chef is, my tocque off to him!

Bistro CP loses a star because their salad frisee avec lardons was skimpy on the tart vinaigrette dressing (although beautifully and artfully presented) and was light on the pork and missing the little potatoes. I'm wondering if this is why they didn't call it salad Lyonnaise? I'd only had this salad a few times at one French restaurant in Russian Hill (now closed) and it was superior to Bistro CP's. I think this salad needs a little bit of tweaking, especially for the price which was a bit steep.

I'm looking forward to another meal soon - and will have to try the trout  that the Chronicle claimed was "too salty." Judging from the balanced tastes of all the dishes I sampled, I bet the dish is just perfect.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Update: raised this to a 5 star. Food is too consistently incredible and worth the price.

I live locally and have been here a couple dozen times...just now getting around to writing a review. This is a great little French spot and you can almost always get seated without a wait which is nice. It's kind of tucked away in the residential area so it's a pretty well-kept "secret". Overall, it's got a great atmosphere, always had great service from knowledgeable staff, and the food is great as well. I come here for both their brunch and dinner, which are fantastic.

I'm knocking off a star because they recently had a considerable price increase on their menu items. While I understand that this is SF and price increases are reasonable given the increases in cost of living, unfortunately this place is now more of a "special occasion" type place for me. 

Get the French Onion Soup!
author: Michael B.

description:
Valentine's Day is for suckers! 

Bouquet of roses.. heart shaped candies.. fine dining dinner.. diamonds, diamonds, and more diamonds.. man!

... yeah okay, I'm one of those suckers too. So! that's why my girlfriend and I are at Bistro Central Parc on Cupid's lovey-dovey day of arrows-to-the-butt!

Moules Marinieres (Mussels) - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_Crohzf_wD5E-AadOAC5iA&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Whoa! There was a mountain of these mussels -- Score! However, they weren't the best mussels I've ever had. There was a tad too much chopped shallots for my taste and wasn't enough white wine cream sauce, leaving some of the mussels tasteless and dry.

Due de Foie Gras with Peche Confite - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=cCasJo_Sab9045zxLKFMYQ&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Simply delicious. The trio of duck liver fat, pork loin and the caramelized peach really hit dead center offering vibrant of sweet, savory, gelatinous, and tangy sensations to my mouth. It's a shame that foie gras will be no more in the following months.. so better get some now!

Risotto aux Conquilles St. Jacques (Scallops with Lobster sauce)  - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=G0N4mZHN7ElER-bRBUD9Ig&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Risotto with lobster sauce is pure genius, and add on the perfectly cooked scallops; well, you got yourself an equation for Heaven in your mouth. Furthermore, they weren't stingy with the scallops either!

Lamb Loin with Foie Gras - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=7YOYQz-SZlG7-2IYNRJIQQ&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Girlfriend: "I didn't know lamb could be this tender."
And indeed it was. Topped with a small slab of foie gras (that's right!) with a unique tantalizingly sauce makes this lamb dish one I will not forget. 

Chocolate Mousse - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=cZ38FOr7VhvXAyuNCznX4w&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
What's Valentine's Day without chocolate, amiright? And how better to end it than with a super moist and chocolatey mousse with strawberry sauce and caramel wiring. I'm ashamed to say that I'm the one that ate most of it.. -- it was too good!

Bistro Central Parc is a very simple and casual, yet French atmospheric restaurant, tucked away within a quiet neighborhood. The menu is simple with all the hors d'oeuvres, entrees, and sides complied into one page and wines on the other. Despite dropping a pretty penny on V-day already, Bistro Central Parc has very reasonable prices for each dish, ranging from $8 - $24. The only discretion we had was that there wasn't much "love in the air" and the service felt rather rushed, but considering it was V-day after all, I wouldn't hold it against them. My girlfriend and I even agreed that we would actually like to return on a slower, regular day to avoid all the rambunctiousness. 

They even gave us both a white rose after as we were leaving the restaurant too. I happily declined.
author: Albert L.

description: Visited this cute place with some co-workers. I loved the ambiance: casual, non-stuffy, relaxing atmosphere! Food wise: the duck breast was so savory (fav dish!!), the filet mignon with foie grass (also delish), and the mussels filled us up! All in all, I really enjoyed this place.
author: Laura M.

description:
The food was delicious, the owners attentive, but it could get a bit noisy.
We had a great time, and I love it when the chef or owner makes the rounds of the tables to talk to his guests.

Obviously authentic french food, we were one of the few there who had English as a first language.   We're going back again soon.
author: Whitney D.

description:
I could see why many people would consider overlooking Bistro Central Parc since there's so many other luxurious and well known restaurants in the city. But to miss out on truly one of SF's best hidden gems will be a huge mistake. It's chic, it's modern, and it's down right delicious. The dim candlelit dining room sets the perfect tone for a romantic date or a night of sophistication with close friends.

SInce foie gras will be banned in mid July, I'm on a mission to get it where I can. The special that evening happened to be a filet mignon topped with seared foie gras, but the scallop risotto had caught my attention early on. I could have gotten both as my main course, but that would have been overkill. Luckily, our party worked it out by ordering the scallops as an appetizer and splitting between 3. It wasn't hard to convince them. Who could pass up on scallops, risotto, & lobster sauce?! I'm so glad we didn't. A few of the scallops were unevenly seared, but the flavor was on point. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who comes here, either as an app or entree.

The scallops were good, but the steak...oh my. I'm not one to be picky about what cut of steak I eat, as long as it's cooked well. Many times when I request medium rare, chefs usually overcook it to a medium, so I tend to ask for more on the rare side. This filet was cooked PERFECTLY! How could I not love a chef who knows how to properly cook meat? The foie gras, on the other hand, could have been seared a tad longer for that perfect creamy yet slightly firm texture. The abundant pool of sauce was left undesired for as the bed of potato gratin drowned in overwhelming flavor. Less is surely more. Chef was very generous with the portions, and for the inexpensive prices, this was a very affordable taste of semi-fine dining.

Bistro Central Parc can be easily compared to Chapeau! with the similar menu, prices, and outstanding service, but the dessert was not even closely on par. We ordered the creme brulee and was not impressed by the lack of flavor. Aside from the dessert, I loved everything else about this place and will definitely return for another bite.
author: Michelle W.

description: Fun little restaurant, entrees, desert and soup was wonderful, pleasant staff. All around nice experience
author: Ian H.

description:
Budget management.

Cheap humor: www.southparkstudios.com/full-episodes/s17e01-let-go-let-gov

Expensive regret: Almost $20 for an egg white omelette with spinach grilled onions and smoked salmon. After tax and tip and it was goodbye to a hard earned Jackson.

Combination itself was quite good. So were the potatoes on the side. All five of them. Pondered that while we waited for our waters to be refilled. Took a while.

Might have been four stars at half the price. Instead a brunch episode of Central Park seemed to cost more than producing an episode of South Park.

Cartman and company are the only ones earning my repeat business.
author: Jason B.

description:
When you look up "French food" on Yelp, this is one of the first listings that comes up. And, it had a crazy amount of reviews. So I made a reservation here for a birthday.

Long story short: snobby host, bland food, expensive bill. Not worth it. But you can keep reading if you want to know my reasonig (I usually give places at least 4 stars on here).

The place was empty on a Friday night. Maybe 7 was still early? 

Worse than that, the host was condescending, snooty, and all over the place. He was trying to be the waiter and the host, walking away from our table mid-sentence to greet incoming patrons. He didn't know the specials too well, and didn't know anything about the wines we were choosing - he couldn't describe any of them, just kept repeating the names of the wines. His general behavior towards us was rude - when we would ask questions about what a dish was like, he would say "What does it sound like?" I've been in the service industry so I'm sympathetic to waiters and hosts, but for a place in this price range and ambiance, the host should a) have better manners and b) not do a million things at once.

The food turned out to be okay, but there wasn't anything "French" or special about it. It was like any other slightly upscale restaurant in SF. We had the lamb shank (sauce was very rich and salty), a SUPER small portion of scallops in risotto with a lobster sauce that was pretty bland... some basic apps, and creme brûlée (also bland, again) and chocolate volcano cake (like a warm lava cake - pretty good).

Overall, disappointed in the experience here and would rather spend this kind of money at Nopa close by.
author: Jenn H.

description:
Two words...pure wow! Such a little gem tucked in a residential neighborhood. Food and service was amazing!! The waiter really made our night...what a funny guy! 
My friend was flying out of SFO and we tried to spend his last day here in SF doing touristy things. He has never tried French food in the US so of course I turned to yelp to find the perfect dining place.
 We started off with 3 appetizers: a plate of cold cut/cured meat (procuitto, duck, chicken pâté, rabbit pâté, beef, pork butt rolled in bacon - forgive me but I don't remember all the fancy names for the meats but it was amazing!!), garlic butter escargot, beef tartare. Although I'm not a beef eater myself, I heard the tartare is to die for. If my bf could, he would've licked the plate clean. We ordered entrees to share: mussels in curry-garlic white wine w/side order of fries , medium rare duck over a bead of greens and potatoes with liqueur soaked cherries, and scallop risotto. Everything was just perfectly cooked and executed. The plating of every dish was beautiful. By the time we finished our meal, every plate was scraped clean. Who says you have to leave a tiny bit of food on your plate to be polite?!? Not us!  We were showing the chef we REALLY enjoyed every last bit of food. 
    We ended the night with creme brûlée. It was silky and creamy- so rich and delicious! I will go back to try their strawberry in peppered balsamic vinegar. It was highly recommended but we didn't have space for 2 desserts.

I will be back soon!!! Loved everything about this place. :)
author: Miss L.

description: Bistro Central Parc is a hidden jewel. The food is amazing and the service is outstanding.
author: Dee G.

description:
The I-couldn't-care-less attitude of the baldish male server wearing glasses soured our most recent experience.  It wasn't his forced French accent but more his argumentative approach (yes, argumentative!) to answering customers' questions.  Unfortunately, the quality of the food was not enough to offset or overcome the poor service.

Sadly, I won't be going back.  Not going to pay money to have a server school me on how to ask questions!
author: Tone C.

description: Absolutely delicious! Went here for a friend's birthday dinner on Saturday and the place was bustling and cheery. Had Petrale Sole and it was my favorite out of all the food that came to our table, yay! I don't eat pate but took a little taste off the charcuterie tray and it was so delicious! The whole staff came out and sang Happy Birthday to my friend, it was super sweet. The portions are huge, far bigger than I expected. I had enough leftover for another meal. And I especially love that the entire wait staff seems to actually be French!
author: Chiara C.

description:
[October Self Date]

I decided that I would start taking myself out. Not just for takeout or a casual dinner, but to a fancy place, that a guy might take a girl out to for like a third date or something when they think they're going to get lucky. 

Anyways, I decided to come to this french restaurant and have my first self-date.  I obviously looked this place up on yelp and decided what I was getting before even getting there. Onion soup, the scallops, and creme brulee. Then the specials threw me for a little loop, but I decided to stick with my original plan. 

The owner (the older French guy) was super nice to me. They cleaned the bar space for me and always made sure that I was doing well the entire time during my dinner. 

Foodwise, all three were delicious. Onion soup - perfect temperature and the perfect amount of cheesiness and onion. The scallops were beautifully cooked and the lobster risotto was so creamy and delicious. I prefer my creme brulee with less/no sugar on top - I know for most people it's the best part, but for me, it's really not. I enjoy the custard the most. 

I think what puts this to a 5 star restaurant is that I decided to pay and wait for my lyft driver outside of the restaurant. It was probably only a few minutes out there and the owner came by to ask about my meal and kept me company until the driver got there. Now that is great customer service. It's really sweet of him to make sure that I was okay. 

I'll definitely suggest this as a place for a date if any guy asks.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Come for the Sunday brunch and have one of the Benedict's. They make a mean Hollandaise. I had the Salmon Benedict and it was delicious. The Mussels are very good also, very flavorful broth. Very strong flavorful coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice are good a starter and finishers.

The French speaking staff are very charming and do everything they can to accommodate you.  It was a gorgeous day this past Sunday and everyone wanted to sit outside so they dragged several additional tables out of the dining room to the sidewalk to satisfy their patrons and shorten the wait.   The table behind me had several dietary requirement, no red food (tomatoes, peppers, etc), no gluten, allergies to potatoes etc and the waiter took down their needs and checked with the kitchen and came up with a solution. 

While the food is very tasty, and the wait staff very friendly, the food presentation could be improved to match the lovely flavors. Such a small tweak would make the experience perfect.
author: Jerry W.

description:
Quietly nestled into a little residential stretch, it would be easy to pass this place up and that would be a shame.

The small outdoor area is adorable and romantic with little twinkle lights peppering the adjacent trees. The interior decor seems less romantic - white walls, stainless steel counter, local art on the walls and tables nestled together; however, the welcoming staff (many French) create an air of warm, coziness. 

A long flight left us starving when we arrived in San Francisco. An overly ambitious late lunch left us in search of something low key and light for dinner. While French isn't typically my go to cuisine for something light, we took a chance and fared quite well. 

Bistro Central Parc dispels the myth that the french are rude; upon entering we were warmly greeted by the staff like we were regulars or old friends. Once seated, we were given small, crusty french rolls to nosh while we perused the menu. Initially, we were both taken with the scallop risotto, but in order to try more than one menu item, opted to split and order of risotto and an order of the mussels. Artfully presented, the risotto was delicious. Served with lobster sauce and scallops, the dish was rich and decadent. The large scallops were cooked perfectly and we savored every bite. BCP offers two preparations of mussels; we opted for the more traditional preparation. The mussels were good; the accompanying sauce was rich, but still light enough to be a perfect complement to the risotto.

Bistro Central Parc was the perfect destination for our first night in town; delicious, classy food in a cozy, casual atmosphere. My only real complaint about our experience was the floor plan. Being a terrible klutz, I get terribly nervous when packed in tight. I felt like I could have easily knocked something over getting in and out of our table - frankly I'm surprised I didn't.
author: Mary T.

description: Went there for the 1st time on Wednesday.  Ambience was fine and the appetizers were nice - 1st time having sweet breads and they were very good.  I got the steak frites for dinner and there was nothing fabulous about it.  Looked like a steak I could've gotten at Safeway on sale for $5.00, and the presentation was boring.  Only nice thing about the meal was the frites, but I would rather not go to a nice French restaurant ONLY for the French fries.  To put the nail in the coffin, our waitress was the worst; completely curt and patronizing.  Won't be going again.
author: Matthew G.

description:
I honestly felt i had to update my review since I received the following message from jerome r.

Thank you for your message ,

I always love to read message from our guest and just love when they give the other place to go eat and try !!
so we are a french bistro and not restaurant ! i was looking at what you say about the rossini from Chaya , and i'm sure you saw that our's was 28 $ and there its almost 40 $$ so my choice is made where to go ! there entree start at 24 $ for chicken and go up , us it's 18 $ and go to 24 $ , just the rossini is 28 $ so like you say at end  83 $ pp with tips and taxe i think that a good deal !! how much will be the bill at Chaya for the same quantity of food ? i'm sure more !!
Anyway thank you for coming try us and hope to see you again one of this days !!

Jerome Manager


My reply: If you read my review nothing in there stated your prices were my unreasonable or expensive. I was only expressing my opinions like every other yelper! All my reviews include the amount per person or total of the bill. I dont judge dishes base on cost, i judge it base on the taste and quality alone. Please get your fact straight because a bistro is a restaurant by definition if you dont believe me look it up in a dictionary genius.


I think that explain the one star review! I will not be returning nor will I be recommending anyone to dine at this establishment.
author: Gina H.

description:
Overall, good food and service made for 5 stars.

My friend and ate here arriving around 6 without a reservation.  All the tables inside were reserved but empty, although there was plenty of seating outside available they offered us.

We had the curry mussels, beef cheeks, and pork chop special.  The mussels themselves were plump and large, however the curry flavor was very dampened by the cream.  The main courses were delicious with very nice presentation. 

Id say if you were here on a date, with wine, dessert, etc, it would be about 50 per person.  We paid about 30 each and left very full and satisfied.

happy eatings! :)
author: Wendy F.

description: My favourite dishes were the mushroom risotto, the kobe beef tatare and the heirloom tomato salad. The price is very afforable but overall nothing too special. The duck breast was okay, the salmon filet was a little bland, beef cheeks were decent, ratatouille risotto isnt my fav. The desserts i ordered were the lemon tart, chocolate lava, fraises a la modena, creme brulee. Lemon tart was a little too sour, choc lava was too sweet, the other 2 was nothing special.
author: Jenny N.

description: Best escargot ever! Practically melts in your mouth :D
author: Spanky S.

description: One of the finest restaurants I have been to. The food is crafted with love. The restaurant is warmly decorated. The wait staff is professional and friendly. You will feel like family. This is a place you will want to go out of your way to go to.
author: Steven W.

description:
My husband and have I enjoyed coming to this little gem in the NOPA/Panhandle area.  The service has always been friendly and welcoming.  Authentically french, proprietors offered a decent range of simplistic french cuisine for both for brunch and dinner.  

My husband loves the Salmon Benedict and the ratatouille is incredibly scrumptious. And their dinner menu is often mouth watering.

Bon Appetit!
author: Michelle G.

description:
Love Bistro Central Parc! 

BCP is a simple french restaurant with no frills, great food, and decent seating. I always make a reservation when coming here, (plan ahead people!), and am pleased to know that I will always leave with my expectations met. 

My absolute favorites here are the mussels and beef tartar. The tartar portion is much more than your typical place and BCP just does it so well. They have a great wine list and super sweet servers that operate under the attitude of no frills-i'm busy-but I care about your happiness, which I appreciate. Sometimes I don't like being talked up with fluff all the time.. just share the specials, make valid recommendations if I ask, and bring on the food. BCP is a classic staple in my book. 

They also have an outdoor patio which is really nice when there's good weather.
author: Lauren Y.

description: What a lovely french bistro with excellent food.  The restaurant is pretty small so expect to be cozy.  We had steak frites and cioppino.  Everything was delicious, including the bread to start.  I had a mushroom soup to start that was velvety and not too heavy at all.  Service was friendly and efficient.  We'll definitely be back!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Awesome neighborhood French Bistro! We live a few blocks away and love coming here for dinner.

Everything on the menu is amazing- my fav is the beef tartar. Service is excellent!

Outdoor enclosed patio is great for dining. And you can bring your pooch!
author: Andrea T.

description: Very educated service. She was able to help guide us towards inspiring dishes with authentic ingredients. The food was amazing. We had the eggs Benedict and croche monsieur. Absolutely delicious.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Excited about the reviews on the food. Went last night with bf and another couple. Food was very good but service surprisingly unfriendly if not down right rude. Only 3 stars because of this. Whenever I read about bad service, I usually ignore it because I feel it only applies to people who are not being very nice to the restaurant staff as well. In this case people were correct.  Service is not the nicest. I won't get into it but trust me service sucks.  

If you only care about the food then it is pretty good, not amazing but very good.

My favorite dish was my bf's duck confit. Leg/thigh combo with nice crispy skin over bacon lentils and I think some wine reduction sauce that you pour yourself. Yummy

My risotto with scallops was very good as well, though the scallops could have used more searing.  Rice was perfectly cooked though.

My friend's filet mignon was very good.  The filet was perfectly cooked and very tender.

The warm Brie with roasted garlic appetizer was delicious

Muscles lacked flavor and were tiny.  Don't orden tris!

The Escargots bourguignon had way too much parsley. It overwhelmed the escargot. Do not bother with this dish.

Wine by the glass was very good.  Sauvignon blanc and this super bold yummy red were excellent.  We all had several glasses should have just gotten a bottle.

Anyway, I usually care about restaurants more for the food than anything else but the unfriendly unexcited service by not just one but 3 of the staff really turned us all off. Not sure if I would come back.
author: Mags P.

description: Four of us dined here recently and were excited to try this bistro after reading the great yelp reviews.  The service was terrible!  Even though there were only about twenty other diners in the restaurant our waiter continually ignored us.  We usually asked another waiter if we needed something.  The food was definitely average.  It lacked flavor and balance.
author: mi m.

description: This is a nice, quiet corner place that serves excellent French cuisine. Among their appetizers, I would vote 'yes' for their mussels, the squid salad and a 'maybe' for their escargot. The filet mignon with foie gras is something that should not be missed. Excellent service at every phase of the dining experience.
author: Rod D.

description:
Yum, yum yum. Went here for dinner and was only able to get a reservation at 8 pm (booked 3 weeks out) on Saturday night! After our dining experience I see why!

So for 1, the pictures online I found of the restaurant do not reflect the true ambience (looks light and sort of barren?). Hoever in reality the place is low-lit (at least for dinner), romantic, and very cozy. 

We had a full dinner (sampling of each course) and every course was scrumptious. My boyfriend had the filet and you literally could have cut it with a spoon... It was cooked to PERFECTION. Soooo delicious. Everything we had was so good, and the prices are SUPER reasonable for the quality of the food (I presume this is why it gets so packed).

I would absolutely recommend visiting this place!! And in fact I have to some friends who have also loved it. I would love to return with some of the foodies in my family. Cheers Bistro! I will see you again.
author: Ella A.

description:
This place has really reasonable prices. When I was here, I did not get the steak only because I feel the best steaks are at steakhouses. I got the rabbit and scallop risotto. The scallop risotto was so buttery and just a flavorful punch in your mouth.

I also got the sweetbreads which were lightly fried and crispy. I also got the dessert which were strawberries in balsamic vinegar (sounds gross but was so amazing).

I am definitely coming back here again and the prices of the wines are really good too. 

It did take 20 min to find parking so beware.
author: Grace C.

description:
I've probably driven past Bistro Central Parc a dozen times without ever knowing that it was a fine dining restaurant.  It is very easy to miss.  Luckily, I had the opportunity to try it for a work dinner and I was blown away by the quality of the food, the wine selection, and the overall service.  As soon as you walk in, you are greeted by dim candlelit tables and soft intimate chatter.  You'll notice right away that this place is not well suited for large parties, but would be an excellent venue for dates or smaller parties.  The whole place seats maybe a maximum of fifty heads.  We came on a Thursday night, and there was already quite a long line.

Mussels in white wine:  A
Standard starter dish.  Broth tasted great; mussels were not overcooked at all.  Dip the bread in the broth for extra flavor.

Filet Mignon w/ Foie Gras:  A+
The filet itself was a nice thick cut and was cooked to a perfect medium rare.  Resting above it was a generous serving of foie gras, cooked tender.  This was topped with a crown potato chips fresh from the fryer.  Presentation alone made me do a double take, and the first bite had me sold.  In my book, this scored a perfect (very rare).

Crème Brulee:  A
Very standard crème brulee.  I was impressed that the carmelized sugar did not leave my mouth with a 'burnt' taste; it was prepared carefully and perfectly.

For the most part, I had a most pleasant experience at this establishment.  For a fine dining venue, their portions are quite generous and the service was outstanding.  I will definitely be back here to try other dishes.  I can do nothing else but recommend this place to anyone in the area looking for some great cuisine and nice ambient date environment.

PROTIP:  Ask for chef specials.
author: David C.

description: BCP is why I live in a bigger city. It's in the middle of a neighborhood, non-descript, and has the best service and food in town. The beef tartar is the best you'll find in SF, I'll even stretch it to say Northern CA. It's delicious! My husband always gets the Rossini and I the Steak et Pommes Frites! This place is so on point.
author: SF M.

description: Excellent moules mariniere for brunch. Mussels were large, plump, and fresh, and served with a side of frites. They seemed to be nicely arranged on the plate as well. Not sure if that was intentional but it was a pleasant touch. A few slices of bread would be nice to soak up all the beautiful juices. I'd come back for dinner.
author: Kwoky L.

description: I've been attempting to go for a while. It's been booked up every time, until tonight! The biggest issue was the service. They waitress was cold and took a long while before taking our drink and food orders. Everything we ordered was delicious and they did make a key substitution. All in all, it was great. We loved the ginger carrot soup, and the salmon with crispy skin in orange berre blanc sauce. I will go back. Perhaps the aloof service was on purpose - authentic French waitstaff behavior?
author: Andrew K.

description:
I was panicking to find a place to eat for my fiance's birthday. It was in the middle of the week and I just couldn't find anything that was different and special.

I took a shot on this place and I'm so glad that I did. 

We had so much fun. The restaurant is small and cozy. We had a nice table by a window. Our server was so nice to us and helped us order since we're not French food connoisseurs. I enjoyed the risotto with ratatouille that I ordered, but my fiance's filet mignon was amaaaaaazinggggg. We had delicious wine. It was a bit noisy but in a good way. It reminded me of being in a bustling outdoor cafe in Paris. 

At the end of the meal the waitress put a candle on a plate with little beignets (SOOO GOOD) and had the restaurant sing "Happy Birthday" which was very touching. 

A wonderful experience and a lot of really great memories from a weeknight birthday dinner. 

A little too pricey for me to eat here on a regular basis, but will always be in my thoughts for special occasions.

Thank you Bistro Central Parc!!
author: Sarah G.

description:
I was really impressed with this place. Our waiter was so sweet and very attentive. I like when a french restaurant is oozing with a french vibe. The head cook is french, waitstaff for the most part, is french, and the owner is french. I went to Chez Papa in the same week and unfortunately it didn't offer the same vibe. 

The mussels with a creamy white wine and garlic is so yummy. The mussels are nice and juicy and the sauce is very flavorful. We even used our bread to soak up more of the sauce even though we knew it would fill us up. We just didn't want it to go to waste!

For dinner, I had the scallop risotto and my friend had the steak. We were floored at the complexity of tastes in both dishes.  

I was dying to try the seared foie gras but my friend wasn't a fan. That's definitely what I'll be trying next time I go - which I hope is soon. 

The owner even came by our table during dinner to see how we were doing. I really love this place!
author: Emily Y.

description:
I think I was taking this place for granted! I owe a fair review of this eatery.

First of all -- delicious everything. Recap of dinner for 4:
- French Onion Soup served to French Onion Soup fanatic -- she loved it!
- Duo of Salmon Tartare - creamy and light yet flavorful
- Escargot - buttery and garlicky
- Trio of Foie Gras - not served daily, on Friday and Saturdays mostly -- try it!
- Duck breast - very tasty, a bit gam-y
- Trio of lamb - tender baby lamb meat
- Filet Mignon topped with Foie Gras - to fall in love with

After several successful dinners here we decided to try their brunch:
- Egg Benedict
- Croque Madame
- French toast 

They don't accept reservation for Brunch though OpenTable -- so call instead.

Everything was fantastic. Love this place
author: Anelya S.

description: Excellent grilled sweetbreads as an appetizer and tournedos rossini for the entree. My wife order risotto ratatouille which had an nice texture. The service and drinks were nice. My only wish was an expanded beer selection.
author: John H.

description:
I came here on a Thursday night and called at 8:30 and was able to get a table for 7 for 9pm. 
It was quite busy but we were greeted with a friendly maître'D and was seated. 
The food is finefrench cuisine - lots of good wines to accompany including the Pouilly Fusse 2011. 
Service is great and well priced. The wild mushroom risotto is perfection along with the fish of the day which was the mahi mahi. 
Highly recommend this place!
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
The food was excellent and the service was fantastic. 
It's been a while since I came here so I can't name all the dishes that I tried but all I remember is how DELICIOUS the filet mignon with foie gras was!!!! Oh and the creme brulee was amazing as well! Definitely needs to come back again soon for the filet mignon, YUM!
author: Becky W.

description: Avoid this place on weekend evenings. They overbook, and then will "politely" ask you to free your table as soon as you are finished. So much for the friendly conversations and convivial atmosphere, you are here to eat, pay, and go. Then, avoid this place with children, there are no kids menus anyway. Last, avoid this place if you want a quiet classy dinner because tables are all really close together and the room is very loud. A disappointing dining experience for us, unfortunately.
author: Herve G.

description: Came for a good Sunday morning meal and they didn't disappoint. The salmon Benedict was good, eggs Florentine was really good, and the French toast was excellent. Staff was very welcoming, so everyone should be able to enjoy a great Sunday brunch.
author: Jonathan E.

description: A hidden gem. We had escargots, mussels and onion soup for lunch. Everything was cooked to perfection. Perfect place to enjoy a nice brunch in this low key restaurant.
author: Christina L.

description: We came here for dinner after hearing from a friend how delicious it was. Lived up to the expectations!! First of all its always comforting to dine in a French restaurant when the chef and servers are actually French. They add a little, je ne sais quoi, flair to an already delightful experience. Food speaks for itself. Ordered the beef tartate with quail egg. DELICIOUS. No stomach aches the day after. Roasted beet salad with  goat cheese and lamb chops were divine! I usually don't go for lamb, especially rare but it was just simply made to perfection. The whole meal with drinks was reasonably priced. I enjoyed dining here and even got a greeting from the owner himself!
author: Caye Q.

description: love it ! and will def be back. The food was amazing, the service was okay.
author: Lana G.

description:
Love Bistro Central Parc. We've dined here for both dinner and brunch on a number of occasions and each time the experience and the food exceed the prior occasion. 

During our most recent visit we shared the curry muscles (Moules au curry Madras), my husband had the risotto with scallops (Risotto aux coquilles St Jacques) and I had the duck breast (Magret de Canard). Everything was delicious and presented beautifully. For dessert we shared the Volcan de Chocolat - it was excellent.

We highly recommend Bistro Central Parc - Jacques runs a truly incredible restaurant and maintains an intimate environment that is respectful and considerate of each patron.
author: Katherine K.

description:
I found my favorite restaurant!!
My husband and I were so happy on the first dinner visit, and we came back after that week again.

We ordered mushroom soup (soup of the day) and duck breast, of course, with pommes frites! The soup was very creamy with lots of mushroom flavor. Good start! The duck breast was cooked perfectly as medium (we love duck, once we find it on menus, we definitely order it). French fries, thin, very crispy, perfect. VERY authentic!!!
Their service was really friendly, like bistros in France. 
I can't wait to go back there again!
author: Amy K.

description:
I've never been to Paris, but Bistro Central Parc is everything I imagine its homey little cafés and brasseries to be. 

The owner (I presume) will greet you at the door.  The place itself is quaint, but no fuss, with a simple one-sided menu and specials on the board.  My favorites are the French onion soup, frisée salad with lardons and a poached egg, and wild mushroom risotto.  D's inevitable go-to is always the scallop risotto in lobster sauce.  Also, don't pass up the fries.  They just may hands down be the best I've had.  And, if you're lucky, someone dining with you will order the mussels, so you can dip your fries in the sauce (or use the complimentary warm, crusty bread to sop it up!  Too bad we're not mussel fans).

Service is friendly and attentive without being overbearing.  And I love the extra little touch for birthdays - they'll flicker the lights while singing you cheer, serve you an on-the-house dessert, and hand over a gift - a branded mug.  Cute touch to commemorate your visit.
author: Mel T.

description: We went to this restaurant as a second choice, after not being able to get into our first choice, and we were so glad. The food was excellent, as well as the service. The atmosphere was warm and inviting.  We will definitely go again.
author: Ruth M.

description:
This is, quite literally, my favorite restaurant of all time. All time!

Bistro Central Parc is quaint, and the service is sweet. We've since been twice, and the service, and dinner, each time were superb. The salads are a great starter, as well as their French Onion Soup. For dinner, I selected their scallop risotto; which is so excellently made that I ordered both night's we frequented. My husband is more adventurous and tried one of their specials each time and both times he loved it. 

They have an awesome chocolate desert that you must order (it's the option that you have to order early; don't know the exact name but it runs out fast!).

Bistro Central Parc is a MUST!
author: Abbey V.

description: Amazing, highly recommend the filet mignon with foie gras. The level of service is exceptional as it the food. Wish I could keep this place a secret as it is too good to share.
author: Olga B.

description:
Lovely French bistro in the residential area of NOPA near the GGP. Parking is a bit hard, but definitely worth it. Price and portion and quality is outstanding.

*Mussels Marinieres (white wine) $12.50 [2 of 5] A little bland, but not bad. But probably won't reorder or recommend to others.
*Escargots Bourguignon $9.50 [4 of 5] Good. Nothing bad to say. 
*Steak Frites (New York Steak) $19.50 [4 of 5] Great. Everything done right. Great piece of meat and delicious smoke flavor. Wonderful for a new york cut of steak. 
*Tournedos Rossini (Filet Mignon with Seared Foie Gras) [5 of 5] Special on the black board, but delicious. Wonderfully cooked and a definite re-order.
*Dessert Chocolate Lava Cake [4 of 5] - yummy
*Dessert Poached Pear [3 of 5] - ok
*Dessert Apple Tart [3.5 of 5] - yummy

I have to comment in addition to their wonderful dishes, they also serve wine and beer. I think this place gave the biggest glass of red wine ever. And their desserts were so beautifully. They use a lot of sugar melting and forming swirls. It is impressive. Eventhough, the swirl doesn't taste great, but the dessert were definitely beautiful and fun to try. We tried their Chocolate Lava Cake, Poached Pear, and Apple Tart. They were all wonderful.
author: Janice T.

description:
Yummy~!! This is a nice and warm place for dinner with your lover or good friends. It's totally classic french bistro style, you can enjoy there as your home. 
Baked Brie is great for appetizer. If you love baguette and cheese, you'll love it.  
Magret de Canad is amazing one. I love it so much. I never had duck so juicy before, it would out of your imagination. 
Scollop Risotto is highly recommendation at all. Scollop is fresh and with creamy risotto which are perfectly matching. 

Perfect night!!
author: Virna M.

description: I love Bistro Central Parc! Went here a few months ago for my birthday and it was so much fun! They give you free dessert and a free mug! The service is exceptional and the owner is the sweetest man. Also, the food is so delicious. The escargot, bouillabaisse, and risotto really hit the spot.
author: Kerry N.

description:
We've been here 3 special occasions in a row this year and that really speaks to how much we adore BCP.  The food is spot on.  Nothing over the top.  Just consistent, well put-together dishes that don't disappoint.  Love that they always have different specials and we've tried a few.  The stuffed quail and ribeye specials are awesome!  

Service is great too.  The owner (I think?) is usually there to ask how your meal went and gives you a warm handshake before you leave.  All the servers are friendly and ready to give recommendations.  We've also never been charged for something that took a long time to arrive.

Prices are beyond reasonable for what you get.  We'd easily rack up twice the bill for half the food in many comparable places in the city.  

What's not to love about this place?!  I can't wait to try their brunch menu.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Holy Moly.

I LOVE french food. I go to paris just for the food.  I frequent french restaurants: chapeau, chez spencer, masa's, fluer de lys, la folie, bouchon.. you get what I'm trying to say. 

I had SUCH a wonderful dinner here. The ambiance is very casual and a bit small, but the food and the waitstaff more than made up for it.  

sweetbread: best sweetbread dish with the perfect demi glace I've ever had

mussles: perfectly plump with a broth that you want to shove down your throat

duck breast: perfectly cooked medium rare.  I always compare all duck dishes to jardiniere's, since it's my fav.. I'm so used to being disspointed by dishes, it was hard to realize this was actually BETTER than jardiniere's! 

duck confit: my husband got this: I'm not a confit girl, but even he said my breasts were better  ;)

great glass of a blend recommended.

***BEWARE.  our friend was supposed to join us, but he went to bistro central park instead of bistro central parc.  becareful! it's akward when your friend calls from san mateo wondering he's not seeing you....
author: Hannah W.

description:
This place was absolutely amazing!!!

Me and my beautiful fiancé came here for a romantic dinner and were nothing less than amazed. 

I had the French onion soup, the filet mignon and the balsamic strawberry dessert. The French onion soup was perfectly made. Tons of flavor. 

The filet was a perfect medium rare and the peppercorn sauce was quite good

The only corrective comment I would mention is that I think the servers should smile more but that's about it. 

Thanks for the great experience!!
author: Spencer L.

description:
I just love this place. My husband took me over to celebrate my birthday last night. No reservations but they were able to sit us in 10 min. Incredibly kind and attentive as usual and dinner was perfect from start to finish! 

I've been going here for a few years and the only reason I've waited this long to write a review was because I didn't care for the waiters. I went despite them because the food is great and the maitre d' is awesome.  It appears they've turned over the wait staff since my visit last fall and the new staff is lovely. Well deserving of a 5 star rating on all fronts!
author: Megan P.

description:
5 stars on taste alone, but this place is not without issues.  It's just that 4 stars is too low.

So it was my girlfriends and my 4 year anniversary and we usually do something simple, but I wanted to take it up a notch but not to a point that I'd be really broke.  

So, we'll start w/ the issues because it there are just a few and the first one happened in the beginning.  So, I made a reservation about a week before and they confirmed it a few days before our dinner, but when we showed up the reservation was no where to be found!  Luckily, they had a table for us anyways (although it was still quite busy).  They were apologetic throughout the entire dinner, but I was still a little annoyed because it was our anniversary and I looked at a number of restaurants to find the right one.  Next is the price.  Yes, I wanted to go up on the price and I was ok with it because it was a really special occasion and for one appetizer, a half a bottle of wine, two main entrees, and a creme brulee desert, we got over $130.  That was the price I was aiming for, but this certainly wouldn't be a once a month sort of meal for 2 grad students.

On to the good stuff.  The service was great, a little on the slow side since they only had 2 servers, but they were courteous and they were actually French (or they were pretending with a french accent and hella pulling it off).  The service had a feel of being upscale without being snobby or pretentious, as if the waiters were trained in a 5 star restaurant but had left for a smaller, more low key place. One moment that I thought was actually pretty classy was that when the waiter brought out our half bottle of wine, he poured a little bit of wine for me to sample.  So I felt it was adorable because 1) I've been a student (undergrad, masters, M.D.) for a long time, so it is really, really rare that I experiencing something as fancy as this because I'm perpetually poor.  2)  He gave it to me as a sense of masculine chivalry even though my palette is horrible and my girlfriend's is much better.  3)  He didn't seem snooty about it at all, just as if I had been 20 years older and much more accomplished than I actually was.  It was just class all around!

The food was simply phenomenal.  We started with a simple role which was a little harder than I would have liked but still quite tasty.  We then shared the baked brie which came with a baked head of garlic, diced tomatoes, and 4 small slices of toasted baguette which was subtle but still enjoyable.  My girlfriend then went with the risotto and poached scallops which was creamy yet bold.  The Scallops were perfect, not too chewy or watery.  The risotto was a bit overcooked for my tastes, but my girlfriend loved it.  I had the ratatouille and lamb chops.  It was the best lamb chops I have ever tasty, and I have had a lot of lamb chops.  Mine was medium rare and spiced, marinated, cooked, and served to perfection.  The ratatouille came with a sauce that was sweet, savory, sharp, and with a hint of spice all at once, I couldn't quite nail down on specific flavor.  It also came with a hashtag shaped pretzel and a hush puppy like thing that was tasty.  It wasn't a super tiny amount like I imagine most fancy places would be and we were filled up quickl.  We finished with the creme brulee which while not the best I've ever had, still ranks in my top 5.

Overall, it was the perfect place for what I was looking for.  It's probably too pricey for most college/grad students to do more than once or twice a year but not so expensive that it is impossible to go to.  It is a little on the small side and cramped, but not uncomfortably so.  The service was great and classy but not snooty, the food was simply top notch and erased any other issues I had with the place.
author: Vincent-Arthur B.

description:
Quaint little place, went on a Thursday night and was able to get a table right away around 8pm.

Food: 
Spicy squid salad - 5/5 delicious and good amount, squid was very tender

Beef cheeks - 5/5 very flavorful and tender
 
Olive oil sponge cake - 0/5 coated with cheap icing (Safeway kind, in fact some cakes at Safeway are better than that cake!), and unnaturally sweet 

Service: 
4/5 good 

Ambiance:
5/5 small cozy place 

Taking one star off because of the cake
author: Penny Z.

description:
Consistent, hearty, quality French food, hidden away in a little neighborhood in NoPa.   I've had dinner twice and brunch once at Bistro Central Parc, and its food has always shined.  Almost don't want to share, because I want to keep this gem to myself!

Love hearing the authentic French accents when you call to make a reservation (for brunch we just walked in and sat outside with our dog on a nice sunny Bay-to-Breakers morning, but it's always safe to call ahead for dinner -- they're always packed!) and service is always warm and quick.  

Sharing with my man over the course of several spectacular meals, we've had their moules frites (steamed mussels with fries), croque madame, beef cheek, magret de canard (duck breast), ris de veau (sweetbreads), steak frites, carré d'agneau (rack of lamb), escargots, duo of salmon tartare, and scallop risotto -- and it's saying a lot that in each dish, ingredients were fresh and prepared splendidly, the right flavors stood out and others melded correctly, and all in all bravo to the chef!  La très bonne bouffe, indeed.  

Prices are reasonable, and they have a nice wine list with some imports that you don't see often (case in point: a Muscat de Beaumes-de-Venise, a teeny little village in Provence that produces a phenomenal muscat dessert wine).

Perfect for that cozy, down-to-earth date or a nice spot to bring your family.  Bistro Central Parc won't disappoint!
author: Cherry L.

description: Our first visit to this terrific French bistro after an evening visit to the DeYoung.  Great location -- real neighborhood feel.  Outside tables available for warmer evenings, or with heaters for the more typical SF nights, but the inside is lovely, too.  Loved the warm welcome when we arrived and the service throughout was spot on.  Nice selection of wines, and I'm always a sucker for a place where I can start with a Kir or Kir Royale.  We split the baked brie to start and wow was it yummy -- it disappeared almost as fast as they could set it down!  I had the roast chicken, which was unbelievable -- perfectly cooked and served on a wonderful selection of fresh vegetables.  The husband had the beef cheeks, which he is still talking about -- I had to stop him before he picked up the plate and licked it -- no -- I'm not kidding.  Big portions -- go hungry -- plenty to take home.  This is now on our list of go to's and we will be back again and again.  Love It!
author: Lisa W.

description:
