Both the dishes we tried, the cornish hen, and lamb shank, were spectacular and very flavorful, the pear/chocolate dessert was a nice ending, and even though i was full, finished everything! The owner/chef is so sweet and greets each guest as does he say goodbye.
I live in the 'hood and this place is frequently packed so make a reso... Would love to go back and try more... maybe an earlier dinner or brunch!
author: Nora S.

description: The food here was delicious but I was really disappointed by the service of an individual who was rude from the beginning. I came here on a Sunday with a large group. We reserved for a certain amount but ended up with two less people. When our waitress found out we came with two less people she gave us attitude and said she now had to change the table settings. When we all got seated a few mins later our waitress tried to have people move so she could grab the extra table out but my friends didn't want to move. She said she needed the extra table for other customers but the place was not full. In fact there was seating available during the duration of our hour and half stay. You could tell she was having a bad day or had some kind of attitude problem. We also had to ask for our menus. I found the other server Armando to be more helpful and friendlier. Besides that the Monsieur with eggs was great and the salmon and pommes frites were a favorite too!
author: mai l.

description: Jacques and his wife have succeeded in creating a  friendly local bistro - bustling and known for great food. He seems to know almost all his customers. Prompt efficient service. This is a dream come true for the owners and the neighborhood. Codfish appetizer, lamb shank, onion soup, and fish stew are all tops. Reservations a must for dinner.
author: Fred  D.

description: This is a WONDERFUL spot!  The service is fantastic.  Very local flavor and the owners are alway around chatting and making you feel at home.  The food is delicious, and the specials are always creative and out of this world.  They often have trout, rabbit, and other fun things to enjoy.  Their flavors are interesting and the drink/wine list is great.  Check it out!
author: Dan N.

description:
My friend and I came here for dinner on a day trip to San Francisco.

I called in to see if there was a parking lot, and they told me that there is very limited street parking. Instead, he suggested to park in Lucky's parking lot around the block, since there is two hours free parking there.

The host was very friendly. He saw us looking on our phones on Yelp to see what others thought was good and told us to just go for whatever we like. 

I ended up getting the scallops and lobster risotto. The scallops were delicious, cooked perfectly. The risotto was a little creamy for me, but it was still good.

My friend got the rack of lamb with ratatouille. The lamb was soo good. I think I actually liked my friend's dish more. The salad came in a cute little cheese cup too. :)

For dessert, we got a creme brulee. I wish the restaurant was closer so I could get some more lamb and creme brulee. DELICIOUS. I would definitely be down to come here again. Yum yum yum :)
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This place was so good! I went there for my birthday and had a really great meal. The atmosphere was great - casual, relaxing, unpretentious for a French restuarant. The service was great - most were french so understanding them was the tough part.

The food:
Mussels were really good, as were the pommes frites. The lobster risotto was a little undercooked, but I think it was just a bad night. I ordered the filet mignon with foie gras - amazing! Melts in your mouth...all in all, a really great restaurant!

The downside is that if you're sitting close to the door, it is a bit chilly. But the food and the wine was great. And I got a mug as a birthday present! I definitely recommend this place if you want some good French.
author: Zarpana K.

description:
The food was very good, and the prices were very reasonable.  Just keep in mind that my opinion for this one might be a bit skewed however, because a friend of a friend worked there that night.

Menu is very classic French.  Don't expect anything new or cutting edge there.  However, the ingredients and care they put into it are also very French - as in, the French take their food very seriously. 

This is the one rare French restaurant where I got my food for under $50, and it was worth it.  

(Rating is really a 4.5, but what the heck, good people there!)
author: Mark M.

description:
WE LOVED THIS PLACE.

We came here for a dinner after our intimate wedding in Alamo Square Park, and we were looking for the perfect meal. We found it!

The owner greeted us as soon as we walked in, and immediately got us glasses of Champagne to celebrate our recent wedding! (Although he did charge us for them later...that was kind of a bummer..)

The food and service were impeccable:

1. Foie gras 2 ways (5 STARS)
2. Braised beef cheeks (5 STARS)
3. Steamed mussles (5 STARS)
4. Creme Brulee (5 STARS)

Will definitely be back!! Thanks for making our post-wedding dinner so delicious and memorable!
author: Emm P.

description:
I went here with a friend and we absolutely adored this restaurant. It's very quaint and the ambiance has the feel of a small, cozy kitchen.

But the food. OH THE FOOD! It's outstanding. We ate so much I thought I'd need a wheelbarrow to get me home. 

We started with the Galette de Pomme de Terre, Crie chaud (melted brie spread over a potato pancake on a mizuna salad). Divine. 

Next up was the Rissoto aux Coquille St. Jacques, which is rissoto and scallops laid in a pool of lobster sauce. This was incredibly rich and creamy. Heavenly.

Then we devoured Poussin a l'americain, jus de poulet -- Cornish hen, potatoes and bacon.

For dessert?  Molten chocolate cake.

I will DEFINITELY be back.
author: Lauren F.

description:
This place is WAYYYYYY over rated!  I came here with high expectations after reading the many Yelp reviews.  My taste buds for French cuisine are a little more critical as well due to the fact that I grew up in Tahiti, a French island, where French cuisine is very preponderant.

I came here on a date with my husband, and we pretty much left the place agreeing that we wouldn't come back to this place again, though close in proximity.  It wasn't about the service (which was pleasant and quite attentive), it wasn't about the ambiance (which was booming, lively though a bit too loud to our liking), it was all about the food.

Appetizers:
1. We chose the classic Escargots: I don't know if it was because they ran out of parsley but the "Cuisto" decided to put some other herbs in there and it just didn't do it for me.  When I choose Escargots, I expect the powerful classic taste of a pleasantly roasted chewy concoction of garlic, parsley and buttered "meat".  My first bite left me thinking: "What IS that taste?!"  Not a good start.
2. We opted for the trio of Salmon: presentation great, but taste - I could have done that out of my own kitchen.  And I really looked for the "Third" salmon... couldn't.  I saw the smoked salmon wrapped around the tartare, which makes two types only. 

Entrees:
1. At this point, I really looked forward to the main meal to see what this place has to offer based on the great reviews by many customers.  I chose the special of the day "Fish Trio - salmon, cod and scallop - with orange sauce and polenta."  I liked this one.  But there was no "WOW factor" taste as experienced at "Chapeau."  
2. My husband went for one of his favorite picks: "Steak Frites".  We were surprised how chewy the steak was, for a place such as this. The accompanying sauce, green peppercorn sauce wasn't strong enough to make him "forget" the texture of the meat.  

Desserts:
1. Surely desserts will make it all up!  I saw so many beautiful pics of desserts taken from this place.  I was still hopeful! First choice: "Poire Belle Helene" (Pear).  My husband chose this one out of curiosity.  Wow, it's pretty much a poached pear, drizzled with melted dark chocolate and voila: $7.50!
2. Tarte Tatin (French Apple Pie): a beautiful vision, wonderfully presented.  No doubt about it.  Taste: good. But again no "WOWs".

Vraiment decue (Really disappointed) -
author: Nadine M.

description:
Great food.  Great atmosphere.  Very reasonable price.  

We went there for our anniversary dinner.  My hubby ordered Kobe Beef Tartar and the Italian Seafood Stew.  He loved it!  I ordered French Onion Soup and Braised Beef.  Those were great also.   

Service was very friendly.   We'll definitely go back again.
author: Meg L.

description: I love this place, the chef Nicolas Jardin is simply amazing. One of my favorite french joint in the city. And this is coming from a french person :)
author: Remi M.

description:
I biked by one evening, and noticed the glow coming from inside this little neighborhood spot. Had to check it out.

The prix fixe before 7 pm is a great deal for under $20. That's fine French food, elegantly presented, in a nice atmosphere and good service.

I enjoyed the mussel soup, scallops and risotto, and the trout - though I realize I like flakier white fish now.  

Will def be back for another prix fixe menu.  And will revise to a 5 rating if it's great again.
author: c t.

description: Another great dinner here! I had the beef tartar for an appetizer and the scallops over rissoto for dinner. Both delicious!
author: Traci H.

description:
I've driven by this Bistro a few times and have meant to try it out. The food is excellent and the service staff are really sweet and attentive.

I'll be going back soon, which is as good a measure as any for how much I like a restaurant.
author: Mark H.

description: Omg these guys were all amazing!! I went in there thinking I was surprising my sisters for one of their birthdays flew up from palm desert , this after my 6 am flight was delayed for five hours ,took bart and a cab to get to the restaurant, I asked the great and friendly host, Alex, if my sisters were here and he says " no we don't have any reservations" and then remembers someone had called and cancelled a reservation,one of my sisters were sick no birthday celebration and I was alone the staff made me feel sooo welcome I was treated like family my niece came and met me we had a lovely brunch the owner is wonderful and I will go back there in a heartbeat no more surprises though that's for sure!!!'the mussels were great the tomato salad was amazing and the mimosas were fabulous!!!
author: terri h.

description:
Love this place. 

The service is great, the food is delicious, very well priced and lovely ambiance. 

Great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Pamela S.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in the city.

I initially thought that it was going to be expensive to eat here, but the price was not so bad for the quality of the food.  I went here with five other friends for a farewell dinner.

Their appetizers were delicious!  I wish they were part of the main course so I could have more of them.  Lol.  We ordered the goat cheese and mushroom tart, which was my favorite, and the mussels.  I don't usually eat shellfish, but everyone was raving about it that I had to try one.  I actually enjoyed it!  It was well-cooked, savory, and doesn't have that strong "fishy/seawater" taste in it, which I don't like.  I found myself wiping the plate clean with a piece of bread because the sauce was too good to waste.  

I ordered the lobster and scallop risotto, which a friend recommended, and it was just mouth-watering.  The serving looks small, but it was rich, and after finishing the dish, I found that it was filling--just the right amount.  I tried my friend's bouillabaisse.  It was a little too salty for me, but the meat was tender and cooked well.

The desserts were good too, but nothing out of the ordinary.  I can't remember what we ordered because they didn't really stand out compared to the appetizers and main dish.  The service was great; the owner came to check on our table, and the waitress made sure we were attended to.  The place is pretty small, and I bet they could get crowded during the weekends, but we went there on a weekday night, so we were luckily able to get seats.  I would definitely go back again.
author: Samantha A.

description: Wifey took me here for a date dinner. Great sweet breads and cassoulet. Wifey's bouillabaisse was very good, but not quite as good as the rest of the meal. Will definitely be back to try some more of their tasty menu.
author: Mike G.

description:
Bistro Central Parc is an amazing addition to the North Panhandle neighborhood. Generally the food is superior, truly one of the better french restaurants in the city. The Bistro excels at their sauces. Every single sauce I have tried is a work of edible art. The Bistro also begs for me to bring out the Devils advocate. Things here are just a little bit off. The food is really excellent, but food this good cries for perfection, so when things are a touch off, it is a bigger disappointment than it should be. The Mixed green salad is purely greens, just too simple. The cornish hen was too dry, but the bacon potatoes were sublime. The Filet Mignon was a touch too peppery, but their pommes frities were perfection. The French onion soup looked to be perfection, and my companions insisted the escargots were the best. I look forward to trying the Duck and hope they bring back the Beef Bourguignon. 

   The room is a stark rectangle. A serious lack of ambiance. The room is loud, given the space it could never be anything other than loud. The service is slow, but the staff is all very friendly. They serve beer and wine but these menus are too limited. 4 or 5 beers a couple dozen bottles of wine. A little on the pricey side for a neighborhood bistro. 

  Bistro Central Parc will become a regular spot of mine. A perfect place to bring out of towners, family or the occasional date.
author: Christopher N.

description:
I just had dinner there with 2 friends last night and we were all blown away at how delicious the food was. As experienced foodies, we walked in with no expectations but left very impressed. We tried 6 appetizers and had delicious satisfaction with every bite. We'll be back for lots more. Probably will try everything on the menu. The 3 of us with 6 plates and 3 glasses of wine, bill totaled $110. Affordable!

The salad with potato pancake and brie on top was delightful. Dressed perfectly with a slightly sweet vinaigrette that had essence of fennel. Huge portion too!

The mushroom galette was super tasty!

Split Pea soup - best I've had ever.

Mussels with wine and parsley - perfectly done and the broth was amazing.

Mushroom risotto - had lots of flavor however I thought the rice could have been a little softer. It was just al dente, good if you like it that way. It wasn't as creamy as I'd hoped.

Salmon tartare - this was a star dish. Salmon tartare wrapped with smoked salmon and topped with salmon roe! Fabulous!
author: Foodie F.

description: My spouse and I were in the mood for some good French cuisine. After researching our options we thought we would try Bistro Central Parc. Before I continue with this review, let me first state that my man is a French cuisine trained Chef that has worked in the top most recognized restaurants in Paris, New York, Los Angeles, Napa (trained by Thomas Keller himself), San Diego and of course San Francisco. We make it a weekly habit to try out new spots in any city we visit - and are currently living in San Francisco. Seldomly do we come across a place that blows us away or impresses us all the way from service to food to decor, but this Bistro certainly left us satisfied and pleased. We had multiple dishes and a bottle of wine, all excellently prepared. The chef did an amazing job in the kitchen. The owner was friendly and hospitable, checking in on us and talking to my chef about his history etc. The service was impeccable. The entire restaurant was clean, warm and inviting. The food was simply delicious and a good representation of French cuisine. We will definitely go back. Decently priced, delicious with excellent service.
author: Tamira J.

description:
My husband and I were in San Francisco for 3 days. we took the Taxi there but there were no sign outside the building. Once we found the place the owner greeted us and the service is excellent and he is very friendly. The food was great and reasonable. My husband had filet mignon and I have the lamb chop. it was delicious. 
We stayed at the hotel in Union Square and the owner told us that there was a bus stop just a block from his place and we tool the bus back for $4 instead of $13 Taxi.
author: agnes l.

description:
Great little jewel in an area that is desperately needing more restaurants!  Jacques (owner), I believe that's his name, is very friendly with patrons.  The place probably has 20+ tables and bar seating as well.

The food is simple and delicious French.  And the prices are affordable. Steak Frites for under $20!  The fish of the day when we went was trout in almond sauce.  Very good.

Overall, highly recommended.  The place is 2 blocks from our house, we'll def. be going back!
author: Hui C.

description:
I live right down the street from this little jem and have watched over the past year+ as this building has been converted from a burned down eyesore into the beautiful building it is today.  

Even better, Bistro Central Parc has moved in and added such a great little haven in our neighborhood.  My best friend and I finally got a chance to visit this great place last night for a few glasses of wine and dinner.  We were greated at the door, seated at the lovely bar and were attended to very well for the entire evening.  Jacques (whom I'm guessing is the owner) and Julian (the bartender/waiter) who attended to us were both wonderul.  The food was impeccably timed and perfectly prepared.  

We're planning to make this a weekly girls date night!  Thanks Bistro Central Parc!
author: Money L.

description:
Fantastic neighborhood spot. The food is excellent. The owners are very friendly and relaxed. The steak frites is my choice for dinner, and the french toast for brunch. 
It gets pretty crowded on the weekends, so you definitely need reservations.
author: Theodore N.

description:
Took my boyfriend here Friday night for his birthday.  We wanted just a nice, somewhat casual dinner, so when I saw this bistro on Yelp I thought it sounded perfect.  I wouldn't recommend this place for a destination dinner, like a special occasion if you want something fancy.  This restaurant is better for a date night or a group with friends.

I like to start with something positive, so the first thing I will say is that the second you step into this Bistro you literally feel like you're in a cafe' in Paris.  It has the noises, the smell, and the quaintness of everything a bistro should be.  

Unfortunately, we were not greeted warmly like the other Yelpers portrayed.  I stepped in and made eye contact with a tall guy who had a t-shirt tucked into jeans and a leather belt....he stepped away for a moment then separated 2 tables and came up to us and pointed and said "reservations?" I gave him my name and he pointed to one of the two tables he was giving us.  We walked over and sat down and the smile on my boyfriend's face told me I picked the right vibe for the night.

The food was great, but the lack of star is definitely due to the service.  

Food:

Filet with Foie Gras was great!

Escargot was great, but had a weird after taste (some sort of clove or warm spice I couldn't identify)

Cassoulet was better then I had in Paris!  The duck confit FELL off the bone and  the sauce was a tomato-based sauce that was so rich and had such great depth I will dream about it!  The cassoulet is more of an open-faced presentation with the bean/tomato stew on the bottom and the sausages and duck laid on top.

SERVICE Issues:

The attire was a little casual for my taste and did not reflect the beautiful food presentations.  (The server was in a tight graphic printed t-shirt, and jeans.) I ordered a bottle of Crozes Hermitage and was so excited that my boyfriend was going to split wine with me because he NEVER DRINKS WINE!  So I went for a Rhone because it is a good middle of the road wine and we both ordered 2 very different items.  I have had Crozes Hermitage many times before.  I excitedly order the wine and the server starts quizzing me about the grape varietal and the tasting notes.  So I told him my thoughts and he shouts "no...that is why I asked you it's very dry"  Ummmmm...okay....be that as it may.....there was a nicer way you could've told me that.  "Miss were you looking for a dry Rhone?  If not, I can recommend something else"  So now at this point I am embarrassed and he walks away and doesn't come back over till 5 minutes after our appetizers hit the table.  Normally I would just say "forget the bottle", but being that it was my boyfriend's birthday and I had a rude server I had to work with what I had.  He comes back and I said "pick a Rhone less dry with a similar price".  Server never came back and poured our wine once,which I thought was odd.  I normally tip anywhere from 20-30%...he got 18.

The server was however helpful helping us catch a taxi outside which was really nice and was very friendly when we parted.

If I was in the neighborhood I would definitely stop in again for a bite and try some other items, but would not go out of my way to come here again.
author: Heather D.

description: Very good food.  Great neighborhood spot with good service and reasonable prices considering the quality of food.  I work nearby and like that on weeknights you can easily make a same day reservation and get great food.   I have enjoyed the sweetbreads, the fillet, and the duck.
author: Miguel P.

description: Delicious! Been to Bistro Central Parc a few times for both brunch and dinner and every time has been great. Everything that I have tried has been yummy and the service is just as good...the owners are almost always there to greet their customers.  My favorites so far.. french toast, onion soup, seared salmon. Yum!
author: Janelle F.

description: Wine list pricing is such that you just get the proper wine, instead of worrying about costs.  It's lovely, simple, and accessible.  Escargot tasted of salt, Lamb Shank was beastly on the bone (not necessarily a bad thing) but drowned in an oily sauce.  The French Onion soup was sweet and delicate.  The Kobe tartare was great - not fantastic - but enjoyable and subtle, definitely not over-seasoned like some.  The filet mignon (in place of 86'd Steak frite) was gamey and tough to cut through.  Both dishes drowned, but I loved my green peppercorn sauce. Bistro style service, they do not bend over backwards, but rather breezy and make you feel welcome.  Affordable for level of food coming from the kitchen, and I just think we hit a bad night.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
4.5 stars.  Bistro Central Parc is an excellent addition to the North Panhandle.  Bistro Central Parc is a great place to bring out-of-town guests.  The space occupies the first floor of a Victorian in a charming and up-and-coming neighborhood.  

I ordered the filet and it was prepared wonderfully.  The sauce was excellent and flavorful.  The other menu items were also good but the steak was definetly the highlight.  
 
Can't wait to go back.
author: Moe J.

description:
Great neighborhood place, very good food, and a reasonable price! I'll start with my bias: We live 3 blocks away and really wanted this place to be good.  That said, it did not disappoint.  The service was top notch --more like France than SF, in terms of attention to detail and promptness.  The food was quite good.  

 It actually reminded me a lot of the neighborhood Bistros and Braseiries in France. The food was simple, well prepared, delicious, and surprisingly not too heavy.  I had Duck Breast with Cherry Sauce, a daily special.  My wife had the Pork Loin.  Neither of these sound like particularly light fare, but the sauces were not overwhelmingly rich, and the portions were very reasonable. 

At the end of a very good meal (with Wine!) we left for just under $100 --and feeling pleasantly full but not bloated.
author: E L.

description: Such a great, neighborhood gem. The brunch selection was excellent, and the meal was well prepared. As a heavy coffee drinker, I appreciated the real size coffee mugs.
author: Todd H.

description: delicious salmon tar tar, lamb was good, looking forward to trying brunch here
author: Tiff W.

description: Great service. Unreal value, usually such high level dish would cost 2x ro 3x what Bistro Central Parc cost.
author: ben j.

description: Mediocre.   Had dinner here that wasn't good or bad, just ahh.  Very nice wait staff, but the food was uninspired.  Wanted to like it more but just wasn't wowed.
author: Lucy P.

description:
Great local neighborhood place! Been here for brunch and everything is awesome. Def worth getting their coffee and eggs !
By far the most impressive poached eggs i have had on a consistent basis. plus their OJ is impressive. 

parking could be a challenge, but a must visit place.
author: A D.

description: Absolutely amazing. This inspired me to write my first ever Yelp review. The black cod special was succulent and  velvety, the wine was first rate and the lava cake was the best I've ever had, and I've had a lot of them. The service was friendly and unpretentious, and the prices really good. I don't want to recommend it in case i can't get a table there next time....
author: Peaches P.

description: Most amazing magret de canard that I ever had! The tomatoes were also completely unbelievably good. The fish dishes I tried were very good too, but did not blew my mind as much as the other dishes did. I feel like going back to san francisco just to go there!
author: Guillaume C.

description:
a cute place with a really cool vibe.  the french fries were awesome, because the french know how to do those.  the frisee salad with the egg on top and the lardon?  freaking excellent!  there was this appetizer of brie over a potato pancake that i could have eaten as a main also.  

the french onion soup was okay....i guess i really just don't like french onion soup.  everyone else really enjoyed their meals too.

the bday girl got a candle in her dessert and a mug, which was really nice of them.  overall a really cool restaurant with a neighborhood vibe to it.
author: Miss P.

description:
My first yelp review! Love Yelp and decided to join the conversation.
First meal of our 3 month stint in San Fran.
Went for brunch on Bay to Breakers Day. Great food, nice simple decor and an easy walk away. I had the salmon florentine and hubby had the croque monsieur.  Just what I needed after a long weekend of packing, driving & moving. One thing that bugged me - tables are really close together but staff was nice and service was good.
author: Moe L.

description: Excellent food and service!  Like a mini-Paris get away.  We went here for my husband's birthday dinner and it was the perfect cozy neighborhood restaurant.  Defininitely exceeded our expectations!  Bon Appetit!
author: Dana S.

description: Great place.  Food was wonderful, staff all very friendly and low key. Next time I'd go a little earlier in the evening, we went at peak time 7:30 or 8:00, and had a table of very enthusiastic women next to us.  They were lovely but a little loud - taking photos of the food etc.  Off peak hours you might miss the foodie fans, so if you prefer quiet that would be a good choice.  The place is not loud overall, we just happened to get a loud table.
author: Cheryl B.

description: Serene, delicious, and our server was awesome. If I lived nearby, I'd be a regular.
author: Molly C.

description: Great French food that is totally approachable. Casual but intimate atmosphere. Great owner, Jacques, and waiter Jerome.
author: Chuck V.

description:
I love this place!  

My new favorite place to go when in the City.  I went here for my birthday a few days ago.  The service was attentive without being overly so, the food was off the charts amazing and the prices were extremely reasonable (not that I paid for it on my birthday!).  

The owner visited our table several times and kissed us all on the cheeks as only the French can do.  He even gave me a mug as a birthday gift!  

I had the hangar steak with a Roquefort sauce and pomme frites.  Most restaurants are uncomfortable with the level of rare I want to see on my steak.  Not this place.  When I ordered, they asked me if I wanted it "blue" and I said "hell yes".  It was more like purple which is even better in my opinion.  Who needs steak tartare as an appetizer when you can have your whole entree that way????

I must admit I'm not really sure what anyone else at the table had, as I was so totally engrossed in my meal.  I do recall hearing lots of happy noises from around the table, so that must be a good sign.  

I also had a cup of the French onion soup as a starter.  Need I even say how exquisite that was?  The crust of cheese on top made me want to weep.  Long live the French and their devotion to cheese.  

For dessert, the chocolate volcano cake.  The words, they fail me.  The chef had decorated the plate so that it looked like stained glass.  I literally stared at it for a few moments before digging in because it was so pretty.  It tasted even better than the pretty picture it made.

The whole experience was so amazing we went back for brunch the next day.  My eggs Benedict put all others to shame.  The fresh orange juicy was wonderful also.  

All in all, I wish Yelp offered more stars because this place was off the charts.  We will be back just as soon as possible!
author: Tara T.

description: a great cozy neighborhood spot. Menu and theme is French inspired with staples like the onion soup, fois gras, ratatouille and the pommes frites to name a few. Went for dinner and wasn't too impressed with the frites but the fois gras and pork dishes were amazing. Staff was pleasant and knew a number of the other patrons by first name. They seemed genuine and really cared about our dining experience, something that you don't always see in this day of standard 30 minute waits...
author: Marcus L.

description: This is my favorite place to go eat. Everything on the menu is great. Whatever you choose you are going to love it. They are always busy, so I would make a reservation. Great service and friendly staff.
author: K S.

description: Highly Recommend. Starting with the friendly french owner to the AMAZING dessert (fraises a la modena) this was the perfect date night. The ambiance was warm, welcoming, cozy, neighborhood restaurant... the food was delicious. I had the Duck Magret, which was a unique spin on a classic, and she had the seafood risotto (heaven in every bite). The wine list was french, decent, and fairly priced. We will definitely go back.
author: Arif J.

description: Just absolutely super! I live a block away and have been there a dozen times. Food is always delicious -- I love their steaks, frites, and french onion soup! Service is warm and friendly. Prices are more than competitive. I recommend Bistro Central Parc to anyone for any occasion!
author: Kat R.

description: great food, great prices, great service!! went here for my moms birthday and was very pleased. the owner (I'm assuming) greeted us warmly and promptly sat us at our table. our server arrived shortly after to let us know specials that they had. we were overjoyed to see bone marrow as one of the specials and knew it was a must to order. 4 of us ended up getting the Kobe beef tartar (although I'm thinking they should change the name bc you can't get Kobe in the US), bone marrow, beet salad and gems with Roquefort and candied bacon, all to start. the bone marrow and tartar were my favorites, rich and flavorful. salads were good and portion size was just right for the prices, about $10 plus or minus. for entrees we ha the bouillabaisse, beef cheek, canard and mussels. I couldn't find a fault with any of the dishes. maybe instead of ordering fries on the side they could include a toast with the mussels or two and raise the price a few dollars to compensate. in the end we left happy and full. price for 4 with 2 glasses of wine and one dessert was about $190 including tip. we definitely ordered everything so I'm sure to eat there again I wouldn't be as extravagant. but I will be coming back!!!
author: Susan Z.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and am moving back east in about a month.  I am kicking myself for not visiting this place sooner!  My son and I had quite an adventure and I needed a glass of wine and some good food.  We got there at about 8pm on a Saturday night.  I was promptly greeted and told that there was only space at the bar but we were welcome to it.  No big deal, they had a booster so my son could see over the counter and the stools have backs.  They had a few dishes for kids.  My son got the chicken and french fries.  DELICIOUS!  I stole a few bites as I was cutting his food.  I wanted to try everything on the menue, but settled on the cornish hen.  Again, amazing!  I wished there was more sauce on the plate so I could lick it up.  

The staff was amazingly friendly.  One of the girls drew faces on corks for my son and he actually just brought them over to me as I was typing.  The woman at the bar that waited on us gave him crayons and paper to draw on.  Everyone was fussing over how cute he is and he LOVES attention so it was perfect.

I joked that they must have drugged my wine.  I don't think I've ever felt so good at the end of a meal.   Oh, and that kids dish was only $5!
author: Sarah S.

description:
walking into this restaurant brings me back to time in france at a little known restaurant with an up-and-coming chef.

we called at 7 on a saturday night, and the host saved us 2 seats at the bar.  while the space is small, it's cozy with a relaxing vivial soundtrack and noise level. we started with the brie salad and mussels, followed by the leg of lamb and then a gallette for dessert.  um, seriously amazing food. the mussel broth was perfectly salted, the lamb just fell off the bone, and the gallette crust thin and golden to perfection with really interesting carmel sculptures.  the woman at the bar helped us choose a complimentary bottle of wine.  staff were busy but friendly and not pretentious.  what a pleasant (and new!) way to experience french fare in SF.

this is definitely joining our restaurant rotation!
author: Meaghan C.

description:
Came here Friday night with 9 of my friends to celebrate my birthday.  This was a second pick place because Chapeau! said they couldn't accommodate the 9 of us (originally it was only 5 of us and I had to change the day of...will definitely have to try Chapeau! some other time).

Food - 3.5 stars
What was ordered:
Escargot - I've had better, but it tasted good.  I think Escargot has lost its luster for me ever since restaurants stopped serving them in the shell due to liability concerns =\
Salad (I don't know which one it was) - Didn't try but it looked fresh
Fries - Oh Frites, yes!  Just the way I like them, thin and crispy and salted!
Steamed Mussels - Very good flavoring and not overcooked
Risotto w/ seared Scallops - Scallops were super yummy and very well cooked (JJJUUUUSST right!) but the Risotto was a little undercooked
Duck Confit - I'm a sucker for Duck Confit and I loved it
Bouillabaisse - I didn't get to try it, but it smelled good
Baked Brie and potato cake - Will order again for sure!
Ratatouille - There was something in that ratatouille that made it hard to stop eating!  It was the taste of .... in Chinese we call it Wok Hay...
Volcano Chocolate cake - nice rich dark chocolate (warm)
Creme Brulee - One of the better creme brulees I've ever had. Nice thick sugar topping!  

Service - 5 stars!!
Okay, this is where it blows me.  The owner was so attentive and took care of us.  Took my last minute reservation, turned out the lights for the birthday dessert, was friendly, Ratatouille was on the house because it came late...great atmosphere.  We just all loved how it felt to be there.  I'll definitely come again!  Elegant place but not uptight.

Go Try it!!
author: Cristina W.

description: Friendly service.  Consistent, top-notch food.  A little on the pricey side but the quality is worth it.  Nice ambiance.
author: Rosemary K.

description: We luved this place. The staff was so very friendly and attentive and very French. The owner also comes out to greet u. The food was wonderful: short ribs were very tasty and tender, my sis luved the scallops and risotto and mom luved the duck. The shrimp salad was tasty and different. Mom also luved the crème brulee, her favorite. The one negative we had was the French onion soup. very disappointing. Not enuf substance inside, once u get past the cheese. But, we will definitely be back for more!
author: Rhonda W.

description:
We arrived there with guests from out of town, our 5 years old boy and 3 months old baby in a stroller. Saturday evening. Restaurant packed. We had a reservation, but a stroller has the power of breaking the atmosphere. The maitre didn't make any fuss, called his "troubleshooter": a very charming woman who set our table in such a way that we could all enjoy the wonderful food without disturbing anybody with a stroller.
We had the cod fish appetizer, I had the file mignon with foie gras, my husband a chicken dish, our guests, the mussles with curry sauce (I didn't like this one that much, but that is me...) anyway, everything was just wonderful! Ten stars! Ah, and they fixed a nice spaghetti for our son. If you have kids, aren't you happy to have a nice meal at a nice restaurant and be able to take your kid with you (if you don't have the option of not taking him...)? Ten stars, indeed.
author: vania m.

description: Great warm welcoming ambiance with well executed French.  Brunch, lunch and dinner are all good.  Steak with foie gras is one of the best.  I live few blocks away from the restaurant and I just keep going back there because they never let me down.  It's nice place enough for a special occasion as well.
author: Miyako U.

description: My son and I (party of 2)  had a great experience for father's day ...We arrived half an hour early, but where seated on the spot !  Unfortunatelly, the dish of  "Bouilllabaise" I was craving for was out, but the the sole fish replacement they had instead was delicious..They served me also a glass of "Bordeaux sec" that was even not on the wine card. My son had a  "Steak / Haricots verts" perfectly cook...And we very much enjoyed the French conversation with the "garcons" and the "patron" ... I will go back,  "bien sur' !
author: Pierre F.

description: A great option if this is in your neighborhood - but not worth driving far for.
author: Joe K.

description: 3 out of 4 time had to return my steak , but Jack the chef is SO-SO friendly and makes every thing great , I love this place
author: matt p.

description: This place is spectacular!  It's definitely hands down my favorite place to dine in the city.  I've been to this bistro twice and each time the food and service is just superb.  The staff is highly knowledgeable on french cuisine and they always have great recommendations if you're willing to try something different.  The owner is usually there and happily greets customers as if you were a guest in his own home.  This is the perfect place for an intimate dinner.  I highly recommend getting Moules Marinieres (mussels in white wine), so simple yet SO amazing.  The filet mignon is also out of this world.  Best part is our server was able to pair everything so perfecectly together from wine to deserts.  Absolutely the best dining experience I have yet to have.  I can't wait to try their brunch!  If the eggs benedict is anything like the dinner dishes then I think I'll just faint.
author: Charmian L.

description:
What a friendly place with great food. 
On to the food: The French onion soup was as good as any I have  had. We also shared the mushroom and goat cheese appetizer which was very tasty. She had the scallops and risotto in lobster sauce, which was very excellent and I had the New York steak with pomme frites (French fries), which was fine but I'm guessing not their strongest entree. I will be returning to try the other offerings on their menu.
This place just opened and they are currently a little disorganized, but the service is so friendly, energetic, and accommodating that they more than made up for a couple of minor inconsistencies. Despite having no reservation and the restaurant looking pretty busy, we were seated very quickly, and greeted by the chef, who also stopped by a couple of times to see how we were doing. The energy of owner and the service was seemingly contagious, as all of the guests in the restaurant seemed to be lively and happy. This place really has a community/neighborhood feel. Non-pretentious French? I know right? I can't wait to go back for more.
author: Jason Y.

description: Nestled within the most unlikely of places in the city.  While the neighborhood might not appear the safest and the restaurant is small and crowded (euro-style) I must confess the food was exception and price reasonable.  The staff was friendly and attentive and I would happily revisit.  Definitely an outstanding gem in the rough.
author: Kevin S.

description: The salad and beef wellington were excellent. The bread was stale though: they clearly froze it and then put it in the oven before serving. The service was good except that they gave out table away even though we called when running late for our reservation. Most of the waiters were French and the whole place had a nice vibe.
author: barbara b.

description: Love this place! The interior is minimal but cozy, the food is authentic and the presentation is superb. Our waitress was in tune with our needs, and quick to refill our glasses with water. I would agree that it's definitely a perfect blend of old and young. The Hanger steak roqueford was amazing, as well as the penne fruit de mar! For dessert we had an apple tart and white chocolate mousse with strawberries. They both were so artfully displayed I almost felt bad diving my spoon into them! We already made our next reservations!
author: Pamela v.

description: Great place! It resembles a lot what its name suggests (hint: "Bistro" not "Central Parc") and the food is A++! I tried a salad with Roquefort cheese and Beef Bourguignon...simply superb, not only in the taste but in the presentation as well. Very good selection of French (of course) wines and reasonable prices ($7-10 for appetizer, $16-22 main course) given the quality you get. I would recommend to place a reservation, because the venue is not very ample and it might get crowded especially at dinner time. Even for who's not a big fan of French food, this place is definitely worth a try. Looking forward to get back there.
author: Steve E.

description: Came here twice. Once for a Valentine's date and for an anniversary date. Both times the dishes were spectacular. During the Valentine's date it was really crowded and our dishes came out really really late. We were sad because everyone who ordered after us had the same dishes come 30 mins before us. The owner recognized their mistake near the end of the night and gave us a complementary dessert- a balsamic strawberry dish (has an acquired taste- wasn't for us). Regardless my favorite was the mussels with curry it was sooo good! The filet mignon was delicious as well.
author: Melody C.

description: What a pleasant surprise!  This is going to be on my shortlist of my go-to restaurants in SF.  Everything is right about this place.  Seriously delicious comforting french food, neighborhood gem quality, great wines, great dinner specials, nice presentation, cozy welcoming atmosphere, good table setup for intimate conversation, friendly warm service that's non-intrusive and doesn't rush, easy reservations, easy parking, all at a very reasonable price!  I almost don't even want to tell you about it.... but it's nice to share :p.  Definitely will be back.
author: Tammy L.

description:
Tried Bistro Central Parc for the first time this past weekend.  We really enjoyed the delicious food, the attentive, professional service, and the cozy, homey setting.  The one downside to the ambiance was that it's a tiny place with not many tables.  We were seated at a small table for two parked literally at most a foot away from another table for two.  It felt a bit like we were on a double date.  ;)  That said, it's not uncommon for small restaurants in the city to squeeze every possible table in.  

The frisee salad with lardons and poached egg was scrumptious, as was the potato pancake with the warm brie over mizuna salad.  The only thing that could have made the second entree better would have been a touch of salt on the potato pancake, which was slightly underseasoned and bland.  The lamb shank I had as an entree was incredible.  The meat absolutely melted off the bone and the sauce had an incredible depth of flavor.  My husband had the duck confit over lentils, and it, too, was perfectly, lovingly prepared.

We were too full for dessert, which is a shame, but I'm sure we'll be back sometime and will try harder to save room!
author: M D.

description:
Excellent food
Excellent service
Adequate prices
Live music on certain days
Go spend money in this place!!
author: The Y s.

description: Thank God we have French food back in the hood.
author: Rosie F.

description: A delightful dining experience. Service was welcoming. I felt like I was a regular, though it was my first time there. Food was delicious, prepared with skill and artfulness, from fresh ingredients. Wine list was not extensive, but what they had was wonderful. It's one of those little places not hyped up, off the beaten path, tucked away, for lucky ones to discover. It made for a magical evening.
author: Boris C.

description: Have been to this bistro twice, and have to say this place tops the chart for quality of food, service and good old fashioned charm! Love the neighborhood.
author: P J.

description:
This review is based on one brunch experience. Terrific service - pleasant, attentive wait staff. Great ambience. 

I had the salmon benedict - great hollandaise sauce, well done - can't complain, and all 3 of my friends enjoyed their meals as well. The only observation we all had is that the portions are small! We are used to huge portions of potatoes, etc, and this place keeps it pretty scant - I think in the end it's a good thing as it prevented us from overeating. 

I actually plan to go back for dinner - which is supposed to be extraodinary here.
author: Latte Queen W.

description: I came here with my friend and even though we came 45 minutes late, we were greeted so warmly by this cute little french man who helped us to our table. We started with the galette de pomme de terre and brie chaud (brie on a potato pancake on top of greens). This dish wasn't my favorite, but it had a lot of potential. I'm a huge brie fan, so I loved the taste of the brie on the potato pancake. I do think that the texture of the pancake wasn't right over the greens underneath. If both were separate (brie on pancake, and greens with dressing), they would have been two perfect appetizers. We also had the escargot bourguignon with garlic and parsley butter. This was a nice dish, but extremeley hot. After that, we had the bouillabaisse and the risotto with lobster sauce and pan seared scallops. The bouillabaisse was  mediocre and the broth didn't have that much flavor. To be honest, I've had much better. What stole the show was the risotto. The seared scallops were to die for, and the risotto was thick and creamy with the most outstanding flavor. We both loved it! Overall, this place is cute with very friendly service, but I think there are much better French restaurants in SF.
author: Sheeva G.

description: Visit #1: French toast - eggy and tasty, Onion soup - good subtle flavor but not blow-me-away tasty, Pasta of the Day - the most tasty. Plus 2 alcoholic drinks: $50 not including tip. Nice laidback atmosphere.
author: Sumi Y.

description: Excellent food and service. I loved it. The staff was super friendly and attentive. The place is small and cozy, a local feeling. I'd love to come again. It's walking distance to the Independent. Parking can be difficult since there is no parking lot nearby, only street parking.
author: M. D.

description: Cute place, food was just aight.  I REALLY wanted to like it, especially because I was the one who chose this spot for Sunday brunch for our party of four after reading the rave Yelp reviews, but it failed to deliver.  The escargot was decent, BF's salmon benedict lackluster, BF's BFF seemed to enjoy the duck confit, and my $17.50 risotto with scallops and lobster sauce missed the mark.  At that price point and at a bistro, I expected quality (if not quantity) and got nothing more than a small bowl of dry, insipid risotto rice flecked with little scallops in a bland sauce.  The best part of the meal was the wine and mimosas, but how hard is it to get that right?  Needless to say, with so many other options in the city, this visit was a one-time deal.
author: Liz N.

description:
what a cool little bistro!

had a warm brie on potato pancake over a bed of mizuna salad, escargots, bouillabaisse and risotto with seared scallops and lobster sauce. so good!

dessert: tarte tatin and strawberry mousse. and a good cup of house coffee. ah, the simple things.

very friendly owner and staff.

parking a little tricky.
author: Tom L.

description: Very nice eggs benedict and salmon benedict.  Impressive hollendaise sauce of which I could have eaten more.  We will be back!
author: Valerie H.

description:
I'm tempted to keep quiet about this place because I'd like to be able to get a table anytime my heart desires.  But that would be selfish.  The food is excellent.  I had rack of lamb, my companion had risotto, and we split a scrumptious tarte tatin.  The prices are reasonable--not cheap, but good for the quality of the food.  Portions are moderate, so this is not for someone who is expecting Olive-Garden-style quantities.  Service was very pleasant.  My only complaint is the noise level.  The dining room was no more than half-full the night we went, and it was already a bit louder than I like it.  There is nothing to soften the acoustics so I expect that it would be REALLY loud when all tables are full.  
It would be a great location for sidewalk tables in warmer weather, assuming the City would allow this.
author: Martha B.

description:
We arrived a few minutes late for our reservation and were seated right away at a table by the window.  It was cold and rainy outside, but toasty inside. Our waitress was very friendly (her strong French accent was pretty adorable to boot), and when we were uncertain as to which wine we wanted, she poured us a taste of both to help us decide.

We shared the entire meal and began with the Trio de tartare de Saumon which was delicious, Escargots Bourguign and Moules  Marinieres. I have to say the mussels may be the most tender and flavorful mussels I've ever had. Definitely dip your bread in the white wine broth and sop it up. So good!  We followed that with the Risotto aux Coquilles St Jacque which was excellent and  ended our meal with their vanilla crème brulee which is hands down the best crème brulee I've ever had. An amazing feast!

The restaurant itself is simple in décor and a little noisy, but well worth a visit.  In fact, I think it is my new favorite restaurant in SF. Can't wait to go back and try the brunch.
author: Indigo W.

description:
If the service wasn't so bad, I would've given this place 5 stars easily.  The food is so amazing.  Definitely try the seafood risotto!  That being said, we had a particularly bad waitress.  After we ordered our food, I watched as two different sets of people sat down and ate their meals and left, before we had even received our appetizers!  When I had asked our waitress to please check on our meals after I saw these people receive their food, she said she would, but we still never received anything.  We finally asked her again and after 45 minutes, we received our first appetizers.  

Our waitress then came to us and asked if we wanted dessert and that was when we asked for the entrees we had ordered an hour ago!  Apparantly she had forgotten those too.  What's worse is that she kept blaming the kitchen, but when we finally got our bill, (nothing was comped), we noticed she had charged us for things we never ordered and food we had ordered wasn't on our bill!  We finally were able to leave after 2 hours!  Did I mention this was a lunch service?

It's a shame because if it wasn't for our waitress, we'd probably go back.
author: Jessica K.

description: I've only been here  twice for brunch now and I can't wait to become a regular.  We had brunch, and the food was excellent. My first time there, we sat outside the first day they happened to offer outdoor seating.  We were also able to indulge in the creme brulee before noon, it was delicious.  I can't wait to find a reason to have dinner here soon.  I love the location, because it's just a pleasant few minute walk away.
author: Mirba E.

description: Absolutely phenomenal. I loved this place.  The starters (tartare wild mushroom risotto), where fantastic, the mains (duck breast, risotto, and confit) were to die for, and the desserts (especially the brulee) were off the chart.  The service and atmosphere were wonderful.  Totally a place I can't wait to go back to with more friends.
author: Mike W.

description: very good neighborhood french bistro.  fantastic french onion soup and steak.  give it a try
author: nick g.

description:
What a lovely, lovely neighborhood joint! This French bistro is the quintessential casual/fine dining experience. From the warm, rustic decor to the French staff. An owner that personally greets you during your meal. Impressive menu. You wouldn't know this used to be a crack house!

Just got back from a little birthday celebration dinner. The food was fantastic:

App -
Endive Salad - creative use of endives with really vibrant Roquefort cheese, pears and walnuts
Trio of Salmon tartare - deliciously seasoned salmon tartar, with roe wrapped in salmon

Entree -
I had the Filet Mignon, with Potato Gratin. I ordered it Medium Rare, because I love my steak moo'ing. It was cooked exactly how I wanted it. Clearly still a bit on the rare side but really tender to chew. At first I thought it was not a huge portion, but actually, even after giving away several bites of my steak, it was plenty.

Veal stew - a little on the small side and pretty good if you enjoy veal. Comes with a yummy risotto

I didn't try the lobster sauce and scallop risotto, but I was told it was very good.

Rack of lamb, done medium. It was still pink and had wonderful juicy texture. The presentation was phenomenal.

Duck confit - a good size piece of duck, I thought it could be a little moister, but pretty tasty nonetheless.

For dessert, we had mentioned it was a birthday celebration. We thought it was taking a little longer than usual, but lo and behold, the lights are dimmed. Everyone in the restaurant is kind of confused, but then the staff bellows their rendition of Happy Birthday and we're presented with our 2 sweet treats with candle in tow.

The special - Strawberries with balsamic vinegar, cracked black pepper and ice cream. We all sort of went "Huh?" when our waitress told us about it, but given our curiosity we ordered it anyway and we were all very pleasantly surprised with this. The strawberries are a bit warm and when you taste a bit of pepper, it adds just a little spiciness to your bite.

Profiteroles - with ice cream. Sweet and yummy.

And while enjoying the wonderful dessert, the owner even came by with a little paper bag. It contained a little souvenir for my walk home.

All in all, for the quality of food, service and atmosphere. Bistro Central Parc is fairly priced and very welcoming. It adds some wonderful French personality to the neighborhood.
author: Karen J.

description: I like the lamb chop there. The portions are bigger than usual. And the people work there are very nice and funny.
author: Tammy L.

description:
I stumbled across this place in my neighborhood soon after it opened and went out on a limb to surprise my girlfriend. My gamble payed off in a major way and we've been back four times since then. I even took my parents who quickly co-opted it and now pop into the City to eat without inviting me. 

I have gotten filet mignon with fois gras with a port reduction a number of times. It's so reasonably priced, plated well and delicious. The mussels are fresh and the fries have integrity. The baked brie croquette on top of a mizuna base is nice precursor to any meal. I had the scallop risotto with lobster sauce last time and it was decadent. We even caught brunch here after the Nike Marathon and I had a croque madame with a poached egg that truly was transcendent. The rest of the breakfast menu is executed very well making it worth paying a couple bucks more.

One of the true strengths of this fine neighborhood restaurant is the warm and welcoming owner. He has always greeted our table - treating us with grace - exuding his appreciation for patrons of his establishment. Bistro Central Parc truly made my dad's 70th birthday memorable by dimming the lights, singing happy birthday, and giving him a logo mug. I truly love the place and hope it does well in the future. It's not as distinguished as Gary Danko or La Foret;  it's simply a can't miss mid-priced French place anyone will love.
author: Uncle M.

description: This was such a complete surprise. I'm not sure how this could have been better. Absolutely charming, efficient staff. Every dish, every bite had us commenting. The rissoto and onion soup were great. The filet topped with pate and pepperorn sauce made me want to order another helping and the fish of the day was superb. The desserts were deliciious and served each with their own unique flair. We had a birthday girl at the table. They turned out the lights and came out singing. Their suggestion of wine was very good and quite affordable. The fact that this was also a very casual, corner neighborhood destination has moved this to the top of all our lists. Go, this is a real find!
author: Ken B.

description:
This neighborhood restaurant is EXCELLENT!  I was very impressed.

Started with the trio salmon appetizer.  The salmon was fresh.  The thinly sliced cucumbers were refreshing.  The touch of herbs added excellent balance and taste.  A wonderful starter!  I ordered the Filet Mignon with Fois Gras (special of the day).  Oh boy, this dish was to die for!!!  I savored every bite.  The glass of French wine was nice, but the portion was small...seemed less than the standard 4 oz glass.

The only bad part to this dining experience was parking.  My friend and I circled around for at least 20 to 25 minutes before we found one.  Other than that, it was wooooonderful.
author: L C.

description:
i swear every time i come here with friends & family....they are so so impressed. the people are sooooooo nice and so warm...welcoming.

the food haunts me in my dreams....so amazing.

food & service is extremely excellent.
please try this place; it is clearly a must!
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
Bistro Central Parc is conveniently located around the corner from my house in NOPA and i couldn't be happier about it!  Where else can you get an amazing french dinner for cheaper?  The owners are kind, the service is attentive, the environment is comfortable, and the food is classic and delicious.  I've been there many times; this review is based on my last visit (a thursday night man date).

We had beef tartar and sweatbreads to start, the cornish game hen and duck breast for dinner, then finished with the volcan au chocolat and creme brulee.  brought a good bottle with us, had some port to finish.  walked out a little drunk and very happy.  highly recommended to all!
author: Albert B.

description: Great, great restaurant. The price is on par with more modest restaurants in the City, but the food matches the quality of Michelin rated establishments. Staff are friendly, wine flows at a decent price, and the food is superb. I've tried both the beef cheeks and the scallop risotto, and they were both amazing.
author: Luis M.

description: Everything was very good and beautifully presented. The staff was very friendly. A few people had their birthday dinners there and they dim the lights and have everyone join in on the singing which seemed nice. Overall it was a bit pricey but if you can afford it, go!
author: Daffodil K.

description: Where do I begin?! First off, BEST foie gras I ever had (runner-up was at the Salt House). It also helped that it was served on top of a steak that melted in your mouth. YES, I was in heaven. The next time, I had the duck and it was fantastic. The presentation was beautiful and the flavors complimented each other so well. I love how everyone there is French, it has a cozy, classy atmosphere without the pretentious feeling. I felt very welcome there both times. Santé!
author: E. N.

description:
just coming back from a paris trip, my wife and i decided to try this place out for our anniversary dinner.  of course trying out some of the best bistros on earth in paris, i didn't expect much from this place as it is designed similar to the bistros there, but with a very san francisco feel to it.  i was happily wrong as everything was great.  food was top notch and on par with the bistros in paris.  totally understandable as i found out later when the owner greeted us in his charming french accent how everything was.  the food is good as expected from the rating of this place so you can't go wrong. 

this restaurant is the place to go at those moments where you and your friends can never decide which restaurants to go because it's either too fancy, too expensive, too cheap, too busy, or always too something.  one thing i would expect for this place is how hard it would be to get a reservation or walk in seating, which to my amazement was not.  but judging from everything i've experienced, i would be amazed if it is still the case, but rightfully so.
author: Mac Y.

description:
We Yelped "French" in the neighborhood Friday night (01/14/2011) and while Chapeau (formerly Clementine) is 1/2 block from the house and we LOVE it, we wanted to try a new place.  BIstro Central Parc was a nice choice and we appreciate all our fellow Yelpers for helping us make the decisions!  Zazie...we'll see you soon :)
We ended up sitting at the bar because they were clearly busy and we didn't want to feel rushed.  We carried in nice wines, but were sufficiently impressed with their list and prices.  Maybe next time we won't bring our own.
We had a plan for items on the menu to go with the Bollinger Champagne NV, Clos Pegas Chardonnay and Black Tears Malbec.  We made it 2/3 of the way before we had to stop.  Black Tears will have to wait.
We started with salmon three ways: smoked, grave lox, roe.  Chopped smoked salmon with herbs, egg, cucumbers, creme fraiche, wrapped in a ribbon of grave lox and dotted with large, salty roe.  Surprising presentation that worked very well!  Sauteed sweetbreads and mushrooms with a veal demi sauce were cooked perfectly and beat Chapeau in texture and flavor.  Pork cheeks au jus with caramelized onions on a bed of pomme Savoyard (or something similar) was a delicacy.  I wish more restauranteurs and Chefs took a chance on the cheeks!  Very nicely done and perfect with the Champagne & Chardonnay by the way.
We planned to have duck after the Coquille St. Jacques on risotto with lobster broth, but saw no point.  We were very satisfied! The lobster broth lingered so nicely, we didn't want to end uncomfortably satiated and eating the duck just because we had a plan.
We will be back!
author: Sean M.

description: What a wonderful addition to the neighborhood! The food is totally scrumptious- been there a few times, and really love brunch- the eggs benedict and florentine are so good. The orange juice is 100% fresh squeezed and I have to stop myself from drinking glass after glass. Portion size is perfect and the prices are good.The staff is so friendly and cute. Bistro Central Parc is a gem.
author: Samantha L.

description: Others have said it...and it's true. Their filet is one of the best I've ever had. Medium-rare, over au gratin potatoes and topped with foie. But that sauce...wow. I dunno if it's black truffle or a wine reduction or both. But it is like a dessert sauce for steak. The waitress literally brought us more bread at the end of the meal just so we could sop up that sauce!! The duck breast is fantastic, too. The owner and staff were super nice and helpful. Great wine suggestion, as well.
author: Manu G.

description: Great food and great people! This is a great place for brunch. Try the muscles, eggs benedict, salmon benedict, croque madame, risotto with lobster sauce, and any of the desserts .. all amazing. The owner previously started Baker Street Bistro, also just as tasty.
author: Diego R.

description: I love this place.  The beef tartar and curry mussels are mind blowing.  I eaten here 6 or 7 times.  The only dish that fell short of stellar was the Bouillabaisse, the rest of the menu is near perfection.  I would have given them 5 stars but, the service is a little lacking (french let's say).  If you like french food or even just like food, you have to check this place out!
author: Jeff H.

description: Great little bistro - I was very happy with the endive salad and the mussels.  Happy to return.
author: J D.

description:
I came here for sunday brunch a while back with a group of friends. i don't remember what i ordered--except that it had eggs in some form--but remember it being good and that everyone enjoyed their food.

we had a pretty good time hanging out and chatting over a tasty brunch, but the experience was soured in the end when our waiter was rude to us. the service was standard, so we included a standard tip with the payment for the bill. the waiter, however, was not pleased and made it obvious by bringing our tip back as change, clearly indicating he wanted more. but, he didn't get more for his jerk move and i kinda felt like i should have subtracted some as punishment for his jerkiness. good food with snotty service = lame.
author: Kan L.

description: I can't stop thinking about the steak tartare! Everything we ate was delicious but the tartare keeps standing out in my mind. Great cozy decor and wonderful staff. Definitely a must try.
author: Cindy P.

description: This place was great.  We had a large group for a birthday celebration and the service was very good and the food delicious.  It was a great way to celebrate.
author: Libbi J.

description:
i didn't think i was going to venture back on yelp, but after much thought and after a friend who owns a restaurant advised me to do such...

love the great reviews but i unfortunately wasn't able to have a pleasant experience.

FOOD POISONING.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Good food and good service. Especially enjoy it when the owner is there. I have had fantastic meals there. Can be real noisy (so what's new) during dinner. Went for brunch today - more quiet. Third time for that. Maybe off day but the eggs of eggs Benedict were overcooked today but not enough to send back. Super convenient to my home and I really like taking friends and out of town relatives there. But $10 does seem pricey for a kir royale.....
author: Da H.

description:
The food, the service, the food!!!  OMG...the place is totally awesome to the nth degree.  I haven't had a meal where every single dish down to the wine and water was impressive.  

first off, let me just say we tried only their small plates.  we will definitely be back for the other side of the menu.

1) wine - sancere sauv blanc. rich, sweet, delicious. just order the bottle.  
2) bread - warm, crusty, melts your butter.  make sure you save some to sop up the sauces in every dish.
3) french onion soup - you know how most places have this overly salty mess of onions and cheese.  well, you know they are doing this right because all you taste is truley the sweetness of carmelized onions in a very rich broth, topped with melty cheese.  the BEST onion soup i have ever had and i've been to Paris, this was better!
4) salad lyonaisse - perfectly crispy pancetta, fresh frissee, topped with a perfectly poached egg. the dressing was tangy and not overpowering.  use the bread clean off the plate.
5) escargot - piping HOT, buttery delicious, tender morsels of snail.  again, use bread to clean the little pots of green goodness.
6) trio of salmon - fresh salmon sashimi mixed with cooked and raw tartare paired with a crispy buttery pastry tart.  yum!
7) OMG - sweetbreads with mushroom sauce. just try it, no words can describe how much i love this dish. i almost licked the plate if my bf wasn't looking at me.
8) hot brie on top of potato pancake salad - i need the recipe to that dressing in the salad, it was sooo good.  hot brie, so smooth, so creamy, so gone in 20 seconds.  you cannot NOT try this dish.
9) you have to have these mussels - creamy broth paired with onions and garlic made this dish to die for.  we forgot to order fries, but with the amount we already ate, we were thankful we did.
10) perfiteroles - homemade icecream!!!  and the bittersweet chocolate was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.

I can't wait to go back and try all their entrees.  also, all the above was consumed by two people.  yes, we are pigs, but happy, full and satisfied pigs!
author: Ames K.

description: food here is amazing and really reasonably priced. The service seemed to drop a little the last few times we went, which is a shame because it had been so fantastically warm and inviting prior to that. May have just caught them on a few off days. Really wonderful though.
author: Kate B.

description:
Bistro Central Parc is a very small casual little bistro with amazing food. Our reservation was at 6:30pm but unfortunately our table was not ready until around 7, however they did offer us a glass of wine while we waited.  Too bad it was too cold outside to eat, but the maitre d told us that they were going to be installing an awning with heater lamps within the next couple of weeks.  This will hopefully help with the traffic of people coming through the front door.
For starters I had the Frisee aux lardons salad.  Basically frisee with nuggets of rendered bacon and a poached egg on top.  Unfortunately they were out of the sweetbreads, so my brother ordered the escargots and he said it was one of the best he had.  Main entrees were the Cassoulet (rich bean stew with duck confit and sausages) and Braised Beef Cheeks over red beet puree with two tournades of potatoes.  Both were very tasty.  
I gave up sweets for LENT and my brother is not much of a dessert guy so no dessert was ordered, but I did get to peak at some of the desserts arriving to the other tables and they looked really good.
I will definitely be coming back here.
*PARKING IS HORRENDOUS SO GET THERE EARLY AND BE READY TO CIRCLE AROUND AND WALK A FEW BLOCKS.
author: Danielle E.

description:
Four of us went to Bistro Central Parc for my husband's birthday.  It was the second time we had been there, the first being just before Christmas on the occasion of our daughter's graduation.  As before, we were met at the door by the owner with an enthusiastic welcome.  He even remembered that our daughter had graduated!

I had brought my husband's favorite homemade cake for dessert and, after  a wonderful meal with four perfectly prepared entrees, the birthday celebration began.  The house lights were turned out and everyone sang Happy Birthday while my humble cake was brought out with candles lit.  After the candles were blown out, the cake was whisked away and then the generous slices were brought back  transformed into works of art with chocolate and raspberry flourishes on the plate and sugar spirals on top.  It was amazing!  My husband even received a logo mug as a gift.

In short, perfect food, perfect service, perfect host.  Don't miss it.
author: patricia p.

description:
I give it one star because the wine by the glass was good. The food was bland. French standards at a French restaurant should be stellar...if you can't make an escargot taste like anything bad news...the steak frite was tough, chewy and again no flavor to the meat, frites no salt...it wasn't expensive but heck....spend your money elsewhere. 
Maybe Chapeau! which is always amazing.
author: shlisa U.

description: I did not know this place was here and I am so happy I found it! Cute, cozy French restaurant with an actual french staff! I am loving it! I had a late dinner date at this restaurant and was 100% satisfied by the service. We were seated at a quiet table were we could talk and enjoy each other's company. The food was great! I ordered the duck breast special they were offering that night and cleaned my plate. Ummmmmmmm! The presentation was just as nice as the meal itself. I was left with a smile on my face. My only complaint is that I was too full to try their desserts! I guess a good reason to go there again!
author: Marie-Claire R.

description: Loved this restaurant ! Terrific service and food, very French atmosphere. The potato gallette with Brie and trio of salmon tartare were magnifique.
author: Meridithe M.

description: I'm not sure there are words to describe how amazing the scallop and lobster risotto is. Also, be sure to try the creme brulee.  ohmygodsogood.  I love this place and am so happy to have it in my neighborhood! Sayonara crackeads and hello delicious!
author: Ashley W.

description: After our impromptu, intimate wedding, on one of the hottest days ever in SF (4/21/13), my new, opera-singer husband & our tiny wedding party headed over to BCP for what we had thought would be a lovely intimate dinner.  When I made the reservation, I said it was a special occasion, and that we would like a good table.  When we arrived, at around 5, we were shown to a table that was okay, and told there were no others, despite the fact that there were few diners there. Okay, we accepted that, no worries, those tables may have been reserved ahead too. We then told our waitperson that it was our wedding day and the four of us were celebrating.  No enthusiasm, just a "that's nice," which felt a little puncturing, but we went on to order our meals without fanfare.  One of our meals was underdone, and the waitperson seemed annoyed to have to do anything about it.  We ordered desserts and wines, and spent well over $200----tipping nicely despite.  And yet, nothing much about this experience felt very special.  Perhaps one has to be young and hip to get special attention here, and we are middle aged.  One person in our party is from Montreal, knows fine French dining, and is very open-minded; but he said that I probably should have chosen another place that understands what it means to celebrate a festivity.  In reviewing the overall experience, we all agreed that none of us would go back.  I did catch a glimpse of the owner coming in to talk to some other tables, and he seems like a very personable man.  By the time we were done, the place was loud, but lively.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Came here for brunch once and for dinner another time. Brunch had a very clean and classy vibe and their eggs benedict was DELICIOUS. For dinner, I came with three girlfriends for a birthday and the service was fantastic. Good food and good wine list. The owner came up to our table and chatted with us for a little bit. GREAT atmosphere and food all around!!
author: Janie Y.

description: This place is only a block away from my apartment and I'm so excited because it was very good. The food is basically classic french dishes with nothing to fancy or "innovative". It's exciting to me to find a place like this because sometimes I feel like we need more of these type of restaurants in this city. I went with a group of friends and we shared everything. We enjoyed every dish and we left excited to come back and try more.  Great new place to have in the neighborhood.
author: Rolo A.

description: We had a wonderful dinner here last night. This restaurant had come highly recommended and did not disappoint. Started with foie gras two ways, which could have been perfect if the cold pâté had been more flavorful. The risotto was creamy but not heavy, with perfectly cooked scallops. The white wine was crisp and perfectly paired. I also tried my boyfriend's peppercorn filet mignon, which was excellent as well and well balanced with a smaller serving of potato gratin. Overall very impressed and looking forward to returning.
author: Diana Z.

description: Incredible dinner, delicious wine (with a generous pour). Had the salad and duck, absolutely loved both. Boyfriend had mushroom risotto and special filet mignon with foie gras. We were attended to with loving care and had an amazing time, would definitely recommend for anyone who loves french food and wine.
author: smallcat p.

description: Had a great meal here.  Appetizer: mussels in cream curry sauce.  Excellent.  Great baguette-style bread.  Entrees: Lobster sauce risotto with scallops - unbelievable; bouillabaisse -- very nice - lots of fresh seafood - salmon, mussels, clams.  With two glasses of wine came to under $100 (?!).  Great restaurant.
author: David S.

description: We thoroughly enjoyed this French country bistro in the middle of the NoPa neighborhood of SF.  Beef bourgounion was perfect, and the duck with lentils was just the right taste.  The bordeaux we ordered complimented the food perfectly and didn't break the bank.  Great discovery, thanks solely to Yelp.
author: Rick F.

description: Nothing but excellent experience! Everything about this place is just right - ambiance, food, service... We were very pleased.
author: Simon B.

description: Traditional french food, brilliantly executed.  Plates at prices much better than comparable cuisine throughout the city.  Pleasant atmosphere.  I want to come back soon!
author: Charles C.

description:
Sis just took me and family here for my birthday dinner.  Here's the scoop:

1) Escagot - ok, nothing special.
2) Warm Brie Salad - looks good, tastes pretty good too.  Love the potato pancake
3) French Steak with Fois Gras - very rich and tasty.  
4) Scallop and Lobster Risotto - yum.  Scallop was cooked perfectly.  Risotto was filled with lobaster broth.  Delicious!
5)  Lamb Chop - ok, nothing fancy.  

Very nice, simple and clean environment.  Table space may be a bit tight for some, but we thought it was fine.  Portions were also just right, so you can really have appetizer, main course and dessert.  We had Profiteroles and Tarte Tartin, which were both good.  Service was ok, owner and our waitress were both very friendly.

Lastly, they even give up a little mug of their restaurant as a birthday gift.  It'll be my new coffee mug. :)
author: grace C.

description:
this was more like 4 1/2
