first of all.. the service was EXCELLENT. i came here with a party of 7 which included 3 kids. the waiters/waitress were soooo accommodating. it was unbelievable... so friendly! the chef/owner?...l was so friendly.....
for the food we ordered:
ESCARGOT: this was ok...
MUSSELS: this was good esp. when you dip the bread in the sauce
SALAD with the POACHED EGG: this was nice and light, but i preferred the....
SALAD with the brie and potato pancake: i really liked this salad. the light dressing on this salad was great!
BOUILABAISSE: was good... it reminded me a cioppino.
LOBSTER RISOTTO with SCALLOPS- this was EXCELLENT! i don't even like risotto.. but i LOVED this dish.
CREME BRULEE- this was good.
PROFITEROLE- this was ok. i don't think i's order this again....

overall this place was good.. i would definitely come back for the risotto bc it was fantastic!
author: Helen C.

description: We love this place, great food and fantastic service, the owner makes it his mission to personally greet you and and thank you when the meal is finished, this is a nice touch and always the cream on what is an already great dining experience. A great addition to the western addition
author: Erevan O.

description:
yumm.... 

this little restaurant in the center of the neighborhood was a treasure.. I'm glad I came across it while looking for a restaurant to eat on yelp :)

cute. small. friendly. yummy.

For the appetizer: We had the salmon tartar.. which actually wasn't anything amazing. I probably wouldn't order it but that French Onion Soup looked soOOo good.. I wish I had gotten it. :( all well.. next time.. (and there will DEFINITELY be a next time!) 
On to the main course:  I had the seared scallops with lobster sauce and risotto.. soOoo good.. soOoo flavorful.. :) I just might have to order that again.. and the New York steak was delish.. tender.. (almost all the guys at the restaurant ate that-- must mean its good).. and the bouillabaisse (seafood stew-ish) was tasty, and the almond trout was good.. 

For dessert: Profiteroles, Creme Brulee and the Tarte Tatin (upside down apple cake?) I don't think i'm really fond of Profiteroles, had it before and didn't like the soggy pastry part of it... but the creme brulee was to die for.. (hard to get it wrong- but it was custardy goodness.
author: Kristina L.

description: I live in the NOPA neighborhood and am thrilled at the arrival of a restaurant this good, this charming and this affordable.  The staff (verifiably French... just listen) are welcoming and friendly.  The newly constructed space is intimate (and still a little cold in terms of its decor, but I think that's improving with time) and very sweet.  But the big thing is the food: so. darn. good.  I've had brunch there a couple of different times and everything is delicious.  And authentically French.  But not foo-foo French: just simple, delicious, fresh and well prepared.  What a welcome addition to our little neighborhood!
author: Derek G.

description:
This place is indeed a find in the neighborhood.  You really can't beat this bistro fare.

The escargot was ok (Pernod please), but the scallops and risotto was sublime.  Really: I usually steer clear of risottos or heavy rice and pasta dishes, but this was well worth the indulgence.

The service was good and the atmosphere is great....not too noisy, a big plus in my book.

Something seems missing from the dessert options though.  I had the profiteroles and they were ok.  Maybe a mousse or some additional lighter items?

Anyway, I'll definitely be going back.
author: Nick H.

description: Yum, yum.  I had the most incredible trout with almonds.  Great place for a romantic meal in a residential neighborhood.
author: M M.

description:
What can I say, top notch from top to bottom. Small and quaint, I felt completely and totally attended to the second we walked in the door. I don't know what it is, but the faces and demeanor of all the staff just ooze hospitality...and that theme manifested itself throughout the evening. 

Hospitality aside, the food was for lack of a cliche magnifique! We had the frisee and lardon salad to start - perfectly dressed and very flavorful. I had the special - beef with fois gras (yeah yeah - hold your judgments for the sake of flavor) with truffle sauce. For lack of a better description *ucking phenomenal. My gf had the bouillabaisse, and while it was a little salty for her taste, to me it was great. I would have been happy leaving there, but then I saw the deserts go to other tables. The presentation on them looked great that we couldn't resist. Let me digress for a second on that note - EVERYTHING was presented thoughtfully and beautifully. They really take the time to make your food not only tasty, but also beautiful - magnificent presentation all around. Back to the desert - can I say explosion in your mouth! the "chocolate volcano" was quite possibly one of the best deserts I've had in years. All in all - magnifique, fantastique, boombastic all around. Highly recommended.
author: Steve H.

description: We are happy to have another excellent restaurant in the hood - even more so a modern French bistro. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends anywhere around the Bay Area. Decor is of course very sleek and fresh - but that's to be expected of a brand new restaurant. We had a table full of starters, sides and a couple of the entrees split among six of us. Ingredients, preparation and presentation were just great . Why not five stars? The service was distracted at times - but I expect this to change as they go along. I hope that the out of the way location and small number of tables are not a problem, as we hope to eat there far into the future.
author: phil a.

description:
At first I was a little skeptical about trying this little out of the way place because super small places small and out of the way are either fantastic or just the opposite, plus the big drawdown for me was there was no menu online I could peek at to see what's tempting.  Am I ever glad we decided to stop in for dinner last week...   First off, I was extremely impressed that they held our reservations despite being 30 minutes late. When we walked in, there were people waiting and one empty table tucked away which they immediately seated us at...  Ammmmmmazing! The ambiance is somewhat bright during the day, considering there are plenty of windows and sits on a corner location tucked in a little neighborhood, but when the sun comes down the candlelit restaurant transforms in to a little romantic getaway...  Parking is a hassle, but seriously, so worth the trouble.  The servers were all French and friendly (rare to my knowledge), but the food... Wow... The food was absolutely incredible! This has to be one of the best dining experiences ever, ever!  

Started off with the smoked salmon and the sweetbread appetizers...  One word, wow!  I was so impressed and we've only started on the appetizers...  I was already feelin' this place and scoping what I would try on the next visit.  The menu looks full of amazing dishes which I have every intention of trying all of them!  For the main course, it was the filet mignon with seared foie gras.  Again, amazing... fantastic and just plain delicious.  The filet was prepared just right and the foie gras on top was a fantastic addition, reminds me of the kobe and foie gras @ katsuya.   

This little stop is going to definitely be a favorite!   The food was phenomenal and was timed perfectly by the hostess.
author: carlo a.

description:
these guys gave great service for my high-maintenance birthday dinner.

i changed the rezzie time and added another person one day before the party. they sat 3 of my friends who had arrived on-time, while i arrived nearly a half hour late to my own dinner, with yet another additional person in-tow. staff graciously added another setting to the table without a single grumble. 

food was terrific and reasonably priced. specials were just as good as the regular menu pics.
author: MB T.

description: I would love to give it 5 stars, but it's tough when you make a reservation, show up on-time, and then have to wait 30 minutes for a table.  I'm nearly positive that's what reservations are for.  Their staff is somewhat attentive when you actually sit-down.  The food though, wow!  All service aside, you will be floored by their dishes.  Totally recommend it and love having it in the neighborhood!
author: Alex P.

description:
What a treat to have this just around the corner!  The bowl of muscles was so good - don't know what we enjoyed more the shellfish or sopping up the broth with bread.    Pomme Frittes were perfect.  Split pea soup was delicious - it was light, not too thick and had a nice singular pea flavor that wasn't overpowered by other seasoning. 

The staff is very welcoming and attentive.  We look forward to many repeat visits to this charming bistro!
author: Anne W.

description:
This restaurant creeps up out of no where.  You're just walking along, through a charming SF neighborhood, and thwap! out of no where is this place: cozy, friendly and perfectly French.  The food is very finely prepared, the staff courteous and helpful, and the overall experience quite pleasurable. 

The French Onion soup was the only part of the meal I wasn't that into - the meats, desserts and salads were all mighty tasty.
author: Jerry T.

description: Very good food,artfully presented  and its so nice to dine where there are actually many main courses for less than 20 bucks.....they seem to really care about whats coming out of the kitchen.Only negative is you can hardly talk when the place is full...too loud for my tastes.
author: james m.

description: Very good food and service.   The staff and owner are very friendly and helpful. I have nothing critical to say with the 9 items we ordered.   I will definitely go back again.
author: George W.

description:
This place is fantastic. The food is amazing.

My girlfriend took me here last night for my birthday... it's two blocks from our place and I've always wanted to try it. From the second we entered the restaurant, the whole staff was amazingly warm and friendly.

The wine list is very affordable, and the bottle that we got was a great, spicy Zinfandel. I ordered the Scallop risotto and repeat what has been said a lot on here: it is AMAZING. Scallops perfectly cooked with a beautiful caramelized crust, and the lobster sauce is heaven. My girlfriend got the flank steak with roquefort sauce, and we shared a side of ratatouille.  All of it was great. 

We ordered the creme brulee for dessert, and as they were bringing it out, the lights went out in the restaurant. Everyone was surprised and looking around... turns out they had found out it was my birthday and they brought it out with a candle. 

Seriously, this place is great and I can't wait to go back and try everything else here.
author: Gavin W.

description: Great food and warm service.  Jacques, the owner, goes out of his way to make all aspects of the dining experience pleasant.
author: Niall V.

description:
Went here for the second or third time the other night , and although the food is really good ( I'd give them 5 stars for that ) , the waiter had such a shitty attitude that we will probably never go back, which is a shame because its a nice place other than that. 
He basically gave my wife a lecture on french food when she asked him a question about if they had something on the menu...
Eating out and spending money is as much about the experience as the food sometimes , and although these food-bringers might on occasion feel the need to impart their opinions to other less important folks , at the end of the day it's the customer paying the bill and they need to be treat with a bit of respect .Or they won't be back.!
It might be worth adding that snotty " European" service is quite amusing when it's done with some style , but making people look small is just a bad reflection on the waiter and the establishment. 
Be warned
author: j b.

description: Probably the best affordable French restaurant in the city.
author: Mark E.

description: Good French place in the city.  French onion soup, Kobe tartare, and foie gras. Wine was very good (cotes du rhone) and ok (pinot). Really friendly staff and good prices ($18 for duo of foie and $10 for tartare).  Bar seating is the place to be
author: V N.

description:
If you love the brunch at Baker Street bistro, you will love the brunch at Bistro Central Parc. It's essentially the same brunch menu. 

If you are tired of long brunch lines, have no fear because it's pretty easy to get a table here. My favorite dish is the the French Toast. It's one of the best in the city and you really must try it. I'm also a big fan of the Benedicts here. 

Another plus if you like to do earlier brunches, Bistro Central Parc opens up at 9:00am.
author: Julianne W.

description: Came here to celebrate my son's 27th birthday. What a great idea! Restaurant is small enough that wait people were always passing by - and very attentive. The decor was fun. The Saumon Tartare starter was incredible. And, since we had birthday cake waiting at home, my son was handed a wrapped, Bistro Central Parc coffee mug as we left the  restaurant amid many good wishes. Wonderfully festive evening!
author: Julie H.

description:
I am so happy Bistro Central Parc has opened.  What a great addition to the neighborhood!

Tonight was my second time visiting and it was even better than the first.  I had the filet mignon and it was terrific.  The sauce was excellent, the meat cooked perfectly with au gratin potatoes rounding out the dish.  I'm prefer the filet over the New York strip I had on my first visit.
author: BH ..

description: We had the pleasure of enjoying a Valentine's Day Brunch and were sooo impressed. It's an intimate place, very fresh and casual in it's ambiance, typical understated french elegance. The food was superb. I loved the mussels and my husband had the steak...Merci beaucoup for Jacque and the team making us feel like we are part of this cozy neighborhood haunt. Looking forward to dinner there this Friday before we take in a concert in Oakland- love that we can stop by this great neighborhood bistro on our way out!
author: Amber O.

description: After reading all the great Yelp reviews, I was looking forward to trying this place.  I was disappointed.  I had the bouillabaisse, and it was the worst I've had in SF - the broth was flavorless and the fish was over-cooked, tough, and didn't taste fresh.  If you're in the mood for french, there are much better places in the city - I recommend chez papa or chez spencer.
author: April G.

description: Tired of the Divisadero scene, I was so excited to see this jewel show up on a quiet little corner two blocks from my apartment. I started off slow on a Wednesday night and ordered a delicious glass of wine to accompany the fantastic salmon with orange butter. It was unbelievable. At first, I was a bit weary of the portion size, as we Americans like things big and better and faster and lazier (sorry, soapbox), but it was perfect. I was full and every bite meant as much as the last. To make sure I wasn't hallucinating, I gave the restaurant another go three nights later. This time increasing my appetite to allow for the brie topped potato pancake, filet mignon with fois gras and marzipan ice cream. Every dish danced on my pallet with a soft finish on the desert. I will continue to frequent this place as I plan on trying everything on the menu.
author: phantomfemmmme p.

description: An incredible neighborhood restaurant with fantastic french food at an affordable price.  Meats, poultry, sea food, foir gras, wine, beer.  No matter what you're in the mood for, you've got to try this place. French owner is a nice guy who explains the menu.  Not snooty or uppity. A relaxed, lovely little place that is worth the walk or drive!  A must try!
author: theresa w.

description:
Actually I would do 3.5 stars but doesn't seem possible.

I've been here twice in the past month. I really wanted to love this place; we live in the neighborhood and have been pining for a local french restaurant ever since the Metro bistro on Divis changed hands a few years ago.

My main grouse is that the entrees, although very tasty and artfully presented, often do not include both vegetables and a starch, and so the entree to me ends up feeling unbalanced.  For instance, the rack of lamb is wonderfully flavored and comes with an excellent ratatouille. But no rice or starch to complement it. Or if you get the steak frites, it is just that: steak, and frites. No green beans or other veggie with it.

It does all seem expertly cooked, with modern presentation (i.e. carefully assembled tower of food on a large white plate with sauce artistically drizzled about).  The sorbet is house-made (I think) and delicious.

And I agree that the staff and owner are wonderfully friendly. I especially admire their friendliness to small children; we've seen babies and toddlers being very graciously accomodated.

But for the price, I would rather eat at RNM, where the entrees seem a bit more balanced to me, and where there is also a prix-fixe option.

All in all this is a good addition to the neighborhood. But I can't yet be a fan.
author: L. K.

description: this is an amazing place. amazing food and the most gracious kind staff. for a date, dinner, or any other event, this is the place to be!!!!!
author: Cecily B.

description: Favorite restaurant in SF. Hands down. Affordable, delicious, and luckily right next to my house!!!  A hidden gem.
author: Miranda J.

description: My family came to the bistro to celebrate my daughter's 30th Birthday.  We have dined there before and the food has been sublime.  My niece is a chef and was with us this time.  She was astounded at the quality and taste of every dish served.  The atmosphere is amazing.  Although small and simply appointed, it is the most warm and comfortable ambiance.  From the moment you walk in the door and are welcomed, you are made to feel you belong there. The service is attentive, but never rushed. The proprietor is a gem............warm and genial and looking out for all his guests. Again..............Kudos, Kudos, Kudos!
author: Sharon L.

description: this is my favorite restaurant for steak! the filet mignon rossini is amazing, and the potato and brie latke appetizer is also really good. I always get those two things and wine when i go there. it's romantic, dimly lit, and not too loud or too quiet. cost is usually about $140 when i go with another person, about 2 appetizers, 2 filet mignon rossini, 2 glasses of wine and a shared dessert (the strawberries with black pepper is very interesting and delicious). not a terrible price at all...definitely reccomend this place to everyone
author: rania o.

description: Well, I had high hopes after reading the reviews. Upon walking in, we  liked the decor and the people who work there and the neighborhood feel.  But honestly, I thought the food was bland, nothing special.   Not sure I'll go back, unless maybe for brunch.
author: Monica M.

description: thanks Jacques for the delish french cuisine in the hood! great atmopshere. amazing wait staff and haven't even mentioned the food. everything delictable. Come hungry and enjoy the great food. Just make sure you've got a reserve if you want to eat here.
author: Renee C.

description:
Best French food I've ever had! And I've been to France. I went here with my family for my mother's birthday and it was sooo delicious. Everyone who works here is French, from the amazingly hot bartender to our adorable and gorgeous waitress. The restaurant is small and intimate, with great decor and the prefect amount of low lighting. 
When we got there for our 7 o'clock reservation, there had somehow been a mix-up and they had our reservation for 8:30. It was totally fine, though because we sat at the bar for about ten minutes before a table was ready for us. 
My father and I got the French onion soup to start, and it was superb. Like lick the bowl delicious. My mother got the mixed greens salad which she, a salad lover, absolutely loved. My brother got the salmon tartar which he loved as well. When my meal came I was already bordering on full but it was so delicious I finished everything. I got the filet mignon and it was amazing. So good. My mother got the steak-frites which was great as well. My brother got the Cornish game hen and my father got some seafood soup that he loved. We also got desserts--the creme brulee and the chocolate volcano. Both amazing and so good I almost died. 
This is new new favorite impress somebody restaurant. I'm obsessed!! GO HERE!
author: Bethany D.

description: Perfect place for a date night.    Never have been a fan of French food till we ate here with friends.  Little on the heavy side, but way worth the calories!
author: shauna b.

description: Wow, the food is unbelievable from the beginning to end.  We ordered the Escargot and wild mushroom risotto to start and they were fantastic!  Simply delicious where every taste was very balanced and they showed a very nice presentation.  I also ordered the specials of the day which is the lamb sirloin.  I am a huge fan of lamb and the restaurant simply nailed it!  I will definitely give it a 5/5 on that dish.  Then the dinner ended with a dessert of tarte tatin.  It was also very delicious and recommended.  What really stood out was my friend's creme brulee as it was made to perfection.  I wished I had ordered that one but that just means I have to come back again soon for it!  This restaurant also have the friendliest waiters without a snubby attitude and the owner was very nice and approachable.  The atmosphere was modern, clean, crisp, and simple.  All in all, it made the experience even more enjoyable.  Thank you for the fantastic job well done!
author: Victor W.

description: Wonderful food, atmosphere and owners, but they really really need to hire a few more waitresses/waiters.
author: Neko R.

description: We finally went to Bistro Central Parc on Friday, Apr-8  for dinner.  We live in the Upper Haight, and enjoy supporting local businesses.  We read the very complimentary reviews and asked another couple to join us.  BCP did not disappoint.  The environment is inviting and unassuming.  Our meals -in taste and presentation- were terrific.  We will definitely be coming back.  -D & M
author: Dwight H.

description: i clearly like french food....i love going to french restaurants (when they are good) and bistro central parc was fabulous! a client recommended this sweet little neighborhood place to me and i'm sorry i've waited this long to go! our dinner was definitely five stars...the service five stars. a great hidden gem. i will be back!
author: Teri A.

description: I signed up for Yelp just to write a review for this great restaurant.  I read on Yelp and saw that this place got excellent reviews, so i had to check it out for myself.  We started the night off with a nice Cabernet Sauvignon and each had an order of their French Onion soup.  WOW!  This was amazing and tasted just like i had it in Paris in January.  Next, we had the escargots which were very good, but not as good as in Paris.  This was the only part of the meal that was slightly disappointing.  For the entree, i had the risotto with lobster sauce and scallops.  This was ridiculous!  The scallops were cooked to perfection and the lobster sauce and risotto were perfect.  My girlfriend had the ratatouille which she loved as well!  To finish the night off we shared the creme brulee which was phenomenal.  I highly, highly, recommend this place! Oh, the service was excellent as well and the owner made his way around the restaurant which made the experience very personal.  You must go here!
author: Ryan T.

description: I took my husband here for father's day brunch and we were both amazed by how incredible the food was for a neighborhood spot.  The coffee was sublime and my omelette was so good, I felt like I was in France. Wow! I can't wait to go there for dinner.  Jaques the owner introduced himself and was very friendly. I think we will become regulars.
author: C W.

description: My husband picked this restaurant after reading the reviews and we were not disappointed.  My husband loves foie gras, so he ordered the filet mignon w/ the foie gras.  It was amazing!  The sauce was very delicious!  I had the scallop risotto w/ lobster sauce and the scallop was cooked perfectly!  We also ordered the kobe beef tartar for appetizer which was also really good.  Everything tasted great!  The price was decent.
author: Karen V.

description: I loved it.  I live nearby and I'd seen it, and honestly thought, Oh, I thought it would look more European.  But once inside I felt that sophisticated family feel of a European restaurant.  Not stuffy.  Great food, a little loud.  It's a nice restaurant where you feel comfortable and can be yourself.  I therefore say, it's great to go with friends, but also on a date where you don't have to feel overwhelmed by the insipid silence, and get to know each other.
author: Rosemary G.

description: Excellent atmosphere, very nice bistro cuisine, friendly servers/owner.  We'll be going back soon.
author: Eddie K.

description: I'd give it less than five stars as I want to keep this place all to myself.    But the owners are SO lovely they deserve all the business they can get.
author: Siobhan L.

description: Jacques used to own Baker Street Bistro and this place is just as good, if not better.  It is so rare to have the owner greet you and ask if you have enjoyed your meal.  Kudos to Jacques, the food is great and he seems to actually care if you've had a good time.  I wish more restaurateurs were like him...
author: Fs A.

description: We had a 7:30 reservation on a Thursday night, but weren't seated until 8.  The owner kept apologizing, but didn't offer us anything while we waited.  The service was good and the food excellent for the most part, except for the NY steak which was inedible and w/o the sauce as mentioned on the menu  (and got brought home for the dog).   Prices are very reasonable given the quality.  I hope they can iron out some of these snafus--if they do it will be a 5-star place!
author: h f.

description:
just what the neighborhood needed! 
loved it so much for dinner we went back to try their breakfast the next day...

dinner is definitely where they shine but a great addition to the neighborhood
author: Joy Y.

description: My favorite place to eat. Kid friendly, people firndly, great food, good vegetarian choices..
author: anjali s.

description: Actually 4.5 stars - This is an update since we've been back for dinner a couple of times. Rack of lamb - savory, perfectly done, excellent. On another occasion (tonight) had the fillet in morel sauce. I was very happy, sauce was spectacular. All in all great food, reasonably priced and the friendly staff and owner (Jacques) make you feel very welcomed. Euro paced dining - some people may think it is too slow -but you are given space to eat, talk and chill.
author: E. Z.

description: this little neighborhood gem, tucked unassumingly away in a residential area, offers incredible bang for your buerre blanc buck. you'll be greeted by jacques, a typically amiable and sharp-witted frenchman.  delightful gallic classics then await you, but so does a noise level more suitable for the gare du nord than a cozy neighborhood bistro. never mind all of that, nor will you, once you taste what's on offer. i ordered a virtual tasting menu of starters-- onion soup, escargot, salmon tartare, steak tartare and, pommes frites, all of which were solid, save for the too-sour kobe steak tartare. but where this place really shined was the main courses. we had the scallop risotto and the eggplant lasagne. the risotto was artfully prepared, pure decadence. the scallops were cooked perfectly, that is, barely cooked at all. like pillows from heaven. the lasagne was a dreamscape of french pasta perfection, layer after layer of delicate deliciousness that must be tasted to be believed. as you can imagine, we didn't leave much room for dessert, so we skipped that. but we'll be back. oh, and (arguably) the best part? all that food, and three glasses of wine, were delightfully inexpensive... $112 for everything!
author: Brett W.

description: The food and the atmosphere are fantastic here.  Went with a party of six and we had a nice, leisurely dinner, and felt neither rushed nor neglected, something that's rare Stateside.  The food's reasonably priced compared to French bistros elsewhere in the city, with appetizers in the $8-$10 range and entrees for $18 (chicken) - $22 (lamb), and it's wonderful, classic French country food like Julia and Jacques used to make on your TV: boeuf bourguignon, confit de canard, tarte tatin.  The risotto au coquilles st. jacques is marvelous, and I usually give scallops a wide berth.  No longer--I'm a convert!  I'd love to have Bistro Central Parc in my neighborhood, but I'll have to settle for taking Muni there as frequently as possible.
author: V O.

description: Really love this amazing new local bistro. The food is superb french bistro food with simple ingrdients well combined. Staff and atmosphere are welcoming and very friendly. My wife and I love going here for late dinner and a glass of wine solo, and hitting the place for brunch with our 17 month old on the weekends. Dining at non-peak times is definitely kid friendly, and I believe there is even an early bird dinner option mon-thur. Definite thumbs up for this place.
author: Justin T.

description: We drove down from Healdsburg to try this place and we were not disappointed! In a nutshell, this place is better than most restaurants we have dined in IN FRANCE!  Really not kidding about this and we have travelled allot in France recently.  The escargot is amazing, not rubbery and the sauce was divine! I am coming back to try other things on the menu! The place is clean, trendy and casual.
author: Peggy M.

description: Friday, tired and bored at the office I happened to YELP for a french restaurant and saw the reviews with as many stars as my favorite french in SF. So decided to give it a try and got a reservation for 7pm.  Standing outside with my cousin debating about first going to bar because it was early for our reservation (fyi no bars around there and they only serve beer and wine), JACQUES came out to chat and greet us and because of his charming personality we decided to just go in early.  We sat at the bar instead of a table and were served by a really sweet and charming french student named Aurelie.  She was so entertaining, and funny, and gave us good food/wine advice.  Not just that, the rest of the staff acknowledged us too and said hi and asked how we were.  it's not just the food but it's the service that makes the evening, right?  Well they made my evening.  We shared the escargot which was ok.  I had the frisee salad and the filet - which was so buttery and the pepper sauce was so yummy.  I will definitely have it again.  Although part of me regrets not having the special tournedos with the fois gras on top.  I love fois gras.  My cousin had the brie potato thing (pardon me, I've just had a bottle of wine and I"m deliriously happy full) which he devoured and one of the specials: a steak with roquefort sauce.   He barely talked to me while he was eating I just heard, mmm.  One critique - the chocolate dessert needs the smallest scoop of vanilla ice cream for balance.  It's a very laid back relaxing place and now on my list of local favorite restaurants.  I'll definitely tell my friends, and be back very soon maybe with an after work group of co-workers.   Thanks, Jacques!  Thanks, Aurelie!    See you soon and thank you for a really great dinner.
author: marie s.
